nome: <entryFree id="n31130" type="greek" key="no^me_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nŏmē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">nomh/</foreign>, <sense id="n31130.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a corroding sore, eating ulcer</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nome intestina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:31:97" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 31, 8, 44, § 97</bibl></cit>.—Usu. in <number>plur.</number>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">nŏmae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:93" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 20, 9, 36, § 93</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cohibere nomas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:26:144" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 26, 14, 87, § 144</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:23:91" default="NO" valid="yes">23, 4, 46, § 91</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sanare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:30:115" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 30, 13, 39, § 115</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sistere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:151" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 24, 16, 94, § 151</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
nomen: <entryFree id="n31131" type="main" key="no_men"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nōmen</orth>, <itype>ĭnis</itype> (archaic form of <sense id="n31131.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">gen. sing.</hi> NOMINVS, S. C. de Bacch. Corp. Inscr. Lat. 196, 8), <gen>n.</gen> <etym>for gnōmen, from root gno, whence gnosco, nosco, co-gnosco</etym>, <hi rend="ital">a name, appellation</hi> (syn. vocabulum). </sense><sense id="n31131.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">nomen est, quod unicuique personae datur, quo suo quaeque proprio et certo vocabulo appellatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:24:134" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 1, 24, 134</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">imponere nova rebus nomina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:3:1:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 3, 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui haec rebus nomina posuerunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:5:10" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 3, 5, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">appellare aliquem nomine,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:56:239" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 56, 239</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">huic urbi nomen Epidamno inditum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:2:1:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 2, 1, 37</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 2, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Theophrastus divinitate loquendi nomen invenit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:19:62" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 19, 62</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lituus ab ejus litui, quo canitur, similitudine nomen invenit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:17:30" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 1, 17, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut is locus ex calamitate populi Romani nomen caperet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 13</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">ludi, Pythia de domitae serpentis nomine dicti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:447" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 447</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">clari nominis vir,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:34:4" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 34, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nominis minoris vir,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:100:5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 100, 5</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:112:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 112, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:103:1" default="NO">2, 103, 1</bibl>: est mihi nomen, inditur mihi nomen, with <hi rend="ital">nom.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cui saltationi Titius nomen est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:62:225" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 62, 225</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eique morbo nomen est avaritia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:11:24" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 4, 11, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">canibus pigris ... Nomen erit pardus, tigris, leo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:8:36" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 8, 36</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec sunt aedes, hic habet: Lesbonico'st nomen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:2:2:110" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 2, 2, 110</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">juventus nomen fecit Peniculo mihi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:1:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Men. 1, 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nam mihi est Auxilio nomen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:1:3:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cist. 1, 3, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">huic ego die nomen Trinummo facio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:4:2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Trin. 4, 2, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nomen Arcturo est mihi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:prol. 5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rud. prol. 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cantus cui nomen neniae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:24:62" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 2, 24, 62</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">puero ab inopiā nomen Egerio est inditum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">est illis strigibus nomen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:6:139" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 6, 139</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cujus nomen est Viventis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,001:25:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Gen. 25, 11</bibl></cit>.—Rarely with <hi rend="ital">ad</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut det nomen ad molas coloniam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:4:6:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 4, 6, 38</bibl></cit>.—Nomen dare, edere, profiteri, ad nomina respondere, <hi rend="ital">to give in one's name, be enrolled, enlist; to answer to one's name</hi> when summoned to military duty: <cit><quote lang="la">ne nomina darent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nomina profiteri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nominis edendi apud consules potestas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">virgis caesi, qui ad nomina non respondissent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 7, 4</bibl></cit>; also, <cit><quote lang="la">dare nomen in conjurationem,</quote> <trans><tr>to join the conspiracy</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:15:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 15, 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ab re nomen habet (terra),</quote> <trans><tr>is named for</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:18:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 38, 18, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae (sapientia) divinarum humanarumque rerum cognitione hoc nomen apud antiquos adsequebatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:3:7" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 3, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dea (Viriplaca) nomen hoc a placandis viris fertur adsecuta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:2:1:6" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 2, 1, 6</bibl></cit>.—Esp.: <cit><quote lang="la">nomen accipere = nominari: turris quae nomen ab insulā accepit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:112:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 112, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:3:13" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 3, 3, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:1:5:1" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 1, 5, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:6:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 6, 37</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">15, 74</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:2:10:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 2, 10, 8</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n31131.2" n="2" level="3"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">the middle name of the three which every freeborn Roman had</hi>, as distinguished from the praenomen and cognomen. The nomen distinguished one gens from another, the cognomen one familia from another, and the praenomen one member of the familia from another, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:3:27" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 7, 3, 27</bibl>.—But sometimes nomen is used in the signif. of praenomen: <cit><quote lang="la">id nomen (sc. Gaja),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:12:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mur. 12, 27</bibl></cit>.—So, too, in the signif. of cognomen: <cit><quote lang="la">Sex. Clodius, cui nomen est Phormio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:10:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Caecin. 10, 27</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">tamquam habeas tria nomina,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>as if you were a Roman</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:5:127" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 5, 127</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n31131.3" n="3" level="3"> Esp. in phrase: sub nomine, <hi rend="ital">under the</hi> assumed <hi rend="ital">name</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui litteras exitiales Demetrio sub nomine Flaminini adtulerant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:54:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 40, 54, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sub nomine meo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:2:24" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 7, 2, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">carmina sub alieno nomine edere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:55" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 55</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">multa vana sub nomine celebri vulgabantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:6:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 6, 12</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">13, 25</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 1, 5</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">rogatio repente sub unius tribuni nomine promulgatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:43:16:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 43, 16, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:29" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 29</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:50:5" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 50, 5</bibl>; cf. also II. B. infra.—</sense><sense id="n31131.4" n="4" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A title</hi> of power or honor: <cit><quote lang="la">imperatoris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:32:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 2, 32, 14</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n31131.5" n="5" level="3"> In gram., <hi rend="ital">a noun</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:4:18" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 4, 18</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:5" default="NO">1, 5</bibl>, <cb n="NOME" /> 42 et saep.—</sense><sense id="n31131.6" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n31131.7" n="1" level="3"> Nomen alicu jus deferre, <hi rend="ital">to bring an accusation against, to accuse</hi> a person: <cit><quote lang="la">nomen alicujus de parricidio deferre,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:10:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 10, 28</bibl></cit>: nomen recipere, <hi rend="ital">to receive the accusation</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">palam de sellā ac tribunali pronuntiat: si quis absentem Sthenium rei capitalis reum facere vellet, sese ejus nomen recepturum: et simul, ut nomen deferret, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:38:section=94" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 38, § 94</bibl></cit>; cf. context.—</sense><sense id="n31131.8" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A bond, note, a demand, claim, a debt</hi>: tituli debitorum nomina dicuntur praesertim in iis debitis, in quibus hominum nomina scripta sunt, quibus pecuniae commodatae sunt, Ascon. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:10:section=28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 10, § 28</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">repromittam istoc nomine solutam rem futuram,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:2:4:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 2, 4, 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si neque in tuas tabulas ullum nomen referres, cum tot tibi nominibus acceptum Curtii referrent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:39:section=102" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 39, § 102</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui tibi, ut ais, certis nominibus grandem pecuniam debuit,</quote> <trans><tr>on good bonds, good security</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Quint. 11, 38</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">egone hos digitos meos impellere potui, ut falsum perscriberent nomen?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,003:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Com. 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">volo persolvere, ut expungatur nomen, ne quid debeam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:1:3:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cist. 1, 3, 40</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">solvere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:6:2:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 6, 2, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">expedire, exsolvere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 16, 6, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nomina sua exigere,</quote> <trans><tr>to collect one's debts</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:10:section=28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 10, § 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc nomen, quod urget, nunc, cum petitur, dissolvere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:28:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Planc. 28, 68</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">transcribere in alium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:35:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 35, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui venit ad dubium grandi cum codice nomen,</quote> <trans><tr>comes with a huge ledger to sue for a doubtful debt</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:7:110" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 7, 110</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n31131.9" n="b" level="4"> Nomina facere, in the case of written obligations, <hi rend="ital">to set down</hi> or <hi rend="ital">book the items of debt in the account-book</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nomina se facturum, qua ego vellem die,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:23:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 7, 23, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">emit homo cupidus (Canius) tanti, quanti Pythius voluit et emit instructos: nomina facit (Pythius), negotium conficit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:14:59" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 3, 14, 59</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nomina facturi diligenter in patrimonium et vasa debitoris inquirimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 1:1:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 1, 1, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n31131.10" n="c" level="4"> Nomen locare, <hi rend="ital">to offer as surety</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:1:16:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 1, 16, 1</bibl> (dub.).—</sense><sense id="n31131.11" n="d" level="4"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">an item of debt;</hi> and hence, <hi rend="ital">a debtor</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc sum assecutus, ut bonum nomen existimer,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>a good payer</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:6:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 5, 6, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lenta nomina non mala,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 5:22:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 5, 22, 1</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:ib. 7:29:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 29, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:1:7:2" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 1, 7, 2</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n31131.12" n="3" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A family, race, stock, people, nation</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">C. Octavium in familiam nomenque adoptavit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:83" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 83</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Crispum C. Sallustius in nomen ascivit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 30</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:7:584" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 7, 584</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n31131.13" n="4" level="3"> With national names: nomen Romanum, <hi rend="ital">whatever is called Roman</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">the Roman dominion, nation, power;</hi> esp. <hi rend="ital">of the army</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">gens infestissuma nomini Romano,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 52:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 52, 24</bibl></cit>: CEIVIS ROMANVS NEVE NOMINVS LATINI NEVE SOCIVM QVISQVAM, etc., S. C. de Bacch.; so, <cit><quote lang="la">concitatis sociis et nomine Latino,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:19:31" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 19, 31</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">3, 29, 41</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ubi deletum omnibus videretur nomen Romanum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:6:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 23, 6, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">relicum Romani nominis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:55:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 22, 55, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:33:11" default="NO" valid="yes">27, 33, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:10:3" default="NO" valid="yes">1, 10, 3</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:7:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 9, 7, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Aeolio regnatas nomine terras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:14:70" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 14, 70</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Volscūm nomen prope deletum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:8:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 8, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nomen Atheniensium tueri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:5:6:9" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 5, 6, 9</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n31131.14" n="5" level="3"> <usg type="style">Poet.</usg> </sense><sense id="n31131.15" n="a" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">A thing</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">infaustum interluit Allia nomen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:717" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 717</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n31131.16" n="b" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">A person</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">popularia nomina Drusos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:6:759" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 6, 759</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:1:311" default="NO" valid="yes">1, 311</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec fidum femina nomen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:3:4:61" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 3, 4, 61</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in diversa trahunt unum duo nomina pectus,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>the love of a mother and sister</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:464" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 464</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:8:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 8, 30</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n31131.17" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n31131.18" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Name, fame, repute, reputation, renown</hi> (syn.: <cit><quote lang="la">existimatio, fama): hujus magnum nomen fuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:67:238" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 67, 238</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nomen habere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 69, 244</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">magnum in oratoribus nomen habere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:6:22" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 6, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">officere nomini alicujus, Liv. praef. § 3: et nos aliquod nomenque decusque Gessimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:89" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 89</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nomen gerere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 1, 20, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">4, 29, 15 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">multi Lydia nominis Romanā vigui clarior Iliā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:9:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 9, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nomen alicujus stringere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:2:350" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 2, 350</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">homines nonnullius in litteris nominis, Plin Ep. 7, 20, 3: parentes, quorum maximum nomen in civitatibus est suis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:22:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 22, 13</bibl></cit>.—Of <hi rend="ital">ill repute, bad reputation</hi>: malum nomen (only rare and late Lat.): magis eligendum in paupertate nomen bonum quam in divitiis nomen pessimum, Hier. Com. Ep. Tit., Paris, 1546, p. 104 H.—</sense><sense id="n31131.19" n="2" level="3"> Of inanimate things: <cit><quote lang="la">ne vinum nomen perdat,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec Baccho genus aut pomis sua nomina servat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:240" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 240</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n31131.20" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A title, pretext, pretence, color, excuse, account, sake, reason, authority, behalf</hi>, etc.: alio nomine et aliā de causā abstulisse. Cic. Rosc. Com. <pb n="1214" /> <cb n="NOMI" /> 14, 40: <cit><quote lang="la">legis agrariae simulatione atque nomine,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Agr. 2, 6, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">classis nomine pecuniam imperatam queruntur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fl. 12, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec a te peto amicitiae nostrae nomine,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fam. 12, 12, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 1, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nomine sceleris conjurationisque damnati,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 5, § 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nomine neglegentiae suspectum esse,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fam. 2, 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid exornamus philosophiam, aut quid ejus nomine gloriosi sumus?</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 2, 14, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui cum luxuriose viverent, non reprehenderentur eo nomine,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 2, 7, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gratias boni viri agebant et tuo nomine gratulabantur,</quote> <trans><tr>on your account</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Phil. 1, 12, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Antonio tuo nomine gratias egi,</quote> <trans><tr>on your behalf</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Att. 1, 16, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">legationes tuo nomine proficiscentes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fam. 3, 8, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quem quidem tibi etiam suo nomine commendo,</quote> <trans><tr>for his own sake</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 13, 21, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">meo nomine,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">feminarum suarum nomine,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bellum populo Romano suo nomine indixit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:2:6:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 2, 6, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">decretae eo nomine supplicationes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:14:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 14, 59</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">but: acceptā ex aerario pecuniā tuo nomine,</quote> <trans><tr>on your responsibility</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:1:3:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 1, 3, 7</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n31131.21" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A name</hi>, as opposed to the reality: <cit><quote lang="la">me nomen habere duarum legionum exilium (opp. exercitum habere tantum),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:5:15:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 5, 15, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Campani magis nomen ad praesidium sociorum, quam vires cum attulissent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nomen amicitia est, nomen inane fides,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:1:740" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 1, 740</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n31131.22" n="III" level="1"> In eccl. Lat., </sense><sense id="n31131.23" n="1" level="3"> Periphrastically: <cit><quote lang="la">invocavit nomen Domini,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,001:13:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Gen. 13, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnipotens nomen ejus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,002:15:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> Exod. 15, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">psallam nomini Domini,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,027:7:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> Psa. 7, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">blasphemare nomen ejus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,027:13:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> Apoc. 13, 6</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n31131.24" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Delegated power</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in nomine tuo daemones eicimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,001:7:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Matt. 7, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in quo nomine fecistis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,005:4:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> Act. 4, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">locuti sunt in nomine Domini,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> Jacob. 5, 10</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
nomenclatio: <entryFree id="n31132" type="main" key="no_mencla_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nōmenclātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>nomen-calo</etym>, <sense id="n31132.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a calling by name</hi> (very rare). </sense><sense id="n31132.1" n="I" level="1"> Of persons, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0478,001:Petit. Cons. 11:41" default="NO"><author>Q. Cic.</author> Petit. Cons. 11, 41</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n31132.2" n="II" level="1"> Of things: <cit><quote lang="la">vitium,</quote> <trans><tr>a list, catalogue</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:2:31" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 3, 2, 31</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
nomenclator: <entryFree id="n31133" type="main" key="no_mencla_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nōmenclātor</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">nōmencŭlātor</orth>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:10:30:23" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 10, 30, 23</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:19" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 19</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:41" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Calig. 41</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:34" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Claud. 34</bibl>), <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n31133.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who calls</hi> a person or thing <hi rend="ital">by name, a nomenclator;</hi> among the Romans, <hi rend="ital">a slave who attended his master in canvassing</hi> and on similar occasions, for the purpose of telling him the names of those he met in the street, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:4:1:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 4, 1, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:36:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mur. 36, 37</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nomenclatori memoriae loco audacia est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 1:3:10" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 1, 3, 10</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 19:11" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 19, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 6:33:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ben. 6, 33, 4</bibl>.—Under the emperors, <hi rend="ital">a slave who told his master the names of the other slaves</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">servorum causā nomenclator adhibendus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 33, 1, 6, § 26</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
nomenclatura: <entryFree id="n31134" type="main" key="no_mencla_tu_ra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nōmenclātūra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n31134.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a calling by name, a list of names, nomenclature</hi> (Plinian), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:H. N. 3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> H. N. 3</bibl> prooem. § 2; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 21, 9, 28, § 52</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
nomenculator: <entryFree id="n31135" type="main" key="no_mencu^la_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nōmencŭlātor</orth>, v. nomenclator.</entryFree>
nomentum:
<entryFree id="n31136" type="main" key="No_mentum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Nōmentum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n31136.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a city in the country of the Sabines</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Mentana</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 38</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:22" default="NO" valid="yes">4, 22</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:32" default="NO" valid="yes">32</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:773" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 773</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n31136.1" n="II" level="1"> Hence, </sense><sense id="n31136.2" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Nōmentānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj., of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Nomentum</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ager,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 14, 4, 5, § 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:13:119" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 13, 119</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">via,</quote> <trans><tr>the road leading from Rome to Nomentum</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 52</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Plur. subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Nōmentāni</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the Nomentans</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 5, 9, § 64</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n31136.3" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Nōmentānus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a Roman surname</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">L. Cassius Nomentanus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:1:102" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 1, 102</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">1, 8, 11</bibl> et saep.</sense>
‡† <orth extent="full" lang="la">nŏmĭmus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">no/mimos</foreign>, <sense id="n31136.4" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">lawful, legitimate</hi>, = legitimus: <cit><quote lang="la">PATER NOMIMVS,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 5059</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
nominalis: <entryFree id="n31137" type="main" key="no_mi^na_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nōmĭnālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>nomen</etym>, <sense id="n31137.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to a name, nominal</hi> (ante- and postclass.): <cit><quote lang="la">gentilitas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 8:section=4" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 8, § 4</bibl></cit> Müll.— </sense><sense id="n31137.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">nōmĭnālĭa</orth>, <itype>ĭum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the day on which a child received its name, the name-day</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Idol. 16</bibl>.—Hence, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">nōmĭnālĭter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">by name, expressly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">annuere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 2, 80</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
nominatim: <entryFree id="n31138" type="main" key="no_mi^na_tim"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nōmĭnātim</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>nomino</etym>, <sense id="n31138.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">by name, expressly, one by one, in detail</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">ibi ego dicam quidquid inerit nominatim,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:4:4:90" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 4, 4, 90</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem nominatim excipere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:11:7:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 11, 7, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non nominatim, sed generatim,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 11, 6, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quicquid esset in praedio vitii, id statuerunt, si venditor sciret, nisi nominatim dictum esset, praestari oportere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:16:65" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 3, 16, 65</bibl></cit>: fortissimum quemque nominatim evocare, Caes. <cb n="NOMI" /> B. C. 1, 39: <cit><quote lang="la">si quidem filius a patre exheredetur, nominatim exheredari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:Inst. 2:127" default="NO"><author>Gai.</author> Inst. 2, 127</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
nominatio: <entryFree id="n31139" type="main" key="no_mi^na_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nōmĭnātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>nomino</etym>, <sense id="n31139.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a naming</hi>. * </sense><sense id="n31139.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">consuetudo nominationum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:6:7:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 6, 7, 7</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n31139.2" n="II" level="1"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n31139.3" n="A" level="2"> In rhet. lang., <hi rend="ital">a figure of speech, whereby a thing which has no name, or an unsuitable one, receives an appropriate name</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 4, 31, 42</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n31139.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A nomination</hi> to an office (rare but class.): <cit><quote lang="la">paternum auguratus locum, in quem ego eum meā nominatione coöptabo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:13:5:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 13, 5, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nominatio in locum pontificis non est facta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 26, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">consulum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:6:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 6, 45</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
nominativus: <entryFree id="n31140" type="main" key="no_mi^na_ti_vus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nōmĭnātīvus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n31140.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to naming, nominative;</hi> in gram.: <cit><quote lang="la">casus nominativus,</quote> <trans><tr>the nominative case</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 10:section=23" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 10, § 23</bibl></cit> Müll.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:7:3" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 7, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:9:13" default="NO">7, 9, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:3:46" default="NO">8, 3, 46</bibl> et saep.</sense></entryFree>
nominator: <entryFree id="n31141" type="main" key="no_mi^na_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nōmĭnātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n31141.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a nominator</hi> (in jurid. Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">nominatores magistratuum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:27:8:1" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 27, 8, 1</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:27" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 27</bibl>, tit. 7.</sense></entryFree>
nominatorius: <entryFree id="n31142" type="main" key="no_mi^na_to_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nōmĭnātōrĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>nominator</etym>, <sense id="n31142.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to naming, naming, containing names</hi> (in jurid. Lat.): nominatorii breves, Cod. Th. 1, 10, 8; <cit><quote lang="la">11, 28, 3: pericula,</quote> <trans><tr>having a name, named</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Anim. 13</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
nominatus: <entryFree id="n31143" type="main" key="no_mi^na_tus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nōmĭnātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos>, from nomino.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n31144" type="main" key="no_mi^na_tus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nōmĭnātus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>nomino</etym>, <sense id="n31144.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a naming, a name;</hi> in gram., <hi rend="ital">a noun</hi> (perh. only in Varr.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 8:section=52" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 8, § 52</bibl> Müll.; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:ib" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl> § <cit><quote lang="la">63: quod ad nominatuum analogiam pertinet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:ib. 9:52" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 9, 52</bibl></cit>, § 95; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:ib. 10:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 10, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
nominito: <entryFree id="n31145" type="main" key="no_mi^ni^to"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nōmĭnĭto</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. freq. a.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n31145.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to name</hi> (ante- and post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">suscipere hunc motum, quem sensum nominitamus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:352" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 352</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:51" default="NO" valid="yes">4, 51</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:424" default="NO" valid="yes">6, 424</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Murat.</author> 1522, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
nomino: <entryFree id="n31146" type="main" key="no_mi^no"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nōmĭno</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>nomen</etym>, <sense id="n31146.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to call by name, to name, to give a name to</hi> (esp. <hi rend="ital">after, for</hi> a person or thing; cf.: appello, voco, dico). </sense><sense id="n31146.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen.: quae (navis) nunc nominatur nomine Argo, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 2, 22, 34, 26</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Chaldaei, non ex artis, sed ex gentis vocabulo nominati,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:1:2" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">urbem constituit, quam e suo nomine Romam jussit nominari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:7:12" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 2, 7, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amor ex quo amicitia est nominata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:chapter=8" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 8</bibl></cit> (Trag. v. 283 Vahl.); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:18:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Caecin. 18, 51</bibl>.—Esp., <hi rend="ital">to give a surname</hi> to a person, <bibl default="NO"><author>Eutr.</author> 8, 8</bibl>: aliquem honoris causā, <hi rend="ital">to name</hi> or <hi rend="ital">mention out of respect</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">L. Sulla, quem honoris causā nomino,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 2, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quem ego hominem honoris causā nominatum volo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:7:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 1, 7, 18</bibl></cit>; v. honor: hanc illi <foreign lang="greek">i)de/an</foreign> appellant, jam a Platone ita nominatam, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 1, 8, 30</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n31146.2" n="II" level="1"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n31146.3" n="A" level="2"> Pregn., <hi rend="ital">to render famous, renowned, celebrated</hi> (cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">laudo, celebro): praedicari de se et nominari volunt omnes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,016:11:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Arch. 11, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sunt clari hodieque et qui olim nominabuntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:94" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 1, 94</bibl></cit>; v. under <pos>P. a.</pos>—</sense><sense id="n31146.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To name</hi> or <hi rend="ital">nominate</hi> a person for an office: <cit><quote lang="la">patres interregem nominaverant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">me augurem Cn. Pompeius et Q. Hortensius nominaverunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 2, 2, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">illo die, quo sacerdotes solent nominare, quos dignissimos sacerdotio judicant, me semper nominabat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:2:1:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 2, 1, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:22" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 22</bibl>; cf. nominatio.—</sense><sense id="n31146.5" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To name, mention, report, accuse, arraign</hi> (not ante-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">capita conjurationis, priusquam nominarentur apud dictatorem, mors ab ipsis conscita judicio subtraxit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:26:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 26, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui nominatus profugisset, diem certam se finituros,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 39, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Dimnus, cum ceteros participes sceleris indicaret, Philotam non nominavit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:6:9:16" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 6, 9, 16</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:8:6:24" default="NO">8, 6, 24</bibl>.—Esp., with <hi rend="ital">inter, to name among</hi> or <hi rend="ital">as one of; to report as belonging to</hi> a party, conspiracy, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">inter conjuratos nemo me nominat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:6:10:5" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 6, 10, 5</bibl></cit>: inter socios Catilinae nominatus, Suet. Caés. 17; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">cum Thesea inter eos nomināsset. qui ad inferos adissent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:10:16:12" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 10, 16, 12</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:93" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 14, 13, 15, § 93</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:22:55" default="NO" valid="yes">22, 21, 27, § 55</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> in Ep. ad Galat. 5, 19</bibl> sqq.—</sense><sense id="n31146.6" n="D" level="2"> In gram.: nominandi casus, <hi rend="ital">the nominative case</hi> (like accusandi casus, the accusative case), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 8:section=42" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 8, § 42</bibl> Müll.; 9, § 76; 10, 2, § 23; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:13:22:5" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 13, 22, 5</bibl>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">nōmĭnātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos> (acc. to II. A.), <hi rend="ital">famed, renowned, celebrated</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">illa Attalica tota Sicilia nominata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:12:section=27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 12, § 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nominatiora pericula,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Anim. 13</bibl></cit>: <cb n="NON" /> bdellium nominatissimum, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:12:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 12, 9, 19, § 35</bibl> (al. laudatissimum); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,015:11:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 1 Par. 11, 10</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
nomio: <entryFree id="n31147" type="main" key="No^mi^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Nŏmĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n31147.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a hymn to Apollo</hi>, Paeanem aut Nomionem citarimus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:59:251" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 59, 251</bibl> B. and K.</sense></entryFree>
nomisma: <entryFree id="n31148" type="greek" key="no^misma"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nŏmisma</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">nŭm-</orth>), <itype>ătis</itype> (also <orth extent="full" lang="la">num-misma</orth>, Ven. Vit. S. Martin. 2, 338), <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">no/misma</foreign>, <sense id="n31148.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a piece of money, a coin</hi> (not ante-Aug.). </sense><sense id="n31148.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n31148.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">acceptos, regale nomisma, Philippos,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 1, 234</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">largae nomismata mensae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:12:62:11" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 12, 62, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">immensa nomismata,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ser. Samm.</author> 28, 525</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n31148.3" n="B" level="2"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">a coin</hi> not in circulation, <hi rend="ital">a medal</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:34:2:27" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 34, 2, 27 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nomismata aurea vel argentea vetera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:7:1:28" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 7, 1, 28</bibl></cit>.—Esp., <hi rend="ital">a medal</hi> or <hi rend="ital">token</hi> given to the knights at the door of the theatre, and entitling the bearer to be served with wine: <cit><quote lang="la">cum data sint equiti bis quina nomismata, quare bis deciens solus, Sextiliane, bibis?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:1:11:1 sq" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 1, 11, 1 sq.</bibl></cit>—* </sense><sense id="n31148.4" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a stamp, an image</hi> on a coin: en Caesar agnoscit suum Nomisma nummis inditum, Prud. <foreign lang="greek">stef</foreign>. 2, 95.</sense></entryFree>
nomius: <entryFree id="n31149" type="main" key="No^mi^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Nŏmĭus</orth> and <orth extent="full" lang="la">Nŏmĭos</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">Nŏ-mĭon</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*no/mios</foreign> and <foreign lang="greek">*nomi/wn</foreign>, <sense id="n31149.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the Pasturer</hi>, a surname of Apollo, because he tended the flocks of Admetus (cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 2</bibl>); acc. to <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:23:57" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 3, 23, 57</bibl>, it is from <foreign lang="greek">no/mos</foreign>, lex, and denotes the fourth Apollo: <cit><quote lang="la">Paeanem aut Nomionem citārimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:59:251" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 59, 251</bibl></cit> Klotz.—</sense><sense id="n31149.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A son of Apollo and of Cyrene, the daughter of Hypseus, king of Thessaly</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:13:7:7" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 13, 7, 7</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
nomos: <entryFree id="n31150" type="greek" key="no^mos"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nŏmos</orth> <itype>i</itype>, <sense id="n31150.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">m.</hi> (and nŏmus), = <foreign lang="greek">nomo/s</foreign>. </sense><sense id="n31150.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A district, province, nome</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Thebais dividitur in praefecturas oppidorum, quos nomos vocant, duodecim,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 9, 9, § 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">substituunt alios nomos, ut Heroopoliten,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:ib" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl></cit> § 50.—</sense><sense id="n31150.2" n="II" level="1"> In music, <hi rend="ital">a tune, air</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:20" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 20</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
non: <entryFree id="n31151" type="main" key="no_n"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nōn</orth> (old collat. forms <orth extent="full" lang="la">noenum</orth> and <orth extent="full" lang="la">noenu</orth>, cf. Lachm. ad Lucr. tom. 2, p. 149 sq.: <sense id="n31151.0" n="I" level="1"><cit><quote lang="la">noenum pro non Lucilius lib. XXX.: sed tamen hoc dicas, quid est, si noenu molestum'st. Varro Epistola ad Fusium: si hodie noenum venis, cras quidem, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 143, 33 sq.</bibl></cit>: noenum rumores ponebat ante salutem, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 6, 1</bibl>; Ann. v. 314 Vahl.; so, noenum sperando cupide rem prodere summam, Enn. ap. Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=229" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 229</bibl> Müll.; <cit><quote lang="la">Ann. v. 411 ib.: noenum mecastor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:1:1:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 1, 1, 28</bibl></cit>: noenu necesse'st, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:62:127" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 62, 127</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">Ann. v. 161 Vahl.: noenu potest,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:199" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 199</bibl></cit> Lachm. <hi rend="ital">N. cr.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">noenu queunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:712" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 4, 712</bibl></cit>), <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>contr. from neoenum, i. e. nec unum, not one, like ne hilum, not any thing (cf. Engl. not, i. q. naught, Angl.-Sax. naht, contr. from ne-aht); cf. Germ. nein</etym>, <hi rend="ital">not</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">hocine agis an non?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:1:2:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 1, 2, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non erat abundans, non inops tamen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:67:238" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 67, 238</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non est ita, judices, non est profecto,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fl. 22, 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum ipsi auxilium ferre, si cupiant, non queant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:5:9" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 5, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">1, 2, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">eam (fugam) si nunc sequor, quonam? Cum illo non,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:8:3:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 8, 3, 5</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n31151.1" n="(b)" level="5"> Non before negatives forms a weak affirmative, and before adverbs of emphatic assertion (as prorsus, omnino, etc.) a weak negative: <cit><quote lang="la">moveo nonnullis suspicionem, velle me navigare: quod tamen fortasse non nollem, si possem ad otium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:2:16:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 2, 16, 2</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">non nemo, non nihil, non nullus, v. h. vv: Res has non omnino quidem, sed magnam partem relinquere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:15:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 9, 15, 3</bibl></cit>: so, non prorsus, etc.—</sense><sense id="n31151.2" n="(g)" level="5"> After negatives it forms a strong affirmative, and after the adverbs above named a strong negative: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil non ad rationem dirigebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:37:140" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 37, 140</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">v. nemo, nihil, nullus: prorsus non arbitror,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:4:8" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 4, 4, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnino non dicere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:7:24" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 7, 24</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n31151.3" n="(d)" level="5"> But the negative force of non is not destroyed by a following <hi rend="ital">ne ... quidem</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">nec ... nec</hi>: non fugio ne hos quidem mores. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:90:section=210" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 90, § 210</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:42:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 28, 42, 16</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">non medius fidius prae lacrimis possum reliqua nec cogitare nec scribere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:9:12:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 9, 12, 1</bibl></cit>.—In a very few passages non is added to a negative to strengthen it (cf. Gr. <foreign lang="greek">ou) mh/</foreign>): <cit><quote lang="la">nolle successum non patribus, non consulibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:45:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 45, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:11:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 3, 11, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec sursum nec deorsum non cresco,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 58</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">horam eximere nullam ... non possumus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:6:3:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 6, 3, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:5:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 5, 18</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:4:4:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Curc. 4, 4, 23</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:4:13:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 4, 13, 8</bibl>.— (<foreign lang="greek">e</foreign>) Unus non = ne unus quidem: <cit><quote lang="la">unus enim vir Numantinus non fuit, qui in catenis duceretur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:2:18:17" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 2, 18, 17</bibl></cit>.—（<foreign lang="greek">z</foreign>) Per litoten, <pb n="1215" /> <cb n="NON" /> emphatic, <hi rend="ital">by no means, not at all, the reverse of</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">non ignobilis tragicus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:12:18" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 12, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non inimici mihi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:7:10:7" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 7, 10, 7</bibl></cit>; esp. with <hi rend="ital">sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Cethegus homo non probatissimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,047:5:3:40" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Par. 5, 3, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">homo non aptissimus ad jocandum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:17:47" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 2, 17, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non minime commoveri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:66:section=125" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 66, § 125</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tu me consiliario fortasse non imperitissimo usus esses,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:1:9:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 1, 9, 2</bibl></cit>.—（<foreign lang="greek">h</foreign>) Non quod, non quo, <hi rend="ital">not that, not as if</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">non quod sola ornent, sed quod excellant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:39:134" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 39, 134</bibl></cit>: me non sane movet res publica; <cit><quote lang="la">non quo sit mihi quidquam carius: sed, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:16:15:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 16, 15, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non quo sit servulus unus, idem quod familia, verum quia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:20:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Caecin. 20, 58</bibl></cit>.—（<foreign lang="greek">q</foreign>) Non nisi, <hi rend="ital">only</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">non nisi vicinas tutus arārit aquas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:3:12:36" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 3, 12, 36</bibl></cit>; v. nisi.—（<foreign lang="greek">i</foreign>) Non vero, <hi rend="ital">truly not</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">non vero tam isti quam tu ipse nugator,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:9:27" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Sen. 9, 27</bibl></cit>.—（<foreign lang="greek">k</foreign>) Non modo, non solum ... sed or sed etiam, <hi rend="ital">not only ... but also</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">non modo falsum illud esse, sed hoc verissimum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:44:70" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 2, 44, 70</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:15:54" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 15, 54</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">v. modo and solum.—Sometimes sed is omitted: nec solum apud Caecinam: Fabii quoque Valentis, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 27</bibl></cit>.—（<foreign lang="greek">l</foreign>) Non modo (solum) non ... sed or sed etiam, <hi rend="ital">not only not ... but even</hi>: sed ne ... quidem ... <hi rend="ital">but not even</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut non modo a mente non deserar, sed id ipsum doleam, me, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:3:15:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 3, 15, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc non modo non laudari, sed ne concedi quidem potest,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:3:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mur. 3, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tu id non modo non prohibebas, verum etiam approbabas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:16:7:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 16, 7, 3</bibl></cit>.—When the verb of the second clause is the common predicate of both clauses, the second non is omitted in the first clause: <cit><quote lang="la">talis vir non modo facere, sed ne cogitare quidem quidquam audebit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:19:77" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 3, 19, 77</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">assentatio, quae non modo amico, sed ne libero quidem digna est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:24:89" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 24, 89</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">advena non modo vicinae sed ne Italicae quidem stirpis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:40:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 40, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:24:4" default="NO" valid="yes">3, 24, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:20:2" default="NO" valid="yes">6, 20, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque solum inscientiam meam, sed ne rerum quidem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:46:203" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 46, 203</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod mihi non modo irasci, sed ne dolere quidem impune licet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:11:24:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 11, 24, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non mentibus solum consipere, sed ne auribus quidem satis constare poterant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:42:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 42, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:3:11" default="NO" valid="yes">4, 3, 11</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">so with sed vix in the second clause: haec genera virtutum non solum in moribus nostris, sed vix jam in libris reperiuntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:17:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cael. 17, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non modo ad expeditiones sed vix ad quietas stationes viribus sufficiebant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:6:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 6, 8</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">very rarely verum ne ... quidem, instead of sed ne ... quidem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:3:30:42" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 3, 30, 42</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:19:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 19, 54</bibl>; cf. Zumpt, Gram. § 724.—（<foreign lang="greek">m</foreign>) Non ita, non tam, <hi rend="ital">not so very, not particularly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">simulacra non ita antiqua,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:49:section=109" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 49, § 109</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non ita lato interjecto mari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:8:25" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 8, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non ita diu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:66:233" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 66, 233</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae nunc quidem non tam est in plerisque,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 15, 58</bibl></cit>.—So, non fere, <hi rend="ital">scarcely, hardly</hi> (v. fere): <cit><quote lang="la">non fere quisquam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:71:section=182" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 71, § 182</bibl></cit>.—（<foreign lang="greek">n</foreign>) Non si, <hi rend="ital">not even if</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">injussu tuo imperator, extra ordinem numquam pugnaverim, non si certam victoriam videam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 10</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 59:8" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 59, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:14:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 14, 5</bibl>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">followed by idcirco (ideo, eo, propterea, etc.): non si Opimium defendisti, idcirco te isti bonum civem putabunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:40:170" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 40, 170</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:9:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cael. 9, 21</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,042:16:60" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Top. 16, 60</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:45:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 45, 8</bibl>.—（<foreign lang="greek">c</foreign>) For nedum, <hi rend="ital">much less</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vix mehercule servis hoc eum suis, non vobis probaturum arbitrer,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:9:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Agr. 2, 9, 22</bibl></cit>.—（<foreign lang="greek">o</foreign>) In an interrogation for nonne: <cit><quote lang="la">quid haec amentia significat? non vim? non scelus? non latrocinium?</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Quint. 26, 82</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,003:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Com. 2, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:23:section=50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 23, § 50</bibl>.—（<foreign lang="greek">p</foreign>) For ne (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose, regarded by Quint. as a solecism): <cit><quote lang="la">qui tamen dicat pro illo Ne feceris, Non feceris, in idem incidat vitium, quia alterum negandi est, alterum vetandi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:5:50" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 5, 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vos quoque non caris aures onerate lapillis ... Munditiis capimur: non sint sine lege capilli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:3:129" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 3, 129</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:1:2:105" default="NO"><author>id.</author> P. 1, 2, 105</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">non Teucros agat in Rutulos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:78" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 78</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non etiam sileas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:5:91" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 5, 91</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non sit, qui tollere curat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:460" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. P. 460</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non ancilla tuum jecur ulceret ulla puerve,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 1, 18, 72</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non dubitaveris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 1:3:3" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 1, 3, 3</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">non credideris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0425,001:2:9" default="NO"><author>Rutil. Lup.</author> 2, 9</bibl></cit>.—（<foreign lang="greek">r</foreign>) With substantives coalescing to form one notion: <cit><quote lang="la">nec vero, aut quod efficeret aliquid, aut quod efficeretur, posse esse non corpus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 1, 11, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">etiam non orator,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:15:17" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 15, 17</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:1:22" default="NO">4, 1, 22</bibl>: <cb n="NONA" /> veri non dissimulator amoris, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 5, 61</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quasi servitute praedii non possessori relicta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:34:1:14" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 34, 1, 14 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non dominus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:43:15:7" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 43, 15, 7</bibl></cit>.—（<foreign lang="greek">s</foreign>) As an answer, <hi rend="ital">no</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aut etiam aut non respondere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 32, 104</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exhereditavitne (pater filium)? Non,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:19:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 19, 54</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:7:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 1, 7, 20</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 2, 30, 97</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:25:70" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 1, 25, 70</bibl>.—（<foreign lang="greek">t</foreign>) In questions, non expresses surprise, and doubt of the possibility of denial (v. Madv. Gram. § <cit><quote lang="la">451): non sum ego servus Amphitruonis Sosia?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:247" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 1, 247</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non tu scis, etc.?</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 2, 71</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec non turpe est dubitare philosophos, quae ne rustici quidem dubitant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:19:77" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 3, 19, 77</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:3:20:47" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 3, 20, 47</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Quid? aviam tuam pater tuus non manifesto necavit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:14:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clu. 14, 40</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
nona: <entryFree id="n31152" type="main" key="no_na1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nōna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, v. nonus.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n31153" type="main" key="No_na2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Nōna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*nw=na</foreign>, <sense id="n31153.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one of the three Fates</hi>: Tria nomina Parcarum sunt, Nona, Decuma, Morta, Caes. Vindex ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:3:16:11" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 3, 16, 11</bibl>; Varr. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:3:16:10" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 3, 16, 10</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
nonacris: <entryFree id="n31154" type="main" key="No_na_cris"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Nōnācris</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*nw/nakris</foreign>, <sense id="n31154.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a mountain in Arcadia, at the foot of which lay a city of the same name, and in which the Styx had its source</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:8:3:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 8, 3, 16</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:131" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 103, 106, § 131</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:21" default="NO" valid="yes">4, 6, 10, § 21</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n31154.1" n="II" level="1"> Hence, </sense><sense id="n31154.2" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Nōnācrīnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj., Nonacrian</hi>, <usg type="style">poet.</usg> for <hi rend="ital">Arcadian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">virgo Nonacrina,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Callisto</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:409" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 409</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Atalanta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:2:185" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. A. 2, 185</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n31154.3" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Nōnācrĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj., Nonacrian</hi>, <usg type="style">poet.</usg> for <hi rend="ital">Arcadian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">heros,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Evander</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:5:97" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 5, 97</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Nōnā-cria</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> </sense><sense id="n31154.4" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Atalanta</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:426" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 426</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n31154.5" n="2" level="3"> (Sc. urbs.) <hi rend="ital">The city of Nonacris</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 3:25:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 3, 25, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
nonae: <entryFree id="n31155" type="main" key="No_nae"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Nōnae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>nonus</etym>, <sense id="n31155.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the fifth day in every month of the year, except March, May, July, and October, in which it was the seventh; the nones</hi>, so called because it was the ninth day before the ides, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 6:section=28" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 6, § 28</bibl> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">o Nonae illae Decembres,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fl. 40, 102</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Nonis Februariis si Romae fuit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Quint. 18, 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">a. d. tertium Non. Januar. si agere coepisset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:2:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 5, 2, 8</bibl></cit>. After the expulsion of the kings, the marketdays were no longer allowed to fall on the nones, because the people celebrated the nones as the birthday of Servius Tullius, and fear was entertained of a movement on that day in favor of royalty, <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 1, 13</bibl>. No wedding took place either on the nones or on the ides, because the following day was a dies ater, unfavorable for the offering to be made by the bride, <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 16</bibl>. Augustus, for superstitious reasons, avoided undertaking any thing on the nones, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:92" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 92</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
nonagenarius: <entryFree id="n31156" type="main" key="no_na_ge_na_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nōnāgēnārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>nonageni</etym>, <sense id="n31156.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that contains</hi> or <hi rend="ital">consists of ninety</hi>. </sense><sense id="n31156.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">nonagenarius motus stellae Martis,</quote> <trans><tr>ninety degrees distant from the sun</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 15, 12, § 60</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fistula,</quote> <trans><tr>made of a sheet of lead ninety inches wide</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Aquaed. 60" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Aquaed. 60</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n31156.2" n="II" level="1"> In partic., as <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">nōnā-gēnārĭus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a commander of ninety men</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 3628</bibl>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> Mil. 2, 8</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n31156.3" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Ninety years old</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,001:17:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Gen. 17, 17</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
nonageni: <entryFree id="n31157" type="main" key="no_na_ge_ni"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nōnāgēni</orth>, <itype>ae, a</itype> (<sense id="n31157.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">gen. pl.</hi> nonagenūm, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Aquaed. 61" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Aquaed. 61</bibl>), <hi rend="ital">adj. distr</hi>. [nonaginta], <hi rend="ital">ninety each</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">porticus ascenduntur nonagenis gradibus omnes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:88" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 13, 19, § 88</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
nonagesimus: <entryFree id="n31158" type="main" key="no_na_ge_si^mus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nōnāgēsĭmus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <sense id="n31158.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adj. ord.</hi> [id.], <hi rend="ital">the ninetieth</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Isocrates quarto et nonagesimo anno scripsisse dicitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:5:13" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Sen. 5, 13</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
nonagessis: <entryFree id="n31159" type="main" key="no_na_gessis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nōnāgessis</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>nonaginta-as</etym>, <sense id="n31159.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a sum of ninety asses</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> 1356</bibl> P.; Beda de Num. tom. 1, p. 101.</sense></entryFree>
nonagies: <entryFree id="n31160" type="main" key="no_na_gi^es"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nōnāgĭes</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">-gĭens</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n31160.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">ninety times</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nonagies sestertium,</quote> <trans><tr>ninety times a hundred thousand sesterces</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:70:section=163" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 70, § 163</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
nonaginta: <entryFree id="n31161" type="main" key="no_na_ginta_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nōnāgintā</orth>, <sense id="n31161.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">num. adj., ninety</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nonaginta annos natus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:10:34" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Sen. 10, 34</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Ep. 5, 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
nonalis: <entryFree id="n31162" type="main" key="No_na_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Nōnālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>Nonae</etym>, <sense id="n31162.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the nones</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Nonalia sacra,</quote> <trans><tr>offerings made at the Capitol on the nones</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 6:section=28" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 6, § 28</bibl></cit> Müll.</sense></entryFree>
