nonanus: <entryFree id="n31163" type="main" key="no_na_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nōnānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>nona, sc. legio</etym>, <sense id="n31163.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the ninth legion</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">miles nonanus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 23</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">nōnānus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a soldier of the ninth legion</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 30</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">14, 38</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
nonarius: <entryFree id="n31164" type="main" key="no_na_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nōnārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>nonus</etym>, <sense id="n31164.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the ninth hour</hi>.—As <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">nonaria</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> (sc. meretrix), <hi rend="ital">a public</hi> <cb n="NONN" /> <hi rend="ital">prostitute</hi> (so called because not allowed to <hi rend="ital">show herself</hi> before the ninth hour of the day), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:1:133" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 1, 133</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
nondum: <entryFree id="n31165" type="main" key="nondum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">non-dum</orth>, <sense id="n31165.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adv., not yet</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nondum sex menses,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:1:3:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 1, 3, 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nondum centum et decem anni sunt, cum, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:21:75" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 2, 21, 75</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nondum Voconiā lege latā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:3:10:17" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 3, 10, 17</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:6:16" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 2, 6, 16</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nondum Ilium et arces Pergameae steterant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:109 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 109 al.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si nondum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:7:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 7, 17</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
noneolae: <entryFree id="n31166" type="gloss" key="noneolae"><orth extent="full" lang="la">noneolae</orth> <itype>vocantur papillae, quae ex faucibus caprarum suppendent</itype>, Paul. ex Fest. pp. 174 and 175 Müll.</entryFree>
nongenarius: <entryFree id="n31167" type="main" key="nonge_na_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nongēnārĭus</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">nōningentēnā-rĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>nongeni, nongenti</etym>, <sense id="n31167.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">containing nine hundred</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> 1355</bibl> P.</sense></entryFree>
nongeni: <entryFree id="n31168" type="main" key="nonge_ni"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nongēni</orth>, <orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">nongentēni</orth>, <itype>ae, a</itype>, <sense id="n31168.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">num. adj. distr</hi>. [nongenti], <hi rend="ital">nine hundred each</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> 1353</bibl> P.</sense></entryFree>
nongentesimus: <entryFree id="n31169" type="main" key="nongente_si^mus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nongentēsĭmus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. noningentesimus.</entryFree>
nongenti: <entryFree id="n31170" type="main" key="nongenti"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nongenti</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">nōningenti</orth>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:5:2:7" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 5, 2, 7</bibl>), ae, a, <sense id="n31170.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adj. card., nine hundred</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ab uno ad nongenta ... a mille ad nongenta milia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:49" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Falcidius emerat HS. nongentis milibus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fl. 37, 91</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n31170.1" n="II" level="1"> In <number>sing.</number>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">nongentus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">one of nine hundred inspectors of the ballot-boxes</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">praeter hos etiamnum nongenti vocabantur ex omnibus electi ad custodiendas suffragiorum cistas ... cum alius se nongentum, alius selectum appellaret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 33, 1, 7, § 31</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
nongenties: <entryFree id="n31171" type="main" key="nongenti^es"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nongentĭes</orth>, v. noningenties.</entryFree>
nongentus: <entryFree id="n31172" type="main" key="nongentus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nongentus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, v. nongenti.</entryFree>
nongesimus: <entryFree id="n31173" type="main" key="nonge_si^mus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nongēsĭmus</orth>, v. nonigesimus.</entryFree>
nonies: <entryFree id="n31174" type="gloss" key="no_ni^es"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nōnĭes</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>nonus</etym>, <sense id="n31174.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">nine times</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quinquies, sexies, septies, octies, nonies, decies,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Not. Tir.</author> p. 100</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Murat.</author> 451, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
nonigesimus: <entryFree id="n31175" type="greek" key="no_ni^ge_si^mus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nōnĭgēsĭmus</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">nongēsĭmus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <sense id="n31175.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adj. ord.</hi>, for noningentesimus, <hi rend="ital">the nine hundredth</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> de Pond. p. 1353</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
noningentesimus: <entryFree id="n31176" type="main" key="no_ningente_si^mus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nōningentēsĭmus</orth> (or <orth extent="full" lang="la">nongentē-sĭmus</orth>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Caes. 15:4" default="NO"><author>Aur. Vict.</author> Caes. 15, 4</bibl>), a, um, <sense id="n31176.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adj. ord., the nine hundredth</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> de Pond p. 1353</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
noningenti: <entryFree id="n31177" type="main" key="no_ningenti"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nōningenti</orth>, v. nongenti.</entryFree>
noningenties: <entryFree id="n31178" type="main" key="no_ningenti^es"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nōningentĭes</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">-tĭens</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">nōn-gentĭes</orth>), <sense id="n31178.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">nine hundred times</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">noningenties trigesies septies mille,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:1:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 1, 6</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
nonius: <entryFree id="n31179" type="main" key="No_ni^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Nōnĭus</orth>, <itype>a</itype>, <sense id="n31179.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the name of a Roman</hi> gens. So M. Nonius Suffenas, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:6:1:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 6, 1, 13</bibl>.— Nonius Marcellus, <hi rend="ital">a Roman grammarian, whose treatise</hi> De Proprietate Sermonis <hi rend="ital">is extant in a very mutilated form</hi>.</sense></entryFree>
nonna: <entryFree id="n31180" type="main" key="nonna"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nonna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, v. nonnus.</entryFree>
nonne: <entryFree id="n31181" type="main" key="nonne^"><orth extent="full" lang="la">non-nĕ</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, the interrogative non, expecting an affirmative answer, <sense id="n31181.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">not?</hi> </sense><sense id="n31181.1" n="(a)" level="5"> In a direct interrogation: <cit><quote lang="la">nonne ego hic sto?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:250" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 1, 250</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nonne animadvertis?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:37:89" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 3, 37, 89</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">te dejectum debeo intellegere, etiamsi tactus non fueris: nonne?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:13:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Caecin. 13, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid paulo ante dixerim, nonne meministi?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:3:10" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 2, 3, 10</bibl></cit> Madv. <hi rend="ital">N. cr.;</hi> cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 28, 86</bibl>.—Very rarely repeated: <cit><quote lang="la">nonne extremam pati fortunam paratos projecit ille? nonne sibi clam ...? nonne, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:32:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 2, 32, 8</bibl></cit>. But usually followed by non in continued questions: <cit><quote lang="la">nonne vobis haec quae audīstis oculis cernere videmini? non illum ... videtis? non positas insidias? non, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:35:98" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 35, 98</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,015:2:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sull. 2, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:1:11:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 1, 11, 27</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n31181.2" n="(b)" level="5"> In an indirect interrogation, <hi rend="ital">if not, whether not</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum esset ex eo quaesitum, Archelaum Perdiccae filium nonne beatum putaret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:12:34" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 12, 34</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
nonnemo: <entryFree id="n31182" type="main" key="nonne_mo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">non-nēmo</orth>, <itype>or better separately</itype>, <orth extent="full" lang="la">non nēmo</orth>, <itype>ĭnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <sense id="n31182.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Some, several, many a one</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:39:84" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mur. 39, 84</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:5:10 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pis. 5, 10 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n31182.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Some one, a certain person</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:4:5:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 4, 5, 10</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
nonnihil: <entryFree id="n31183" type="main" key="nonni^hil"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nonnĭhil</orth>, v. nihil.</entryFree>
nonnisi: <entryFree id="n31184" type="main" key="nonni^si"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nonnĭsi</orth>, v. non and nisi.</entryFree>
nonnullus: <entryFree id="n31185" type="main" key="nonnullus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">non-nullus</orth> (or written separately, <orth extent="full" lang="la">non nullus</orth>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:725" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 725</bibl>), a, um, <sense id="n31185.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adj., some, several</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">non nullumst periculum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:1:1:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 1, 1, 23</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:2:1:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 2, 1, 68</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">esse nonnullo se Caesaris beneficio affectum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:37:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 37, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nonnulla pars militum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:13:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 1, 13, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">frumenti copiam nonnullam habere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 78, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non nulli amici,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:20:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mur. 20, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non nulla communia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 2, 22, 70</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nonnullae cohortes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 24</bibl></cit>.— <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">nonnulli</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> (sc. milites), <hi rend="ital">some, several</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 26</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
nonnumquam: <entryFree id="n31186" type="main" key="nonnumquam"><orth extent="full" lang="la">non-numquam</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">-nunquam</orth>, <sense id="n31186.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adv., sometimes;</hi> opp. numquam, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,023:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Vatin. 2, 5</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">with aliquando,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:8:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 5, 8, 2</bibl></cit>: nonnumquam<pb n="1216" /> <cb n="NORM" />  interdiu, saepius noctu, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 8 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
nonnus: <entryFree id="n31187" type="main" key="nonnus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nonnus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">nonna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <sense id="n31187.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A monk; a nun</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Ep. 117</bibl>, n. 6; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 22</bibl>, n. 16.—</sense><sense id="n31187.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A tutor</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 4670</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
nonnusquam: <entryFree id="n31188" type="main" key="nonnusquam"><orth extent="full" lang="la">non-nusquam</orth>, <sense id="n31188.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adv., in some places</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:120" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 14, 19, 24, § 120</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">silices quibusdam in locis rubentes, nonnusquam vero et albi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:168" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 36, 22, 49, § 168</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:13:24:31" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 13, 24, 31</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
nono: <entryFree id="n31189" type="main" key="no_no_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nōnō</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. nonus <sense id="n31189.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
nonuncium: <entryFree id="n31190" type="gloss" key="no_nunci^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nōnuncĭum</orth> <itype>et sescunciam quod magistri ludi appellant, significat dodrantem et dimidium teruncium, quod singula sescuncia uncia et dimidium sit</itype>, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=173" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 173</bibl> Müll.</entryFree>
nonus: <entryFree id="n31191" type="main" key="no_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nōnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <sense id="n31191.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adj. ord.</hi> [for novenus, from novem], <hi rend="ital">the ninth</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">terra nona,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:6:18:18" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 6, 18, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">accedes opera agro nona Sabino,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:7:118" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 7, 118</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n31191.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">nōna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> </sense><sense id="n31191.2" n="A" level="2"> (Sc. hora.) <hi rend="ital">The ninth hour of the day</hi>, i. e. the third before sunset, at which hour business was ended at Rome: <cit><quote lang="la">post nonam venies,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 7, 71</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:4:8:5" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 4, 8, 5</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n31191.3" n="B" level="2"> (Sc. pars.) <hi rend="ital">The ninth part</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nonas praedae vovere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:20:3:3" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 20, 3, 3</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">nōnō</orth>, <hi rend="ital">ninthly</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> de Anim. 12</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
nonusdecimus: <entryFree id="n31192" type="main" key="no_nusde^ci^mus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nōnus-dĕcĭmus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <sense id="n31192.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adj. ord., the nineteenth</hi> (the class. undevicesimus): <cit><quote lang="la">nonodecimo aetatis anno,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:13:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 13, 16</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 34 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Grut.</author> 449, 7</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
nonussis: <entryFree id="n31193" type="hapax" key="no_nussis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nōnussis</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>novem-as</etym>, <sense id="n31193.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">nine asses</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=169" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 169</bibl> Müll.</sense></entryFree>
nora: <entryFree id="n31194" type="main" key="No_ra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Nōra</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*nw=ra</foreign>. <sense id="n31194.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A hill-fort between Lycaonia and Cappadocia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,018:5:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Eum. 5, 3</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n31194.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A very ancient city in Sardinia</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Nori</hi>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n31194.2" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Nōrensis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj., of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Nora</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,029:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Scaur. 1, 4</bibl>, c.—In <number>plur.</number>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Nōrenses</orth>, <itype>ĭum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of Nora</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,029:2:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Scaur. 2, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:85" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 7, 13, § 85</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n31194.3" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A city of India</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:8:11:1" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 8, 11, 1</bibl>; v. Mütz, ad h. l.</sense></entryFree>
norba: <entryFree id="n31195" type="main" key="Norba"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Norba</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n31195.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a city of Latium</hi>, now called <hi rend="ital">Norma</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 34</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n31195.1" n="II" level="1"> Hence, </sense><sense id="n31195.2" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Norbānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj., of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Norba, Norban</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ager,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 19</bibl></cit>.—In <number>plur.</number>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Norbāni</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the Norbans</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:10" default="NO" valid="yes">27, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 5, 9, § 64</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n31195.3" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Norbānus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a Roman surname in the</hi> gens Vibia: <cit><quote lang="la">C. Norbanus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:21:89" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 21, 89</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
noreia: <entryFree id="n31196" type="main" key="No^re_ia"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Nŏrēïa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n31196.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a town in Noricum</hi>, now prob. <hi rend="ital">Neumarkt</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:131" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 19, 23, § 131</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
norensis: <entryFree id="n31197" type="main" key="No_rensis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Nōrensis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, v. Nora, II. B.</entryFree>
noricum: <entryFree id="n31198" type="main" key="No_ri^cum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Nōrĭcum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n31198.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a country lying between the Danube and the Alps</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 70</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n31198.1" n="II" level="1"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Nōrĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj., of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Noricum, Norican</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ager,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">provincia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 63</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ferrum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:145" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 34, 14, 41, § 145</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:712" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 14, 712</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ensis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:17:71" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 17, 71</bibl></cit>.—In <hi rend="ital">plur. subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Nōrĭci</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the Noricans</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:146" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 24, 27, § 146</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
norma: <entryFree id="n31199" type="main" key="norma"><orth extent="full" lang="la">norma</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>for gnorima (cf. Gr. <foreign lang="greek">gnw/rimos</foreign>); root, gno-; cf. gnarus, nosco</etym>, <sense id="n31199.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a square</hi>, employed by carpenters, masons, etc., for making right angles (cf. regula). </sense><sense id="n31199.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">anguli ad normam respondentes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:7:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 7, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:9:2" default="NO" valid="yes">9, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:172" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 22, 51, § 172</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n31199.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a rule, pattern, precept</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec sunt haec rhythmicorum aut musicorum acerrima norma dirigenda,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:49:190" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 49, 190</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitam ad certam rationis normam dirigere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mur. 2, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">numquam ego dicam Fabricium, Curtium, Coruncanium ad istorum (Stoicorum) normam fuisse sapientes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:5:18" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 5, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hanc normam, hanc regulam, hanc praescriptionem esse naturae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 2, 46, 140</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">natura norma legis est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:24:61" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 2, 24, 61</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">juris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:42:178" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 42, 178</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">loquendi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 72</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">norma et regula oratoris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:9:26:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 9, 26, 8</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
normalis: <entryFree id="n31200" type="main" key="norma_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">normālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>norma</etym>, <sense id="n31200.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">made according to the square</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">normalis angulus,</quote> <trans><tr>a right angle</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:141" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 141</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">virgula,</quote> <trans><tr>a square</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Manil.</author> 2, 289</bibl></cit>: rigores, Aggen. ap. Comm. in Frontin. p. 53 Goes.—Hence, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">normālĭter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">according to the square</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:de Limit. p. 168" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> de Limit. p. 168</bibl> and 176 Goes. —</sense><sense id="n31200.1" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">In a straight line, directly</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 20, 3, 11</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
normatio: <entryFree id="n31201" type="hapax" key="norma_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">normātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n31201.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a fashioning</hi> or <hi rend="ital">adjusting according to the square</hi>, Auct. de Limit. p. 217 Goes.</sense></entryFree>
normatura: <entryFree id="n31202" type="main" key="norma_tu_ra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">normātūra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n31202.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a fashioning</hi> or <hi rend="ital">adjusting according to the square</hi>, Innocent. de Cas. <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> p. 221 Goes. <cb n="NOSC" /></sense></entryFree>
normatus: <entryFree id="n31203" type="hapax" key="norma_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">normātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype> <etym>norma</etym>, <sense id="n31203.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adjusted according to the square</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">normatus ad perpendiculum,</quote> <trans><tr>rectangular</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:13:12" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 3, 13, 12</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
normo: <entryFree id="n31204" type="main" key="normo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">normo</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n31204.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to square, to set by the square</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">basis ad perpendiculum normata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:13:12" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 3, 13, 12</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
normula: <entryFree id="n31205" type="gloss" key="normu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">normŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n31205.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a small square</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">norma, normula,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Not. Tir.</author> p. 119</bibl></cit>; Bretto, 2 Geometr. p. 1216.</sense></entryFree>
nortia: <entryFree id="n31206" type="main" key="Norti^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Nortĭa</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">Nurtĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n31206.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a goddess of the Volsinii</hi>, prob. <hi rend="ital">Fortuna</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quam alii Sortem asserunt, Nemesimque nonnulli, Tychenque quam plures, aut Nortiam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 1, § 88</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in templo Nortiae Etruscae Deae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:3:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 3, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si Nortia Tusco Favisset,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Sejanus</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:10:74" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 10, 74</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Apol. 24</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
nos: <entryFree id="n31207" type="main" key="no_s"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nōs</orth>, <itype>nostrum</itype>, etc., the <number>plur.</number> of ego, q. v. (<sense id="n31207.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">gen.</hi> nostrōrum and nostrārum, for nostrum: <cit><quote lang="la">nemo nostrorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:4:2:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 4, 2, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nostrarum quisquam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:4:4:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 4, 4, 11</bibl></cit>) [cf. Sanscr. nāu; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">nw=i+</foreign>], <hi rend="ital">we</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nos, nos, dico aperte, consules desumus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:1:1:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 1, 1, 5</bibl></cit>.—It is frequently used instead of ego: <cit><quote lang="la">nos ... habemus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:1:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 1, 1, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:1:15" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 1, 15</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nos patriam fugimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 1, 4</bibl></cit>.— Instead of the <hi rend="ital">gen. poss.</hi> noster is commonly used. But: <cit><quote lang="la">impedis et ais "habe meam rationem." Habe nostrum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:7:9:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 7, 9, 4</bibl></cit>.— <cit><quote lang="la">So, freq. with omnium: communis nostrum omnium patria,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fl. 2, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">communem omnium nostrum condicionem miserari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:27:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mur. 27, 55</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praesens omnium nostrum fortuna,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:38:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 25, 38, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:43:18" default="NO" valid="yes">21, 43, 18</bibl>.—The <hi rend="ital">gen. obj.</hi> is usually nostri, rarely nostrum: <cit><quote lang="la">nil nostri miserere?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:2:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 2, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">memoria nostri tua,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:12:17:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 12, 17, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amor nostri,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 12, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nostri cupidine captus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:762" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 762</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vale, nostri memor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:3:318" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 3, 318</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Gen. part.</hi> nearly always nostrum: <cit><quote lang="la">quem enim nostrum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:12:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 5, 12, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">domus utriusque nostrum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:2:4:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 2, 4, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Fabio amantissimo utriusque nostrum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:8:12:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 8, 12, 1</bibl></cit>. —<hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi> with <hi rend="ital">sing. predic.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">absente nobis for absente me,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:4:3:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 4, 3, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nobis merenti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:3:6:55" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 3, 6, 55</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">insperanti nobis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, 107, 5 sq.</bibl></cit>—It often takes the suffix <hi rend="ital">-met</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:3:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 3, 67</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 10, 56</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
noscentia: <entryFree id="n31208" type="main" key="noscenti^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">noscentĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>nosco</etym>, <sense id="n31208.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">knowledge</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Ep. 4:9" default="NO"><author>Symm.</author> Ep. 4, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:6:11" default="NO">6, 11</bibl> dub. (al. notitia).</sense></entryFree>
noscibilis: <entryFree id="n31209" type="main" key="nosci^bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">noscĭbĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n31209.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">knowable</hi> (eccl. Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> ad Scapul. 2 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Trin. 9:5:12" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Trin. 9, 5, 12</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
noscitabundus: <entryFree id="n31210" type="hapax" key="nosci^ta_bundus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">noscĭtābundus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <sense id="n31210.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adj., knowing, recognizing</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:5:14:11" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 5, 14, 11</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
noscito: <entryFree id="n31211" type="main" key="nosci^to"><orth extent="full" lang="la">noscĭto</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. freq. a.</pos> <etym>nosco</etym>, <sense id="n31211.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to know, to recognize</hi> (not in Cic. or Cæs.). </sense><sense id="n31211.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">noscito hanc, nam videor, nescio ubi, me vidisse prius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:4:1:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ep. 4, 1, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem facie,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">noscitabatur tamen in tantā deformitate,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:23:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 23, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praefectos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:3:11:10" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 3, 11, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ducem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem vocibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:6:20:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 6, 20, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">facile inscieis noscitetur ab omnibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:61:219" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 61, 219</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n31211.2" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To perceive, observe</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">haut est dissimilis, meam quom formam noscito,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:5:9:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 5, 9, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">circumspectare omnibus fori partibus senatorem, raroque usquam noscitare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:38:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 38, 9</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n31211.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to examine, explore</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aedes noscitat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:4:2:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 4, 2, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nunc vestigia, si qua sunt, noscitabo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:4:2:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cist. 4, 2, 14</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
nosco: <entryFree id="n31212" type="main" key="nosco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nosco</orth>, <itype>nōvi, nōtum, 3</itype> (old form, GNOSCO, GNOVI, GNOTVM, acc. to <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 569</bibl> P.; <sense id="n31212.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">inf. pass.</hi> GNOSCIER, S. C. de Bacch.; cf. GNOTV, cognitu, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=96" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 96</bibl> Müll.: GNOT (contr. for gnovit) <foreign lang="greek">oi)=den, e)piginw/skei</foreign>; GNOTV, <foreign lang="greek">gnw=sin, dia/gnwsin</foreign>, Gloss. Labb.—Contr. forms in class. Lat. are nosti, noram, norim. nosse; nomus for novimus: nomus ambo Ulixem, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Diom.</author> p. 382</bibl> P., or Trag. v. 199 Vahl.), <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>for gnosco, from the root gno; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">gignw/skw</foreign>, to begin to know</etym>, <hi rend="ital">to get a knowledge of, become acquainted with, come to know</hi> a thing (syn.: scio, calleo). </sense><sense id="n31212.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n31212.2" n="1" level="3"> </sense><sense id="n31212.3" n="(a)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Tempp. praes.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum igitur, nosce te, dicit, hoc dicit, nosce animum tuum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:22:52" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 22, 52</bibl></cit>: <hi rend="ital">Me.</hi> Sauream non novi. <hi rend="ital">Li.</hi> At nosce sane, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:2:4:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 2, 4, 58</bibl>; cf.: <hi rend="ital">Ch.</hi> Nosce signum. <hi rend="ital">Ni.</hi> Novi, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:4:6:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Bacch. 4, 6, 19</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:4:2:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Poen. 4, 2, 71</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">(Juppiter) nos per gentes alium alia disparat, Hominum qui facta, mores, pietatem et fidem noscamus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:prol. 12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rud. prol. 12</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:1:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Stich. 1, 1, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">id esse verum, cuivis facile est noscere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:5:4:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 5, 4, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut noscere possis quidque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:190" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 190</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:832" default="NO" valid="yes">2, 832</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:124" default="NO" valid="yes">3, 124</bibl>; 418; 588; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:41:64" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 41, 64</bibl>: deus ille, quem mente <cb n="NOSC" /> noscimus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:14:37" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 1, 14, 37</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Pass.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">EAM (tabulam) FIGIER IOVBEATIS, VBEI FACILVMED GNOSCIER POTISIT, S. C. de Bacch.: forma in tenebris nosci non quita est, Ter Hec. 4, 1, 57 sq.: omnes philosophiae partes tum facile noscuntur, cum, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:4:9" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 1, 4, 9</bibl></cit>: philosophiae praecepta noscenda, id. Fragm. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 3, 14</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nullique videnda, Voce tamen noscar,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:153" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 14, 153</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec noscitur ulli,</quote> <trans><tr>by any one</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:1:5:29" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tr. 1, 5, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">noscere provinciam, nosci exercitui,</quote> <trans><tr>by the army</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> Agr. 5</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n31212.4" n="(b)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Temppperf., to have become acquainted with, to have learned, to know</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">si me novisti minus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:4:10:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 4, 10, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Cylindrus ego sum, non nosti nomen meum?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:2:2:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Men. 2, 2, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">novi rem omnem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:4:4:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 4, 4, 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui non leges, non instituta ... non jura noritis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:13:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Pis. 13, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">plerique neque in rebus humanis quidquam bonum norunt, nisi, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:21:79" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 21, 79</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quam (virtutem) tu ne de facie quidem nosti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:32:81" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pis. 32, 81</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:22:71" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 2, 22, 71</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">si ego hos bene novi,</quote> <trans><tr>if I know them well</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:chapter=20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 20 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: si Caesarem bene novi, Balb. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:9:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 9, 7</bibl>, B, 2: <cit><quote lang="la">Lepidum pulchre noram,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:10:23:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 10, 23, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si tuos digitos novi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:5:21:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 5, 21, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">res gestas de libris novisse,</quote> <trans><tr>to have learned from books</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 5, 19, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nosse Graece, etc. (late Lat. for scire),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Serm. 45:5" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Serm. 45, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:167:40 al" default="NO">167, 40 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut ibi esses, ubi nec Pelopidarum—nosti cetera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:28:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 7, 28, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:3:9:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 3, 9, 11</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n31212.5" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To examine, consider</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad res suas noscendas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 10, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">imaginem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:4:2:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 4, 2, 29</bibl></cit>.—So esp., <hi rend="ital">to take cognizance of</hi> as a judge: <cit><quote lang="la">quae olim a praetoribus noscebantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:12:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 12, 60</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n31212.6" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, in the <hi rend="ital">tempp. praes</hi>. </sense><sense id="n31212.7" n="A" level="2"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">to know, recognize</hi> (rare; perh. not in Cic.): hau nosco tuom, <hi rend="ital">I know your</hi> (<hi rend="ital">character</hi>, etc.), i. e. <hi rend="ital">I know you no longer</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:2:4:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 2, 4, 44</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nosce imaginem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:4:2:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ps. 4, 2, 29</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:4:6:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Bacch. 4, 6, 19</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">potesne ex his ut proprium quid noscere?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:7:89" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 7, 89</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:90" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 90</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n31212.8" n="B" level="2"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">to acknowledge, allow, admit of</hi> a reason or an excuse (in Cic.): <cit><quote lang="la">numquam amatoris meretricem oportet causam noscere, Quin, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:2:1:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 2, 1, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">illam partem excusationis ... nec nosco, nec probo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:4:4:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 4, 4, 1</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">quod te excusas: ego vero et tuas causas nosco, et, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:11:7:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 11, 7, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">atque vereor, ne istam causam nemo noscat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:1:4:11" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 1, 4, 11</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n31212.9" n="III" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> in <hi rend="ital">tempp. perf.</hi> </sense><sense id="n31212.10" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To be acquainted with</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to practise, possess</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">alia vitia non nosse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 4 praef" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 4 praef.</bibl></cit> § 9.—</sense><sense id="n31212.11" n="B" level="2"> In mal. part., <hi rend="ital">to know</hi> (in paronomasia), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:4:2:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 4, 2, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:1:3:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pers. 1, 3, 51</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n31212.12" n="IV" level="1"> (Eccl. Lat.) Of religious knowledge: <cit><quote lang="la">non noverant Dominum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Judic. 2, 12</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,014:1:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> 2 Thess. 1, 8</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Jesum novi, Paulum scio,</quote> <trans><tr>I acknowledge</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,005:19:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> Act. 19, 15</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">nōtus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">P. a., known</hi>. </sense><sense id="n31212.13" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">nisi rem tam notam esse omnibus et tam manifestam videres,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:58:134" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 58, 134</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ejusmodi res ita notas, ita testatas, ita manifestas proferam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 2, 34</bibl></cit>, § <cit><quote lang="la">85: fingi haec putatis, quae patent, quae nota sunt omnibus, quae tenentur?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:28:76" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 28, 76</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">noti atque insignes latrones,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:11:5:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 11, 5, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">habere omnes philosophiae notos et tractatos locos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:33:118" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 33, 118</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">facere aliquid alicui notum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:12:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 5, 12, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tua nobilitas hominibus litteratis est notior, populo obscurior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:7:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mur. 7, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nullus fuit civis Romanus paulo notior, quin, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 2, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vita P. Sullae vobis populoque Romano notissima,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,015:26:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sull. 26, 72</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nulli nota domus sua,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:1:7" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 1, 7</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n31212.14" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">notus in fratres animi paterni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 2, 6</bibl></cit>: noti operum Telchines. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:2:274" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 2, 274</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">notusque fugarum, Vertit terga,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:17:148" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 17, 148</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n31212.15" n="(g)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">subj.-clause</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">notum est, cur, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:2:58" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 2, 58</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n31212.16" n="(d)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">Delius, Trojanos notus semper minuisse labores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:12:331" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 12, 331</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n31212.17" n="2" level="3"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n31212.18" n="a" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">nōti</orth>, <hi rend="ital">acquaintances, friends</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">de dignitate M. Caelius notis ac majoribus natu ... respondet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cael. 2, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hi suos notos hospitesque quaerebant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:74:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 74, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:1:85" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 1, 85</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Verg.</author> Cir. 259</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n31212.19" n="b" level="4"> In a bad sense, <hi rend="ital">notorious</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">notissimi latronum duces,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:10:14:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 10, 14, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">integrae Temptator Orion Dianae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:4:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 4, 70</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:198" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 198</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Clodia, mulier non solum nobilis sed etiam nota,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:13:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cael. 13, 31</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:6:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 1, 6, 15</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">moechorum notissimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:42" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 42</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n31212.20" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">act., knowing, that knows</hi>: novi, <pb n="1217" /> <cb n="NOTA" /> notis praedicas, <hi rend="ital">to those that know</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:4:2:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 4, 2, 39</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
nosmet: <entryFree id="n31213" type="main" key="nosmet"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nosmet</orth>, v. nos <sense id="n31213.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>, and ego.</sense></entryFree>
nosocomium: <entryFree id="n31214" type="greek" key="no^so^co^mi_um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nŏsŏcŏmīum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">nosokomei=on</foreign>, <sense id="n31214.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a hospital, infirmary</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 1, 2, 19</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">22</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Ep. 30, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
nosocomus: <entryFree id="n31215" type="greek" key="no^so^co^mus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nŏsŏcŏmus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">nosoko/mos</foreign>, <sense id="n31215.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an attendant on the sick, a sick-nurse</hi>, Jul. Ep. Nov. c. 111, § 410; c. 115, § 452.</sense></entryFree>
noster: <entryFree id="n31216" type="main" key="noster"><orth extent="full" lang="la">noster</orth>, <itype>stra, strum</itype> (<sense id="n31216.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">gen. sing. f.</hi> nostrāï, Vel. Long. p. 2222 P.; <hi rend="ital">gen. plur.</hi> nostrum, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:1:2:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 1, 2, 25</bibl>; <xr><lbl>v.</lbl> <ref type="sym" targOrder="U">infra</ref></xr>.), <hi rend="ital">pron. poss.</hi> [nos], <hi rend="ital">our, our own; ours, of us</hi>. </sense><sense id="n31216.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen. </sense><sense id="n31216.2" n="A" level="2"> For the <hi rend="ital">poss. gen. of the first person</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nostra omnis lis est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:2:8:75" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 2, 8, 75</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">averti praedam ab hostibus, nostrum salute socium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:1:2:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Men. 1, 2, 25</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 743</bibl> P.: <cit><quote lang="la">nostris consiliis et laboribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:2:3" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 2, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Rhodanus, qui provinciam nostram ab Helvetiis dividit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">patrum nostrorum memoriā,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exemplo majorum nostrorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:8:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 24, 8, 17</bibl></cit>.—Strengthened by the suff. <hi rend="ital">-pte</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nostrāpte culpā facimus ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:5:2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 5, 2, 1</bibl></cit>.—Strengthened by an appositive <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui de nostro omnium interitu cogitant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:1:4:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 1, 4, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in nostro omnium fletu nullam lacrimam aspexisti Milonis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:34:92" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 34, 92</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cui credas nostram omnium vitam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:3:2:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 3, 2, 32</bibl></cit>: nostra omnium delicta, Greg. M. <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> Sacram. N. 820.—</sense><sense id="n31216.3" n="B" level="2"> Rarely for the <hi rend="ital">object-gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne aspernere amorique nostro plusculum etiam quam concedet veritas, largiare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:12:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 5, 12, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n31216.4" n="II" level="1"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n31216.5" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to us, one of ours, one of us, our friend, ours</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">certe tu me alienabis numquam quin noster siem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:243" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 1, 243</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:5:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 2, 5, 20</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">noster est,</quote> <trans><tr>he belongs to us, is of our house</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 3, 79</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:1:1:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> As. 1, 1, 43</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 2, 86</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:1:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 1, 1, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Ciceronem nostrum quid tibi commendem?</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">impedimentis castrisque nostri potiti sunt,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>our men</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">o noster misericors quid facis?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:8:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Pis. 8, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut ait poëta ille noster,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,030:10:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rab. Post. 10, 28</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:7:24" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Sen. 7, 24</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:36:103" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 5, 36, 103</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:1:3:26" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 1, 3, 26</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:8:1" default="NO">2, 8, 1</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">hic noster, quem principem ponimus,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>he of whom we are speaking</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:28:99" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 28, 99</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">divi, quorum est potestas nostrorum hostiumque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 9</bibl></cit>: quisquis es, Noster eris, a formula made use of on receiving a deserter into the army, Liv. Fragm. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Verg. A. 2, 148</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">noster esto, an expression of assent and applause,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:3:3:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 3, 3, 25</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:3:3:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Bacch. 3, 3, 39</bibl>: minume istuc faciet noster Daemones, <hi rend="ital">our good friend Dæmones</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">I</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:4:7:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rud. 4, 7, 19</bibl>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">novi ego nostros,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:1:2:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ep. 1, 2, 45</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:1:2:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Stich. 1, 2, 26</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">per totum hoc tempus subjectior in diem et horam Invidiae noster,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:6:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 6, 48</bibl></cit>; v. Orell. ad h. l.—</sense><sense id="n31216.6" n="B" level="2"> In addressing a person, <hi rend="ital">dear, good</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">o Syre noster, salve, quid fit? quid agitur? etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:5:5:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 5, 5, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n31216.7" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Convenient for us, favorable to us</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nostra loca,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hora nostra est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:12:193" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 12, 193</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
nostimus: <entryFree id="n31217" type="gloss" key="Nosti^mus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Nostĭmus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*no/stimos</foreign> (returned = redux), <sense id="n31217.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">name of a Roman slave</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Don.</author> 427, 18</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
nostius: <entryFree id="n31218" type="main" key="Nosti^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Nostĭus</orth>, <itype>a</itype>, <sense id="n31218.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">name of a Roman</hi> gens.— Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Nostĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">name of a Roman freedman</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">L. Nostius Zoilus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:13:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 13, 46</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
nostras: <entryFree id="n31219" type="main" key="nostras"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nostras</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype> (old form of the <sense id="n31219.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">nom. sing</hi>. nostratis, Cass. Hem. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 943</bibl> P.), <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>noster</etym>, <hi rend="ital">of our country, native</hi>: arma nostratia, Cato ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 943</bibl> P.: <cit><quote lang="la">verba nostratia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:2:11:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 2, 11, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mirifice capior facetiis, maxime nostratibus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 9, 15, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nostrates philosophi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:32:90" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 5, 32, 90</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tertium genus nostrates vocant silvestre,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 16, 28, § 70</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nostras cunila,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:9:4:6" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 9, 4, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nostrates gallinae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:2:13" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 8, 2, 13</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 15, 11, 10, § 37</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
nostratim: <entryFree id="n31220" type="hapax" key="nostra_tim"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nostrātim</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>nostras; cf. tuatim</etym>, <sense id="n31220.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">in our manner</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tuatim Plautus in Amphit. (2, 1, 4): jam tuatim facis: ubi Sisenna, ut nostratim. Significat autem tuo more,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 196</bibl></cit> P.</sense></entryFree>
nostratis: <entryFree id="n31221" type="main" key="nostra_tis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nostrātis</orth>, v. nostras <sense id="n31221.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
nostos: <entryFree id="n31222" type="gloss" key="Nostos"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Nostos</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*no/stos</foreign> (return), <sense id="n31222.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">name of a Roman slave</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Fabr.</author> p. 194</bibl>, n. 41.</sense></entryFree>
nota: <entryFree id="n31223" type="main" key="no^ta"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nŏta</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>nosco</etym>, <sense id="n31223.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a mark, sign, note</hi> (cf.: signum, insigne, indicium): nota alias significat signum; ut in pecoribus, tabulis, libris, litterae singulae aut binae, alias ignominiam, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=174" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 174</bibl> Müll. (v. in <cb n="NOTA" /> the foll.). </sense><sense id="n31223.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n31223.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">reliquis epistulis notam apponam eam, quae mihi tecum convenit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:13:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 13, 6</bibl></cit>, a, 2: <cit><quote lang="la">si signa et notas ostenderem locorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:41:174" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 41, 174</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:37:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 37, 31</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sive puer furens Impressit memorem dente labris notam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:13:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 13, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caeruleae cui (angui) notae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:87" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 87</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n31223.3" n="B" level="2"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n31223.4" n="1" level="3"> Notae litterarum, <hi rend="ital">marks</hi> or <hi rend="ital">characters</hi> in writing, <hi rend="ital">letters</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui sonos vocis, qui infiniti videbantur, paucis litterarum notis terminavit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:25:62" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 25, 62</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sortes in robore insculptae priscarum litterarum notis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:41:85" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 2, 41, 85</bibl></cit>.—So without litterarum: <cit><quote lang="la">quosque legat versus oculo properante viator, Grandibus in tituli marmore caede notis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:3:3:72" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 3, 3, 72</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">foliisque notas et nomina mandat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:444" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 444</bibl></cit>: C nota praenominis, cum sola Gaium notat; <cit><quote lang="la">item numeri cum centum significat,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Diom.</author> 418</bibl></cit> P.—</sense><sense id="n31223.5" n="b" level="4"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, notae, <hi rend="ital">a letter, epistle, writing</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">inspicit acceptas hostis ab hoste notas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:4:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 4, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">20, 207</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:577" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 6, 577</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">incisa notis marmora publicis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:8:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 8, 13</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n31223.6" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Secret characters, secret writing, cipher</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in quibus (epistulis), si qua occultius perferenda essent, per notas scripsit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:56" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 56</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:88" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Aug. 88</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:11:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mur. 11, 25</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:17:9" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 17, 9</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 1, 25</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n31223.7" n="3" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Short-hand characters, stenographic signs</hi>, used instead of the letters of the alphabet: <cit><quote lang="la">apud veteres cum usus notarum nullus esset, propter perscribendi difficultatem ... quaedam verba atque nomina ex communi sensu primis litteris notabant, et singulae litterae quid significarent, in promptu erat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0996,001:de Jur. Not. Signif. 1" default="NO"><author>Val. Prob.</author> de Jur. Not. Signif. 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid verborum notas, quibus quamvis citata excipitur oratio et celeritatem linguae manus sequitur?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 90:25" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 90, 25</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tit.:3" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tit. 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">notis scriptae tabulae non continentur edicto, quia notas litteras non esse Pedius scripsit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:37:1:6" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 37, 1, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:50:13:1:section=7" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 50, 13, 1, § 7</bibl>: verba notis brevibus comprendere cuncta peritus, Raptimque punctis dicta praepetibus sequi, Prud. <foreign lang="greek">stef</foreign>. 9, 23.—</sense><sense id="n31223.8" n="4" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Memoranda, notes, brief extracts</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">idem (Aristoteles) locos, quasi argumentorum notas, tradidit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:14:46" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 14, 46</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n31223.9" n="5" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A note</hi> in music: <cit><quote lang="la">notis musicis cantica excipere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:12:14" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 12, 14</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n31223.10" n="6" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A critical mark</hi>, made on the margin of a book in reading, to point out particular passages: <cit><quote lang="la">notam apponere ad malum versum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:30:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Pis. 30, 73</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mittam tibi libros, et imponam notas, ut ad ea ipsa protinus, quae probo et miror accedas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 6:4" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 6, 4</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 1, 21</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:59:2" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 59, 2</bibl>.— Hence, </sense><sense id="n31223.11" n="b" level="4"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a critical remark, a note</hi>, on a writing: <cit><quote lang="la">ex notā Marcelli constat, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:49:17:10" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 49, 17, 10</bibl></cit>; Cod. Th. 1, 4, 1.— </sense><sense id="n31223.12" n="7" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A mark on a wine-cask</hi>, to denote the quality of the wine: <cit><quote lang="la">nota Falerni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:3:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 3, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:10:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 1, 10, 24</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n31223.13" n="b" level="4"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a sort, kind, quality</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">eae notae sunt optimae,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>wines of those brands</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:83:287" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 83, 287</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex hac notā corporum est aër,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 2:2:4" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 2, 2, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">secundae notae mel,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:9:15:3" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 9, 15, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eum ex hac notā litteratorum esse,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 83</bibl></cit>: de meliore notā, Cur. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:29:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 7, 29, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quaedam beneficia non sunt ex hac vulgari notā, sed majora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 3:9:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 3, 9, 1</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n31223.14" n="8" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A distinguishing mark. distinctive feature</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cujusque generis dicendi nota,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:23:75" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 23, 75</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:4:22:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 4, 22, 22</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n31223.15" n="9" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A nod, beck, sign</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">innuet: acceptas tu quoque redde notas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:3:514" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 3, 514</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:466" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 11, 466</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n31223.16" n="10" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A brand</hi> on the body of a bad slave: <cit><quote lang="la">multos honesti ordinis, deformatos prius stigmatum notis, ad metalla condemnavit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:27" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 27</bibl></cit>.—Also of <hi rend="ital">tattoo-marks</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">barbarus compunctus notis Thraciis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:7:25" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 2, 7, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">interstincti corpora ... fucatis et densioribus notis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 31, 2, 14</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n31223.17" n="11" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A mark, spot, mole</hi> on the body (syn.: <cit><quote lang="la">naevus, macula): corpore traditur maculoso dispersis per pectus atque alvum genetivis notis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:80" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 80</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:2:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 2, 59</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n31223.18" n="12" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A stamp impression</hi> on a coin: <cit><quote lang="la">nummos omnis notae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:75" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 75</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">94</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:25" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ner. 25</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n31223.19" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n31223.20" n="A" level="2"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">a mark, sign, token</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">notae ac vestigia suorum flagitiorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:47:section=115" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 47, § 115</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quam scite per notas nos certiores facit Juppiter,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:21:47" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 2, 21, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mihi quoque impendere idem exitium, certis quibusdam notis augurabar,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:3:11:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 3, 11, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nomina et notae morti destinatorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:49" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pro re publicā cicatrices ac notas virtutis accipere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,012:13:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rab. Perd. 13, 36</bibl></cit>: interspirationis enim, non defatigationis nostrae neque librariorum<cb n="NOTA" />  notae, <hi rend="ital">signs</hi> of punctuation marks, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:44:173" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 44, 173</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n31223.21" n="B" level="2"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n31223.22" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A characteristic quality, character</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">patefacta interiore notā animi sui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:54" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 54</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n31223.23" n="2" level="3"> Nota censoria, or simply nota, <hi rend="ital">the mark</hi> or <hi rend="ital">note which the censors affixed in their lists of citizens to the name of any one whom they censured for immorality</hi> or <hi rend="ital">want of patriotism</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">censoriae severitatis nota,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:46:129" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 46, 129</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">patrum memoriā institutum fertur, ut censores motis e senatu adscriberent notas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:42:6 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 39, 42, 6 sq.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">duo milia nominum in aerarios relata, tribuque omnes moti, additumque tam acri censoriae notae triste senatus consultum, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:18:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 24, 18, 9</bibl></cit> Weissenb.: <cit><quote lang="la">censores senatum sine ullius notā legerunt,</quote> <trans><tr>not excluding any one</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:32:7:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 32, 7, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">censores eo anno ... de senatu novem ejecerunt.
