Insignes notae fuerunt Maluginensis et Scipionis et, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:41:27:1 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 41, 27, 1 sq.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">notae jam destinatae exemptus est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:4:20:8" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 4, 20, 8</bibl></cit>; v. Dict. of Antiq. p. 664 sq.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n31223.24" n="b" level="4"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a mark of ignominy</hi> or <hi rend="ital">infamy, a reproach, disgrace</hi>: quem scis scire tuas omnes maculasque notasque, Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 354, 21</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae nota domesticae turpitudinis non inusta vitae tuae est?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:1:6:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 1, 6, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Gabinii litteras insigni quādam notā atque ignominiā novā condemnāstis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,025:10:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Prov. Cons. 10, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">o turpem notam temporum illorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:18:74" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 3, 18, 74</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">homo omnibus notis turpitudinis insignis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,012:9:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rab. Perd. 9, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nota ignominiaque Philippi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:44:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 44, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sempiternas foedissimae turpitudinis notas subire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:18:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Pis. 18, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">notā laborare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:3:2:2" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 3, 2, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
notabilis: <entryFree id="n31224" type="main" key="no^ta_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nŏtābĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>nota</etym>, <sense id="n31224.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">noteworthy, distinguished, remarkable, extraordinary, memorable, notable</hi> (not freq. till the Aug. per.; in Cic. perh. only once; in Cæs. not at all). </sense><sense id="n31224.1" n="I" level="1"> Prop.: exitus, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:12:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 5, 12, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">rara et notabilis res,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:7:6:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 7, 6, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">id est notabilius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:3:22" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 3, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">illud notabile ex diversis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:5:5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 8, 5, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">notabilis introitus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> Agr. 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cunctis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:374" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 374</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">magna ista et notabilis eloquentia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tac.</author> Or. 40</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n31224.2" n="B" level="2"> Esp., in a bad sense, <hi rend="ital">infamous, notorious</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">turpitudine notabiles,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:3:1:5" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 3, 1, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si quid in pejus notabile est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:3:1" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 3, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae imperitis quoque ad reprehensionem notabilia videntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:33" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 9, 4, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eo notabilior caedes fuit, quia filius patrem interfecit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 3, 25</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n31224.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">dis cernible, perceptible</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aspice nobilissimarum civitatum fundamenta vix notabilia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ira, 1:2:3" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ira, 1, 2, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n31224.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Pointed at, marked, indicated</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">digitis hominum nutibusque notabilis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 11, p. 784</bibl></cit> Oud.—Hence, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">nŏtābĭlĭter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">remarkably, notably; perceptibly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quaedam frequentius et notabiliter usurpavit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:87" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 87</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">expalluit notabiliter,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:1:5:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 1, 5, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gaudium eminuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:ib. 5:17:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 17, 5</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">notabilius turbare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 55</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem odisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:Decl. 17" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> Decl. 17</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
notaculum: <entryFree id="n31225" type="hapax" key="no^ta_cu^lum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nŏtācŭlum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>noto</etym>, <sense id="n31225.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a mark, sign</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">notaculum corporis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Min. Fel.</author> 31, 8</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
notaria: <entryFree id="n31226" type="main" key="no^ta_ri^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nŏtārĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, v. notarius, B.</entryFree>
notarius: <entryFree id="n31227" type="main" key="no^ta_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nŏtārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>nota</etym>, <sense id="n31227.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to writing in cipher</hi> or <hi rend="ital">short-hand writing</hi> (post-Aug.).—Only as <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi> </sense><sense id="n31227.1" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">nŏtārĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> </sense><sense id="n31227.2" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A short-hand writer, stenographer</hi> (syn. actuarius), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:3:5:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 3, 5, 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:2:24" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 7, 2, 24</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:5:51:2" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 5, 51, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:14:208" default="NO">14, 208</bibl> <hi rend="ital">in lemm.;</hi> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lampr.</author> Alex. Sev. 28</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n31227.3" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a writer, secretary, clerk, amanuensis</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">notarium voco et quae formaverim dicto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:9:36:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 9, 36, 2</bibl></cit>; Val. ap. Treb. <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> 14</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 17, 5, 15</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n31227.4" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">nŏtārĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> </sense><sense id="n31227.5" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">The art of writing</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in puerilibus litteris prima abecedaria, secunda notaria,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Fulg.</author> Myth. 3, 10</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n31227.6" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A written information, indictment</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Ep. 169" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Ep. 169</bibl> dub.</sense></entryFree>
notatio: <entryFree id="n31228" type="main" key="no^ta_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nŏtātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>noto</etym>, <sense id="n31228.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a marking, noting.</hi> </sense><sense id="n31228.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">tabellarum,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>the marking of the voting-tablets with wax of different colors</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:47:130" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 47, 130</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n31228.2" n="II" level="1"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n31228.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">The inflicting of disgrace by the</hi> nota censoria; <cit><quote lang="la">v. nota, II. B. 2.: ad notationes auctoritatemque censoriam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:46:128" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 46, 128</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n31228.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A designation, choice</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">delectus et notatio judicum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:5:5:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 5, 5, 13</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n31228.5" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A noticing, observing, observation</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">notatio naturae et animadversio peperit artem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:55:183" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 55, 183</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae notatione et laude digna sint,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:17:65" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 17, 65</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">notatio temporum,</quote> <trans><tr>chronology</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 19, 74</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n31228.6" n="D" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">The designating of the meaning and derivation<pb n="1218" /> <cb n="NOTI" />  of a word, etymology</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tum notatio, cum ex vi verbi argumentum aliquid elicitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,042:2:10" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Top. 2, 10</bibl></cit>; cf.: multa etiam ex notatione sumuntur. Ea est autem, cum ex vi nominis argumentum elicitur: quam Graeci <foreign lang="greek">e)tumologi/an</foreign> vocant, id est verbum e verbo, veriloquium, <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 8, 35</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:6:28" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 6, 28</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n31228.7" n="E" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">The use of letters to denote entire words, a species of short-hand</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad quas notationes publicas accessit, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0996,001:de Jur. Not. Signif. 1" default="NO"><author>Val. Prob.</author> de Jur. Not. Signif. 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n31228.8" n="F" level="1"> Rhet. t. t., <hi rend="ital">a describing, depicting, characterizing</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">notatio est cum alicujus natura certis describitur signis, quae sicuti notae quaedam naturae sunt attributae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 4, 50, 63</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
notatus: <entryFree id="n31229" type="main" key="no^ta_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nŏtātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos>, from noto.</entryFree>
notesco: <entryFree id="n31230" type="main" key="no_tesco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nōtesco</orth>, <itype>tŭi, 3</itype>, <sense id="n31230.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. inch. n.</hi> [1. notus], <hi rend="ital">to become known</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose): <cit><quote lang="la">notescatque magis mortuus atque magis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:68:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 68, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec minus haec nostri notescet fama sepulchri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:13:37" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 13, 37</bibl></cit> (3, 5, 21 M.): <cit><quote lang="la">malis facinoribus notescere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:12:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 12, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae ubi Tiberio notuere, scripsit consulibus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 73</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:43" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 43</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:42" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ner. 42</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nondum fas erat alienigenis hominibus religionem veri Dei notescere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 4, 2, 5</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
nothus: <entryFree id="n31231" type="greek" key="no^thus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nŏthus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">no/qos</foreign>, <sense id="n31231.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">spurious, not genuine</hi>. </sense><sense id="n31231.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n31231.2" n="A" level="2"> Of persons, <hi rend="ital">illegitimate, bastard, born out of wedlock</hi> (but of a known father; contra, spurius, <hi rend="ital">of an unknown father</hi>: legitimus, <hi rend="ital">born in wedlock</hi>): <cit><quote lang="la">nothum qui non sit legitimus, Graeci vocant: Latinum rei nomen non habemus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:6:97" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 3, 6, 97</bibl></cit>; cf. Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=174" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 174</bibl> Müll.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:6:96" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 3, 6, 96</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:7:10" default="NO">7, 7, 10</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Antiphaten ... Thebanā de matre nothum Sarpedonis alti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:697" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 697</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n31231.3" n="B" level="2"> Of animals <hi rend="ital">of a mixed breed, mongrel</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:283" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 283</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:2:13" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 8, 2, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 1, 1, § 3</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n31231.4" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">not genuine, false, counterfeit</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-class. prose): <cit><quote lang="la">lunaque sive notho fertur loca lumine lustrans, Sive suam proprio jactat de corpore lucem,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>borrowed, not its own</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:575" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 575</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">lumen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:34:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 34, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Attis notha mulier,</quote> <trans><tr>false, counterfeit</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:63:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 63, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quojus genera (nominum) sunt tria, unum vernaculum ac domi natum, alterum adventicium, tertium nothum ex peregrino hic natum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 10:section=69" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 10, § 69</bibl></cit> Müll.; so, <cit><quote lang="la">notha nomina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:ib. 10" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 10</bibl></cit>, § <cit><quote lang="la">70: nothae atque adulterae lectiones,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 5, 182</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
notia: <entryFree id="n31232" type="greek" key="no^ti^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nŏtĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">noti/a</foreign>, <sense id="n31232.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a precious stone, said to fall with the rain, also called</hi> ombria, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:176" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 10, 65, § 176</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n31232.1" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A plant</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:175" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 24, 19, 115, § 175</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
notialis: <entryFree id="n31233" type="main" key="no^ti^a_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nŏtĭālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. notus</etym>, <sense id="n31233.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">southern</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">nubila,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Avien.</author> Arat. 550</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
notifico: <entryFree id="n31234" type="main" key="no_ti^fi^co"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nōtĭfĭco</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>1. notusfacio</etym>, <sense id="n31234.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to make known</hi> (perh. only ante- and post-class.): genus alicui, Pompon. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 144, 24</bibl>: res est notificata satis, Poët. Lat. Min. t. 6, p. 383 Wernsd.</sense></entryFree>
notio: <entryFree id="n31235" type="main" key="no_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nōtĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>nosco</etym>, <sense id="n31235.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a becoming acquainted, a making one's self acquainted</hi> with a person (syn.: cognitio, perceptio, notitia). </sense><sense id="n31235.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> * </sense><sense id="n31235.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">quid tibi hanc aditiost? quid tibi hanc notiost, inquam, amicam meam?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:2:7:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 2, 7, 62</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n31235.3" n="B" level="2"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">a taking cognizance of</hi> a thing by a magistrate, <hi rend="ital">an examination, investigation</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ceteri agri omnes, sine ullo delectu, sine populi Romani notione, sine judicio senatās, decemvirisaddicentur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:21:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Agr. 2, 21, 57</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">pontificum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,020:13:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Dom. 13, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">notionem ejus differre,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:11:20:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 11, 20, 2</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">censoria,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:25:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 25, 55</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,025:19:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Prov. Cons. 19, 46</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:5:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pis. 5, 10</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">notiones animadversionesque censoriae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:31:111" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 3, 31, 111</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad censore, non ad senatum, notionem de eo pertinere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:25:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 27, 25, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dilatā notione,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 59</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">notioni quindecimvirum is liber subicitur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid denique ad jus civile aut ad actoris notionem atque animadversionem ages injuriarum?</quote> <trans><tr>the investigation and punishment sought by the plaintiff</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:12:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Caecin. 12, 35</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:42:1:5" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 42, 1, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:49:1:10" default="NO">49, 1, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:50:16:99" default="NO">50, 16, 99</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n31235.4" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">an idea, conception, notion</hi> of a thing: <cit><quote lang="la">notio rerum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:39:114" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 39, 114</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum rerum notiones in animis fiant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:3:10:33" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 3, 10, 33</bibl></cit>: simulac (homo) cepit intelligentiam, vel notionem potius quam appellant <foreign lang="greek">e)/nnoian</foreign> illi, etc., <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 6, 21</bibl>; cf.: genus est notio ad plures differentias pertinens: Forma est notio, cujus, etc. Notionem appello, quod Graeci tum <foreign lang="greek">e)/nnoian</foreign>, tum <foreign lang="greek">pro/lhyin</foreign> dicunt, id. Top. <cb n="NOTO" /> 7, 31; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:24:57" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 1, 24, 57</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:21:59" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 5, 21, 59</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in omnium animis deorum notionem impressit natura,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:16:43" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 1, 16, 43</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 5, 13</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">intellegentiae nostrae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 11, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">excute intellegentiam tuam ut videas, quae sit in eā species, forma et notio boni viri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:20:81" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 3, 20, 81</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque alia huic verbo subjecta notio est, nisi, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:10:29" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 5, 10, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de fortitudine,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 24, 53</bibl></cit>: apud veteres dicebatur, professionem eorum (mathematicorum), non notitiam, esse prohibitam, Mos. et Rom. Leg. Coll. 15, 2, 2.</sense></entryFree>
notion: <entryFree id="n31236" type="main" key="no^ti^on"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nŏtĭon</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n31236.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a plant, otherwise called</hi> cucumis silvaticus, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Herb. 113</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
notitia: <entryFree id="n31237" type="main" key="no_ti^ti^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nōtĭtĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype> (<sense id="n31237.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">gen. sing</hi>. notitiāï, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:124" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 124</bibl>.—Collat. form <orth extent="full" lang="la">nōtĭtĭes</orth>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:182" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 182</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1047" default="NO" valid="yes">1047</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 6</bibl> prooem.), <gen>f.</gen> <etym>1. notus</etym>, <hi rend="ital">a being known, celebrity, note, fame</hi>. </sense><sense id="n31237.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">hi propter notitiam sunt intromissi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Dion. 9:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Dion. 9, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tanta notitia te invasit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 19:3" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 19, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">plus notitiae quam fuit ante dedit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:3:1:49" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 3, 1, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">virtus Notitiam serae posteritatis habet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:4:8:48" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 8, 48</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n31237.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> (class.) </sense><sense id="n31237.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Acquaintance</hi> with a person: <cit><quote lang="la">quamquam haec inter nos nuper admodum notitia est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:1:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 1, 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fama adulescentis paulum haesit ad metas notitia nova mulieris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:31:75" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cael. 31, 75</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 59</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n31237.4" n="2" level="3"> In partic.: notitiam feminae habere, <hi rend="ital">to know</hi> or <hi rend="ital">have carnal knowledge of a woman</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:21:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 6, 21, 5</bibl>; cf. cognosco.—</sense><sense id="n31237.5" n="B" level="2"> In gen. <hi rend="ital">a knowing, knowledge, an idea, conception, notion</hi> of a thing: <cit><quote lang="la">notitiam praebere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:124" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 124</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nostrae menti corpora posse vorti in notitiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:745" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 745</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">notitiam habere dei,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:1:8:24" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 1, 8, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">valetudo sustentatur notitiā sui corporis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:24:86" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 2, 24, 86</bibl></cit>: notitiae rerum, quas Graeci tum <foreign lang="greek">e)nnoi/as</foreign>, tum <foreign lang="greek">prolh/yeis</foreign> vocant, <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 2, 10, 30</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">natura ingenuit sine doctrinā notitias parvas rerum maximarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:21:59" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 5, 21, 59</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">habere notitiam alicujus rei,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:4:8" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 4, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">locorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 5, 5, § 48</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:19:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 19, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc venit mihi in notitiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 1, 1, § 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tradere aliquid notitiae hominum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 3, 5, 9, § 57</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:7:4" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 7, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">antiquitatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:4:12" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Sen. 4, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in notitiam hominum pervenire,</quote> <trans><tr>to become generally known</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Contr. 6:2:5" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Contr. 6, 2, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quo notitia supplicii ad posteros perveniret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:6:3:1" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 6, 3, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in notitiam populi pervenire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:26:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 26, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in notitiam alicujus perferre aliquid,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:10:18:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 10, 18, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
notities: <entryFree id="n31238" type="main" key="no_ti^ti^es"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nōtĭtĭes</orth>, v. notitia <sense id="n31238.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
notium: <entryFree id="n31239" type="main" key="Notium"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Notium</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n31239.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a city and promontory near Colophon, in Ionia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:37:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 37, 26</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:39" default="NO" valid="yes">38, 39</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:116" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 29, 31, § 116</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
notius: <entryFree id="n31240" type="greek" key="no^ti^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nŏtĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">no/tios</foreign>, <sense id="n31240.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">southern</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">notia sidera,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Manil.</author> 1, 436</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">piscis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 427</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">polus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Astron. 1:5" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Astron. 1, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:4:11" default="NO">4, 11</bibl>. According to Pliny, <hi rend="ital">the Tyrrhene Sea</hi> was called by some Greek writers Mare Notium, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:75" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 5, 10, § 75</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
noto: <entryFree id="n31241" type="main" key="no^to"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nŏto</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>nota</etym>, <sense id="n31241.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to mark, to designate with a mark</hi> (syn.: signo, designo). </sense><sense id="n31241.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">tabellam cerā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:32:section=79" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 32, § 79</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ungue genas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:1:7:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 1, 7, 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pueri rubor ora notavit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:329" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 4, 329</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rugis uterum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:3:785" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. A. 3, 785</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ova atramento,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:11:12" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 8, 11, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">corpus nulla litura notet,</quote> <trans><tr>not a wrinkle</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:7:18:2" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 7, 18, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n31241.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n31241.3" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To write</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">scribit, damnatque tabellas, Et notat et delet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:522" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 9, 522</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n31241.4" n="b" level="4"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">to write in short-hand</hi> or <hi rend="ital">cipher, to set down in a summary form</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">notando consequi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1</bibl></cit> prooem. § 7; 11, 2, 19; <cit><quote lang="la">4, 5, 22: notata, non perscripta erat summa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=gal.:5" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Galb. 5</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n31241.5" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To make remarks</hi> or <hi rend="ital">notes</hi> on a writing, <hi rend="ital">to remark</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">idque et Labeo probat, sed Proculus apud eum notat, non semper debere dari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:3:5:9" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 3, 5, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Marcellus apud Julianum notat: Non dubitamus, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:35:1:19" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 35, 1, 19</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:50:4:18:section=26" default="NO">50, 4, 18, § 26</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n31241.6" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n31241.7" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To signify, indicate, denote</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae notant et designant turpitudinem aliquam non turpiter,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:58:236" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 58, 236</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">notare res nominibus novis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:3:2:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 3, 2, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">illa, quae temporis naturam notant,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Part. 11, 37</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n31241.8" n="2" level="3"> In partic.: aliquem, <hi rend="ital">to allude to, hint at</hi> one: <cit><quote lang="la">senatum gestu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:39" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 39</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">conjunx visa est duro vultu Dicta tulisse Jovis, seque indoluisse notatam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:261" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 9, 261</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n31241.9" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To mark, note, observe</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">numerum in cadentibus guttis notare possumus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:48:186" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 48, 186</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animadvertere et notare sidera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:43:91" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 2, 43, 91</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cantus avium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 42, 94</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">id caput notavi, et descriptum tibi misi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 7, 22</bibl></cit>: veris initium iste a Favoniā notare, id. <cb n="NOVA" /> Verr. 2, 5, 10, § 27; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 8, 6, § 29</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 6 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></bibl>—</sense><sense id="n31241.10" n="C" level="2"> Publicist's t. t., esp. of the censors, <hi rend="ital">to mark</hi> or <hi rend="ital">brand</hi> with infamy (nota) on account of a crime or fault, <hi rend="ital">to censure, reprimand</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quos censores furti et captarum pecuniarum nomine notaverunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:42:120" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 42, 120</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eques Romanus impolitiae notabatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:4:12:2" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 4, 12, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ita senatus rem, non hominem notavit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:11:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mil. 11, 31</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:47:130" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clu. 47, 130</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem ignominiā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:7:9:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 7, 9, 23</bibl></cit>: luxuria Cornelii non crimine aliquo libidinis, sed communi maledicto notabatur <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,026:25:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Balb. 25, 56</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne is dedecore, maculā, turpissimā ignominiā notetur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Quint. 31, 99</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cujus improbitatem veteres Atticorum comoediae notaverunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:62:224" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 62, 224</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">stultus et improbus hic amor est dignusque notari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:3:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 3, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">notante judice, quo nosti, populo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 6, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem joco,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:5" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">scripta famosa quibus primores viri notabantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=dom.:8" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Dom. 8</bibl></cit>. Hence, * <orth extent="full" lang="la">nŏtātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">P. a., marked, perceptible</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">notatior similitudo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 3, 22, 37</bibl></cit> Orell. (al. notior).</sense></entryFree>
notor: <entryFree id="n31242" type="main" key="no_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nōtor</orth> (collat. form ‡ <orth extent="full" lang="la">nōtos</orth>, <sense id="n31242.0" n="I" level="1"><xr><lbl>v.</lbl> <ref type="sym" targOrder="U">infra</ref></xr>), <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>nosco</etym>, <hi rend="ital">one who knows</hi> a person or thing, <hi rend="ital">a voucher, witness</hi>, = cognitor (postAug.): <cit><quote lang="la">qui notorem dat ignotus est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 39:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 39, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 92</bibl>; Sen. Apoc. <hi rend="ital">med.</hi>; <cit><quote lang="la">NOTOS (i. e. notor) ADVENISTI,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 4957</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
notoria: <entryFree id="n31243" type="main" key="no_to_ri^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nōtōrĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, v. notorius, I.</entryFree>
notorius: <entryFree id="n31244" type="main" key="no_to_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nōtōrĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>notor</etym>, <sense id="n31244.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">pointing out, making known</hi> (post-class.); only <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi> </sense><sense id="n31244.1" n="I" level="1"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">nōtōrĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> </sense><sense id="n31244.2" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A notice, advice, intelligence, news</hi>: quod notoriā tuā intimāsti, Gall. ap. Treb. <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> 17</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui falsam de me notoriam pertulerat,</quote> <trans><tr>information, indictment</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 7, p. 189, 10</bibl></cit> Oud., for notorium (v. infra).—</sense><sense id="n31244.3" n="B" level="2"> Notoria, <foreign lang="greek">a)nafora/</foreign>, Gloss.; cf.: <foreign lang="greek">mh/nusis</foreign>, notoria, indicium, Gloss.—</sense><sense id="n31244.4" n="II" level="1"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">nōtōrĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">an information, indictment</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nuntiatores, qui per notoria indicia produnt, notoriis suis assistere jubentur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:48:16:6" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 48, 16, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:10:4" default="NO"><author>Symm.</author> 10, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
notos: <entryFree id="n31245" type="main" key="No^tos1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Nŏtos</orth>, <itype>i, for Notus</itype>, v. 2. Notus.</entryFree>
<entryFree id="n31246" type="gloss" key="no_tos2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nōtos</orth>, <itype>for notor</itype>, q. v.</entryFree>
notrix: <entryFree id="n31247" type="main" key="notrix"><orth extent="full" lang="la">notrix</orth>, v. nutrix <sense id="n31247.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
notula: <entryFree id="n31248" type="main" key="no^tu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nŏtŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>nota</etym>, <sense id="n31248.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a little mark</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 1, § 66</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
notus: <entryFree id="n31249" type="main" key="no_tus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nōtus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. nosco <sense id="n31249.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n31250" type="greek" key="No^tus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Nŏtus</orth> and <orth extent="full" lang="la">Nŏtos</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym><foreign lang="greek">*no/tos</foreign></etym>, = auster, <sense id="n31250.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the south wind</hi>. </sense><sense id="n31250.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">tres Notus hibernas immensa per aequora noctes Vexit me violentus aquā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:355" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 355</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">madidis Notus evolat alis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:264" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 264</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">udus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:10:19" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 10, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">procellosus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:2:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 2, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tepidus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:1:4:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 1, 4, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sub Noton et Borean,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:7:363" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 7, 363</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n31250.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, transf., for <hi rend="ital">wind</hi> in gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">tendunt vela Noti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:268" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 268</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1</bibl>. 575; 5, 512; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:5:35" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 5, 35</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
novacula: <entryFree id="n31251" type="main" key="no^va_cu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nŏvācŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>novo</etym>, <sense id="n31251.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a sharp knife</hi>. </sense><sense id="n31251.1" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">cutem raporum novaculā decerpere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:56:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 56, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:22:99" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 22, 23, 47, § 99</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n31251.2" n="B" level="2"> Esp. </sense><sense id="n31251.3" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A razor</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut ex novaculā comperistis, tonsor est,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 103</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aream (capitis) novaculā radere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:6:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 6, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nudare caput,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:2:66:7" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 2, 66, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">secare fauces,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:23" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 23</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:29:107" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 29, 6, 34, § 107</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Tarquinius dixit, se cogitāsse, cotem novaculā posse praecidi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:17:32" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 17, 32</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 36</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:1:4:1" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 1, 4, 1</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n31251.4" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A dagger</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">stringitur in densā nec caeca novacula turbā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:7:61:7" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 7, 61, 7</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n31251.5" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">the name of a fish</hi>, otherwise unknown, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:32:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 32, 2, 5, § 14</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
novalis: <entryFree id="n31252" type="main" key="no^va_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nŏvālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>novus</etym>, in agriculture, <sense id="n31252.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that is ploughed anew</hi> or <hi rend="ital">for the first time</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ager restibilis, qui restituitur ac reseritur quotquot annis: contra qui intermittitur, a novando novalis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=39" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 39</bibl></cit> Müll.; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:ib. 6" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6</bibl>, § 59; Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=174" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 174</bibl> Müll. —Hence, </sense><sense id="n31252.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">nŏvālis</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> (sc. terra), and <orth extent="full" lang="la">nŏvāle</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> (sc. solum). </sense><sense id="n31252.2" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Fallow land</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">alternis idem tonsas cessare novales,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 71</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae numquam vacuo solita est cessare novali ... se nescit humus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:1:4:13" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 1, 4, 13</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 1, 6</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 10</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">novale est, quod alternis annis seritur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:176" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 19, 49, § 176</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:2:14" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 2, 2, 14</bibl>: pabula fesso praebere novali, id. poët. 10, 84.—</sense><sense id="n31252.3" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A field that has been ploughed for the first time</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">talis fere est in novalibus, caesā vetere silvā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 5, 3, § 39</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:47:21:3" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 47, 21, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">novalis (dicitur), ubi fuit satum antequam secunda aratione renovetur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:29:1" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 29, 1</bibl></cit>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n31252.4" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n31252.5" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Unploughed land, meadow-land</hi>: ille subacto et puro solo gaudet, hic novali graminosoque gaudet,<pb n="1219" /> <cb n="NOVE" />  <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 6</bibl>, praef. 1.—</sense><sense id="n31252.6" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A cultivated field</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">impius haec tam culta novalia miles habebit?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:1:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 1, 71</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dira novalia Cadmi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:3:644" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 3, 644</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n31252.7" n="3" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">The standing crops</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec prius inde domum quam tota novalia saevos In ventres abeant (boum),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:14:148" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 14, 148</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
novamen: <entryFree id="n31253" type="main" key="no^va_men"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nŏvāmen</orth>, <itype>ĭnis</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>novo</etym>, <sense id="n31253.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an innovation</hi> (post-class.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Marc. 1, 20</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
novanensisvicus: <entryFree id="n31254" type="gloss" key="Nova_nensis vi_cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Novānensis vīcus</orth>, <sense id="n31254.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a village on the</hi> Via Appia, <hi rend="ital">not far from Calatia</hi>, Inscr. Marin. Fratr. Arv. p. 390.</sense></entryFree>
novani: <entryFree id="n31255" type="gloss" key="No^va_ni"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Nŏvāni</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>novus</etym>, <sense id="n31255.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">colonists, immigrants, new residents</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 101</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Grut.</author> 1022, 12</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
novatiani: <entryFree id="n31256" type="main" key="No^va_ti^a_ni"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Nŏvātĭāni</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n31256.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the followers of Novatius of Carthage, Novatians, a sect of Christians</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 4, 30, 10</bibl>; Cod. 16, 5, 59 al.</sense></entryFree>
novatilla: <entryFree id="n31257" type="main" key="No^va_tilla"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Nŏvātilla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n31257.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a niece of Seneca the philosopher</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Cons. ad Helv. 18:7" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Cons. ad Helv. 18, 7</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
novatio: <entryFree id="n31258" type="main" key="no^va_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nŏvātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>novo</etym>, <sense id="n31258.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a renewing, renovation</hi> (post-class.). </sense><sense id="n31258.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Marc. 4, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pudendorum,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>shaving</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 5, 182</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n31258.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a renewal</hi> or <hi rend="ital">change of a bond or other evidence of debt</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">novatio est prioris debiti in aliam obligationem ... transfusio atque translatio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:46:2:1" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 46, 2, 1</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">the whole title: de novationibus et delegationibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:46:2" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 46, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:34:3:31" default="NO">34, 3, 31</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:33:1:21" default="NO">33, 1, 21</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">debts and obligations were transferred only by novatio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:Inst. 2:38 sq" default="NO"><author>Gai.</author> Inst. 2, 38 sq.</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:3:176" default="NO">3, 176</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
novator: <entryFree id="n31259" type="main" key="no^va_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nŏvātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n31259.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a renewer, restorer</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">verborum,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>who brings obsolete words again into use</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:1:15:18" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 1, 15, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">stirpis Anniae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Ep. 16, 32</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
novatrix: <entryFree id="n31260" type="hapax" key="no^va_trix"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nŏvātrix</orth>, <itype>īcis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>novator</etym>, <sense id="n31260.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">she who renews</hi> or <hi rend="ital">changes</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">rerum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:252" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 252</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
novatus: <entryFree id="n31261" type="main" key="no^va_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nŏvātus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>novo</etym>, <sense id="n31261.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a renewing, changing, change</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Idyll. 14, 39</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
nove: <entryFree id="n31262" type="main" key="no^ve_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nŏvē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. novus <sense id="n31262.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
novella: <entryFree id="n31263" type="main" key="no^vella"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nŏvella</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, v. 1. novellus, II.</entryFree>
novellaster: <entryFree id="n31264" type="main" key="no^vellaster"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nŏvellaster</orth>, <itype>tra, trum</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>novellus</etym>, <sense id="n31264.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">rather new</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vinum novellastrum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Marc. Emp.</author> 8</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
novelle: <entryFree id="n31265" type="main" key="no^velle_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nŏvellē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. 1. novellus, I. <sense id="n31265.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
novelletum: <entryFree id="n31266" type="main" key="no^velle_tum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nŏvellētum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>1. novellus</etym>, <sense id="n31266.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a place planted with young trees</hi> or <hi rend="ital">vines, a nursery-garden</hi> (post-class.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:25:1:6" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 25, 1, 6</bibl>; cf.: novelletum, <foreign lang="greek">neo/futon, neofutei=on</foreign>, Gloss. Philox.</sense></entryFree>
novellitas: <entryFree id="n31267" type="main" key="no^velli^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nŏvellĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n31267.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">newness, novelty</hi> (post-class.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Anim. 28</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> adv. Prax. 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
novello: <entryFree id="n31268" type="main" key="no^vello"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nŏvello</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n31268.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to till new fields, to set out new vines</hi> (post-Aug.). </sense><sense id="n31268.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">edixit ne quis in Italiā novellaret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=dom.:7" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Dom. 7</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n31268.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitam novellantes Deo,</quote> <trans><tr>dedicating, renewing by devotion</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul. Nol.</author> Carm. 21, 659</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
novellus: <entryFree id="n31269" type="main" key="no^vellus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nŏvellus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <sense id="n31269.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adj. dim.</hi> [novus], <hi rend="ital">young, new</hi> (esp. freq. in econom. lang.): <cit><quote lang="la">capra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:3" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">juvenci,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:ib. 1:20" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">boves,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:1:3" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 6, 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sues,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:211" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 37, 84, § 211</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vineae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:31:1" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 31, 1</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">arbor et novella et vetula,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:14:39" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 5, 14, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vites,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:3:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 3, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">novellae gallinae,</quote> <trans><tr>which have hatched for the first time</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:5:8" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 8, 5, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oppida,</quote> <trans><tr>newly founded</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:39:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 39, 3</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, turba, qs. <hi rend="ital">young brood</hi>, for <hi rend="ital">children</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:2:2:22" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 2, 2, 22</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum regerem tenerā frena novella manu,</quote> <trans><tr>new</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:4:12:24" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 4, 12, 24</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">subtrahere colla novella jugo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:3:7:16" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 7, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">novellum imperium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vop.</author> Tac. 1</bibl></cit>: novellas et inauditas sectas veteribus religionibus opponere, Mos. et Rom. Leg. Coll. 15, 3, 3.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">nŏvellē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">adv., newly</hi>, = nove; <cit><quote lang="la">in supposit.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 8</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n31269.1" n="II" level="1"> <pos>Subst.</pos> </sense><sense id="n31269.2" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">nŏvella</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> (sc. vitis). </sense><sense id="n31269.3" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A vine newly planted</hi>, Coripp. Johann. 3, 327.—</sense><sense id="n31269.4" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A shoot, sucker</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">filii tui sicut novellae olivarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,027:127:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Psa. 127, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n31269.5" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Nŏvellae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> (sc. constitutiones), <hi rend="ital">the Novels</hi>, a part of the Roman law published after the Codex.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n31270" type="main" key="No^vellus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Nŏvellus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n31270.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Roman surname</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Cn. et L. Gavilii Novelli, Aquileienses,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:41:5:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 41, 5, 1</bibl></cit> (but Gronov. regards it as <hi rend="ital">adj., new colonists of Aquileia;</hi> cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:34:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 40, 34, 2</bibl>).</sense></entryFree>
novem: <entryFree id="n31271" type="main" key="no^vem"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nŏvem</orth>, <sense id="n31271.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">num. adj. card</hi>. [kindred to Sanscr. navan; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">e)nne/a</foreign>; Germ. neun; Engl. nine], <hi rend="ital">nine</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">novem orbibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:6:17:17" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 6, 17, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sermo in novem et libros et dies distributus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:3:5:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 3, 5, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">milia passuum decem novem,</quote> <trans><tr>nineteen</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 8</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
november: <entryFree id="n31272" type="main" key="No^vember"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Nŏvember</orth> and <orth extent="full" lang="la">Nŏvembris</orth>, <itype>bris</itype>, <cb n="NOVE" /> <pos>adj.</pos>, with or without mensis [novem], <sense id="n31272.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the ninth month of the old Roman year</hi> (which began with March), <hi rend="ital">November</hi>: mense Octobri fecimus: Novembris reliquus erat, Cato ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 696</bibl> P.: <cit><quote lang="la">Calendis Novembribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:2:77" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 11, 2, 77</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:3:58:8" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 3, 58, 8</bibl>: implent tricenas per singula menstrua luces Junius, Aprilis et cum Septembre November, Aus. Ecl. de Dieb. Sing. Mens.</sense></entryFree>
novemdecim: <entryFree id="n31273" type="main" key="no^vemde^cim"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nŏvemdĕcim</orth>, v. novendecim.</entryFree>
novenarius: <entryFree id="n31274" type="main" key="no^ve_na_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nŏvēnārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>novem</etym>, <sense id="n31274.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">consisting of nine</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">numerus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 9:section=86" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 9, § 86</bibl></cit> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">natura,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:ib" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> Somn. Scip. 2, 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Idyll. 11</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sulcus,</quote> <trans><tr>three feet in breadth and three in depth</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 11, 15, § 77</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
novendecim: <entryFree id="n31275" type="main" key="no^vende^cim"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nŏven-dĕcim</orth> and <orth extent="full" lang="la">nŏvemdĕcim</orth>, <sense id="n31275.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">num. adj. card.</hi> [novem-decem], <hi rend="ital">nineteen</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">centum septemdecim milia trecenta novemdecim,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 24 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum annos novendecim haberet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:Epit. 18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Epit. 18</bibl></cit> Weissenb.; v. Drak. ad loc.</sense></entryFree>
novendial: <entryFree id="n31276" type="main" key="no^vendi^al"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nŏvendĭal</orth>, <itype>ālis</itype>, v. novendialis, II.</entryFree>
novendialis: <entryFree id="n31277" type="main" key="no^vendi^a_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nŏvendĭālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>novem-dies</etym>, <sense id="n31277.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">nine-day, of nine days</hi>. </sense><sense id="n31277.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">That lasts nine days, a nine-days' festival</hi>, which was solemnized on the occasion of a prodigy announcing misfortune (esp. a shower of stones): <cit><quote lang="la">novendiale sacrum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 31</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:62" default="NO" valid="yes">21, 62</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:31" default="NO" valid="yes">23, 31</bibl>; 25, 7; 26, 23; <cit><quote lang="la">27, 37 et saep.: sacrificium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:36:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 38, 36, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">novendiales feriae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:3:5:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 3, 5, 1</bibl></cit>; cf.: novendiales feriae a numero dierum sunt dictae, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=176" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 176</bibl> Müll.—</sense><sense id="n31277.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">That takes place on the ninth day;</hi> of offerings and feasts for the dead, which were celebrated on the ninth day after the funeral: novendiale dicitur sacrificium quod mortuo fit nonā die quā sepultus est, Porphyr. ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:17:49" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 17, 49</bibl>; cf.: novendialia, <foreign lang="greek">e)/nnata e)pi/ nekrou= a)go/mena</foreign>, Gloss. Philox.; cf. also <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Verg. A. 5, 64</bibl>.—These solemnities were also called, <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>, <orth extent="full" lang="la">nŏvendĭal</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>: <cit><quote lang="la">nescio utrum inveniatur, alicui sanctorum in Scripturis celebratum esse luctum novem dies, quod apud Latinos novendial appellant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Quaest. in Heptat. 1" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Quaest. in Heptat. 1</bibl></cit> Quaest. 172: <cit><quote lang="la">novendialis cena,</quote> <trans><tr>the funeral banquet held on the ninth day</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:6:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 6, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Novendiales pulveres ( = recentes),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:17:48" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 17, 48</bibl></cit>; v. Orell. ad h. 1.—Prov.: exstincto populo etiam novendialis tarde venit, said of one who brings assistance when too late, Ps.-<bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:Decl. 12:23" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> Decl. 12, 23</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
novennis: <entryFree id="n31278" type="main" key="no^vennis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nŏvennis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>novem-annus</etym>, <sense id="n31278.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of nine years</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">filius,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> Mort. Persec. 20, 4</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
novensides: <entryFree id="n31279" type="main" key="No^vensi^des"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Nŏvensĭdes</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">Nŏvensĭles</orth>, <itype>dii, ĭum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>novus-insideo</etym>, <sense id="n31279.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the new gods</hi> (those received from abroad, in opp. to indigetes, the native gods): <cit><quote lang="la">Feronia, Minerva, Novensides a Sabinis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=74" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 74</bibl></cit> Müll. <hi rend="ital">N. cr.;</hi> cf., respecting the form with <hi rend="ital">d</hi>, Mar. Victorin. p. 2470 P.: <cit><quote lang="la">Cincius numina peregrina novitate ex ipsā appellata pronuntiat,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 3, 38</bibl></cit> Orell.; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 3, 39 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>: Jane, Juppiter, Mars pater, Quirine, Bellona, Lares, Divi Novensiles, Dii Indigetes, etc., a form of prayer in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:9:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 9, 6</bibl>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 1, § 46</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
novenus: <entryFree id="n31280" type="main" key="no^ve_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nŏvēnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <sense id="n31280.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">num. adj. distr.</hi> [novem], <hi rend="ital">nine each, nine</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut virgines ter novenae per urbem euntes carmen canerent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 27, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">terga novena boūm,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:12:97" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 12, 97</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">novenorum conceptu dierum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 5, 9, § 53</bibl></cit>; in <number>sing.</number>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:1:2:4" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 1, 2, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
noverca: <entryFree id="n31281" type="main" key="no^verca"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nŏverca</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>for noverica, qs. <foreign lang="greek">nearikh/</foreign>, the new one</etym>, <sense id="n31281.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a step-mother, step-dame</hi>. </sense><sense id="n31281.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, Afran. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 393, 26</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">uxor generi, noverca filii, filiae paelex,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:70:199" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 70, 199</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum is (Hippolytus) patri suspectus esset de novercā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:25:94" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 3, 25, 94</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">saeviores tragicis novercas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:10:5" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 10, 5</bibl></cit> Spald.: <cit><quote lang="la">injusta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:3:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 3, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">saeva,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:128" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 2, 128</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">scelerata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:3:853" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 3, 853</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lurida terribiles miscent aconita novercae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:147" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 1, 147</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:Inst. 1:63" default="NO"><author>Gai.</author> Inst. 1, 63</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:3:14" default="NO">3, 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:403" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 403</bibl>.—Prov.: <cit><quote lang="la">apud novercain queri,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>in vain</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:3:80" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 1, 3, 80</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n31281.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">rerum ipsa natura in eo ... non parens sed noverca fuerit, si, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:1:2" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quorum noverca est Italia,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>who are not natives of Italy</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:4:4" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 4, 4</bibl></cit>; so, viles operae, quorum est mea Roma noverca, Petr. poët. Sat. 122, 166.— </sense><sense id="n31281.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">nŏvercae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> </sense><sense id="n31281.4" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Ditches which drain off the waler imperfectly and slowly</hi>, Agrim. ap. Goes. 119; 142; 143 al.—</sense><sense id="n31281.5" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A rough piece of land</hi> (so called <cb n="NOVI" /> in allusion to the iniquitas novercae), Hyg. Mun. Castr. § 57 Lange.</sense></entryFree>
novercalis: <entryFree id="n31282" type="main" key="no^verca_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nŏvercālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>noverca</etym>, <sense id="n31282.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to a step-mother</hi> (post-class.). </sense><sense id="n31282.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">novercales ibat venator in agros Ascanius,</quote> <trans><tr>of Dido</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:5:2:118" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 5, 2, 118</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">atque novercali sedes praelata Lavino,</quote> <trans><tr>called after Ascanius's step-mother, Lavinia</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:12:71" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 12, 71</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Mycenae,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>sacred to Juno, the stepmother of Bacchus</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:7:177" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 7, 177</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n31282.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">like a step-mother</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">hostile, malevolent</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">novercalia odia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:12:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 12, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">novercales Liviae in Agrippinam stimuli,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">novercalibus oculis aliquem intueri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Contr. 4:6" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Contr. 4, 6</bibl></cit>: erat circa illum Zenobia novercali animo, Treb. XXX. Tyrann. 16.</sense></entryFree>
novercor: <entryFree id="n31283" type="main" key="no^vercor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nŏvercor</orth>, <itype>āri</itype>, <pos>v. dep.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n31283.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to act the step-mother to, to treat with harshness</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">alicui,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 7, 14 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
novesium: <entryFree id="n31284" type="main" key="No^vesi^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Nŏvesĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n31284.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a city in</hi> Gallia Belgica, <hi rend="ital">on the Rhine</hi>, the mod. <hi rend="ital">Neuss</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 4, 26</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">33, 35</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 22</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">its fortifications were restored by Julian A. D. 359,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 18, 2, 4</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
novi: <entryFree id="n31285" type="main" key="no_vi"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nōvi</orth>, v. nosco.</entryFree>
novia: <entryFree id="n31286" type="main" key="No^vi^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Nŏvĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, v. Novius.</entryFree>
novianus: <entryFree id="n31287" type="main" key="No^vi^a_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Nŏvĭānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. Novius.</entryFree>
novicio: <entryFree id="n31288" type="main" key="no^vi_ci^o_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nŏvīcĭō</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">nŏvīt-</orth>), <pos>adv.</pos>, v. novicius <sense id="n31288.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
noviciolus: <entryFree id="n31289" type="main" key="no^vi_ci^o^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nŏvīcĭŏlus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <sense id="n31289.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adj. dim.</hi> [novicius], <hi rend="ital">rather new</hi> (post-class.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Apol. 47</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Poen. 6</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
novicius: <entryFree id="n31290" type="main" key="no^vi_ci^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nŏvīcĭus</orth> (late Lat. <orth extent="full" lang="la">-ītĭus</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>novus; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 6:section=59" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 6, § 59</bibl> Müll.</etym>, <sense id="n31290.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">new</hi> (mostly confined to technical lang.): novum novicium dicimus et proprium propicium augere atque intendere volentes novi et proprii significationem, Alfen. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:6:5:1" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 6, 5, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quaestus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:3:2:92" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 3, 2, 92</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vinum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:23:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 23, 1, 23, § 41</bibl></cit>.—Esp. freq. of slaves who have only recently lost their freedom: <cit><quote lang="la">recens captus homo, nuperus et novicius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:3:5:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 3, 5, 60</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">servi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 8:section=6" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 8, § 6</bibl></cit> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">de grege noviciorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Pis. 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">venales novicios accepimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:2:8" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 2, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">puellae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:3:5:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 3, 5, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">turba grammaticorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:11:1:5" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 11, 1, 5</bibl></cit>;
