cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">novicios philosophorum sectatores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:1:9:11" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 9, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">statuae Lupercorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 34, 5, 10, § 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">colores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 35, 6, 29, § 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jam sedet in ripā tetrumque novicius horret Porthmea,</quote> <trans><tr>newly arrived, a novice</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:3:265" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 3, 265</bibl></cit>.—As <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">nŏ-vīcĭum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> (sc. verbum), <hi rend="ital">a newly-coined word, an innovation in language</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">at noviciis nostris per quot annos sermo Latinus repugnat!</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:12:9" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 12, 9</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">nŏvīcĭō</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">nŏvīt-</orth>), <hi rend="ital">newly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">(Luci) Qui novicio capti sunt,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Verg. A. 11, 316</bibl></cit> (acc. to a conject. of Marini, Fratr. Arv. p. 309).</sense></entryFree>
novies: <entryFree id="n31291" type="main" key="no^vi^es"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nŏvĭes</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">-ĭens</orth>), <sense id="n31291.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">num. adv.</hi> [novem], <hi rend="ital">nine times</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ter novies,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:2" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 2 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">noviens Styx interfusa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:480" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 480</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">novem novies,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 58:31" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 58, 31</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
noviesdecies: <entryFree id="n31292" type="main" key="no^vi^esde^ci^es"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nŏvĭes-dĕcĭes</orth>, <sense id="n31292.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">num. adv., nineteen times</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> 1355</bibl> P.</sense></entryFree>
novilunium: <entryFree id="n31293" type="main" key="no^vi^lu_ni^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nŏvĭlūnĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>novus-luna</etym>, <sense id="n31293.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the new moon</hi> (late Lat. for nova luna; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">interlunium),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> 3</bibl></cit> Esdr. 5, 57; 9, 37 al.</sense></entryFree>
noviodunum: <entryFree id="n31294" type="main" key="No^vi^o^du_num"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Nŏvĭŏdūnum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n31294.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the name of several cities in Gaul.</hi> </sense><sense id="n31294.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A city of the Bituriges</hi>, near the mod. <hi rend="ital">Nouan</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:12:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 12, 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">7, 55</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n31294.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A city of the Æduans, on the Loire</hi>, the mod. <hi rend="ital">Nevers</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:55:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 55, 1</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n31294.3" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A city of the Suessones</hi>, the mod. <hi rend="ital">Soissons</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:12:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 12, 1</bibl></sense></entryFree>
noviomagus: <entryFree id="n31295" type="main" key="No^vio^magus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Nŏviŏmagus</orth>, v. Nivomagus.</entryFree>
novissimalis: <entryFree id="n31296" type="hapax" key="no^vissi^ma_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nŏvissĭmālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>novissimus</etym>, <sense id="n31296.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the last, final</hi>: particulae (versuum) finales seu novissimales, Mar. Victorin. p. 2519 P.</sense></entryFree>
novissime: <entryFree id="n31297" type="main" key="no^vissi^me_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nŏvissĭmē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. novus <sense id="n31297.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
novissimus: <entryFree id="n31298" type="main" key="no^vissi^mus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nŏvissĭmus</orth>, <pos>adj.</pos>, v. novus, II.</entryFree>
novitas: <entryFree id="n31299" type="main" key="no^vi^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nŏvĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>novus</etym>, <sense id="n31299.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a being new, newness, novelty</hi>. </sense><sense id="n31299.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">rei novitas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:28:60" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 28, 60</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gratiam novitati similem parant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:6:39" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 6, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">novitatis gratiā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:3:58" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 9, 3, 58</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">plus novitatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:3:74" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 8, 3, 74</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(figura) ipsā novitate ac varietate magis delectat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 9, 2</bibl></cit>. 66.—In <hi rend="ital">plur., new acquaintances, friendships</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">novitates, si spem afferunt, non sunt illae quidem repudiandae, vetustas tamen loco suo conservanda,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:19:68" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 19, 68</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">anni,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>the spring</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:1:160" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 1, 160</bibl></cit>.—Adverb.: <cit><quote lang="la">AD NOVITATEM,</quote> <trans><tr>anew, newly</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 3278</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n31299.2" n="II" level="1"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n31299.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Rareness, strangeness, unusualness</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sceleris atque periculi novitas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 4:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 4, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">perturbatis nostris novitate pugnae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:4:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 4, 34</bibl></cit>: rerum, <pb n="1220" /> <cb n="NOVU" /> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 31</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">adjuta est novitas numine nostra dei,</quote> <trans><tr>this novel attempt</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:4:13:24" default="NO"><author>id.</author> P. 4, 13, 24</bibl></cit>; so in <number>plur.</number>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Grut.</author> 337</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n31299.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">The condition of a</hi> homo novus, <hi rend="ital">newness of rank</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">novitas mea,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:1:7:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 1, 7, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">contemnunt novitatem meam, ego illorum ignaviam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 85:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 85, 14</bibl></cit> (shortly before: <cit><quote lang="la">comparate hunc cum illorum superbiā me hominem novum): quibus novitas familiae haud obstitit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:127:1" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 127, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n31299.5" n="III" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">newness, reformation</hi>. In eccl. Lat.: <cit><quote lang="la">in novitate vitae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,006:6:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Rom. 6, 4</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
noviter: <entryFree id="n31300" type="main" key="no^vi^ter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nŏvĭter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. novus <sense id="n31300.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
novitio: <entryFree id="n31301" type="main" key="no^vi_ti^o_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nŏvītĭō</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. novicius <sense id="n31301.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
novitiolus: <entryFree id="n31302" type="main" key="no^vi_ti^o^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nŏvītĭŏlus</orth>, <orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">nŏvītĭus</orth>, v. novic-.</entryFree>
novius: <entryFree id="n31303" type="main" key="No^vi^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Nŏvĭus</orth>, <itype>a</itype>, <sense id="n31303.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the name of a Roman</hi> gens. </sense><sense id="n31303.1" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Masc.</hi> </sense><sense id="n31303.2" n="1" level="3"> Novius, <hi rend="ital">a famous writer of Atellane plays, a contemporary of Pomponius, about</hi> A. U. C. 650-670: <cit><quote lang="la">Novius probatissimus Atellanarum scriptor ait, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 1, 10, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:63:255" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 63, 255</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 69, 279</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:15:13:4" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 15, 13, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:17:2:8" default="NO">17, 2, 8</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 81, 22 sq.</bibl> et saep.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Nŏvĭānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj., of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Novius</hi> (the Atellane poet), <hi rend="ital">Novian</hi>: oratiunculae, M. Aurel. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Ep. ad M. Caes. 2:13" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Ep. ad M. Caes. 2, 13</bibl> Mai.: <cit><quote lang="la">fullones,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Pall. 4</bibl></cit>; v. fullo, I.—</sense><sense id="n31303.3" n="2" level="3"> L. Novius, <hi rend="ital">a tribune of the people and enemy of Clodius</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0803,001:ad Cic. Mil. p. 47" default="NO"><author>Ascon.</author> ad Cic. Mil. p. 47</bibl> Orell.— </sense><sense id="n31303.4" n="3" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Another</hi> Novius, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:6:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 6, 40</bibl> (perh. a fictitious name, i. q. Newcomer, Upstart). —</sense><sense id="n31303.5" n="4" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A fortune-hunter</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:12:111" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 12, 111</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n31303.6" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Fem.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Nŏvĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <hi rend="ital">the wife of Oppianicus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:9:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 9, 27</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
novo: <entryFree id="n31304" type="main" key="no^vo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nŏvo</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>novus</etym>. <sense id="n31304.0" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to make new, to renew</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ipsi transtra novant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:752" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 752</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nullā prole novare viros,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:1:622" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 1, 622</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gregem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:10:229" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 10, 229</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fessa membra,</quote> <trans><tr>to refresh</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:4:90" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 4, 90</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vivāque nitentia lymphā membra novat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:3:423" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 3, 423</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ardorem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:19:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 26, 19, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vulnera mentis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:4:11:20" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 4, 11, 20</bibl></cit>; <hi rend="ital">to break up fallow ground</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">novate novale,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,049:4:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Jer. 4, 3</bibl></cit>: ager novatus, <hi rend="ital">a field ploughed again, prepared for sowing</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">agro non semel arato sed novato et iterato,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:30:131" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 30, 131</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:4:2:44" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 4, 2, 44</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">To invent, coin</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">verba,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:37:149" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 37, 149</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 38, 154</bibl>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">verbum aut inusitatum aut novatum aut translatum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 38, 152</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">multa novantur in omni genere materiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:10:106" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 10, 106</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">novata forma dicendi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:1:14" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 9, 1, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ignotum hoc aliis ipse novavit opus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:3:346" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 3, 346</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n31304.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to change, alter.</hi> </sense><sense id="n31304.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid in legibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:3:5:12" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 3, 5, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nomen faciemque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:540" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 540</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc quoque novat (Aristoteles), quod prooemio non narrationem subjungit, sed propositionem,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>deviates from the rule</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:9:5" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 3, 9, 5</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n31304.3" n="B" level="2"> In partic., in a political respect: novare res, <hi rend="ital">to alter the existing constitution, to overthrow the government, make</hi> or <hi rend="ital">effect a revolution</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">res,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 52</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">novandi res aliquam occasionem quaerentes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:23:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 24, 23, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnia novare velle,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:35:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 35, 34</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:32:38" default="NO" valid="yes">32, 38</bibl> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Civilis novare res hoc modo coepit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 4, 14</bibl></cit>.—Also <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">novare: ubi primum dubiis rebus novandi spes oblata est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 39:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 39, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 42, 31</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 18</bibl>; cf. <hi rend="ital">impers. pass.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne quid eo spatio novaretur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 55:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 55, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
novocomensis: <entryFree id="n31305" type="main" key="No^vo^co_mensis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Nŏvŏcōmensis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, v. Comum.</entryFree>
novomagus: <entryFree id="n31306" type="main" key="Novomagus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Novomagus</orth>, v. Nivomagus.</entryFree>
novum: <entryFree id="n31307" type="main" key="No^vum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Nŏvum Cōmum</orth>, v. Comum.</entryFree>
novus: <entryFree id="n31308" type="main" key="no^vus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nŏvus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>Sanscr. navas; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">ne/os</foreign>, i. e. <foreign lang="greek">nevos</foreign>; cf.: noverca, nuntius, denuo, nuper; Germ. neu; Engl. new</etym>, <sense id="n31308.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">new, not old, young, fresh, recent</hi>, etc. (v. antiquus <hi rend="ital">init.</hi>; cf.: recens, novellus). </sense><sense id="n31308.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n31308.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">civitates condere novas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:7:12" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 7, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nova et a nobis inventa ratio,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 8, 13</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil novi vobis afferam neque quod a me sit cogitatum aut inventum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 14, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">novus veteri exercitus jungitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 7</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">miles,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 87:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 87, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">imperator,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:ib. 44:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 44, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">novum de integro proelium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 24, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Camillus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 22, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">consules,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:15" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">serpens,</quote> <trans><tr>which has cast its old skin</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:266" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 9, 266</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caro,</quote> <trans><tr>fresh meat</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:11:85" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 11, 85</bibl></cit>.—Special phrases. </sense><sense id="n31308.3" n="1" level="3"> Novae tabernae, or simply Novae (sub Novis), <hi rend="ital">the new shops; many of the shops of the money-changers in the Forum were burned down</hi> A. U. C. 543, <hi rend="ital">and those built on their sites were called</hi> Novae, <hi rend="ital">those which remained standing</hi> Veteres (v. vetus), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 26, 27</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:48" default="NO" valid="yes">3, 48</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sub Novis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:66:266" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 66, 266</bibl></cit>; cf.: sub Novis dicta pars in foro aedificiorum,<cb n="NOVU" />  quod vocabulum ei pervetustum, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 6:section=59" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 6, § 59</bibl> Müll.—</sense><sense id="n31308.4" n="2" level="3"> Novae tabulae, <hi rend="ital">new account-books</hi>, by making which old debts were cancelled, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:23:84" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 2, 23, 84</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:6:4:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 6, 4, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:5:21:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 5, 21, 13</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">14, 21, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 21</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tum Catilina polliceri tabulas novas, proscriptionem locupletium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 21:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 21, 2</bibl></cit>.—Hence, trop.: <cit><quote lang="la">beneficiorum novae tabulae,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>forgetfulness of benefits</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 1:4:6" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 1, 4, 6</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n31308.5" n="3" level="3"> Novus homo, or homo novus, <hi rend="ital">the first of his family who obtained a curule office, a man newly ennobled, an upstart</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:39:138" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 39, 138</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">adeptus es, quod non multi homines novi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:18:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 5, 18, 1</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">in Q. Pompeio, novo homine et fortissimo viro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:7:16 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mur. 7, 16 sq.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">M. Catoni, homini ignoto et novo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:1:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 1, 1</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">hic novus Arpinas, ignobilis, et modo Romae Municipalis eques,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:8:237" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 8, 237</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nova nupta,</quote> <trans><tr>a bride</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:2:120" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 2, 120</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Plur. subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">nŏvi</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">recent writers</hi>: est et quod appellatur a novis <foreign lang="greek">no/hma</foreign>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:5:12" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 5, 12</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">novorum lectio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:5:26" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 5, 26</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:4:1" default="NO">5, 4, 1</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n31308.6" n="4" level="3"> Novae res, <hi rend="ital">new things, novelties</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil te ad me postea scripsisse demiror, praesertim tam novis rebus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:18:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 7, 18, 4</bibl></cit>.—Also <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">nŏvum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a new thing, a novelty; news</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">novum attulerint, quod fit nusquam gentium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:prol. 70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. prol. 70</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">num quidnam inquit novi?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:3:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 3, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si quid novi vel sero invenissem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:5:3" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 5, 3</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">novorum interpositione priora confundere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:3:32" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 3, 32</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:3:60" default="NO">8, 3, 60</bibl>.—But, in gen., novae res signifies <hi rend="ital">political innovations, a revolution</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Q. Servilius Ahala Sp. Maelium novis rebus studentem manu suā occidit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:1:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 1, 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rerum novarum causam quaerere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:33:91" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 2, 33, 91</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">plebes novarum rerum cupida,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 28:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 28, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cuncta plebes novarum rerum studio Catilinae incepta probabat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:ib. 37:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 37, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">novarum rerum avidi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 19:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> J. 19, 1</bibl></cit>.—In a double sense: Segulium neglegamus, qui res novas quaerit: non quo veterem comederit—nullam enim habuit—sed hanc ipsam recentem novam devorārit, <hi rend="ital">innovations</hi> and <hi rend="ital">new wealth</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:11:21:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 11, 21, 2</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n31308.7" n="B" level="2"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n31308.8" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">New, novel, strange, singular, unusual, unheard of</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">flagitia ingentia, nova, capitalia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:4:7:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 4, 7, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil dicam aut inauditum vobis aut cuiquam novum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:31:137" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 31, 137</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">novum crimen et ante hunc diem inauditum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,033:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Lig. 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nova tibi haec sunt et inopinata?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:8:section=24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 8, § 24</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:6:1:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 6, 1, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">novam in feminā virtutem novo genere honoris donavere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 13</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:591" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 591</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nova monstra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 2, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si res agi videtur nova, magna, atrox,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:1:33" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 4, 1, 33</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n31308.9" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">New</hi> in any thing, <hi rend="ital">unused, unaccustomed, inexperienced</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose): <cit><quote lang="la">et rudis ad partus et nova miles oram,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:11:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 11, 48</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n31308.10" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">novus dolori,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:6:254" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 6, 254</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> Agr. 16</bibl>.—* </sense><sense id="n31308.11" n="(g)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nova ferre jugum cervix,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:16:332" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 16, 332</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n31308.12" n="3" level="3"> Nova Via structa esse dicitur regnante Ser. Tullio, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=174" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 174</bibl> Mull.; v. Müll. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=389" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> p. 389</bibl>, a; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">vocabulum pervetustum ut Novae viae, quae via jam diu vetus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 6:section=59" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 6, § 59</bibl></cit> Müll.—</sense><sense id="n31308.13" n="4" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Recent</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tu cognovisti omnia, novissima et antiqua,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,027:138:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Psa. 138, 5</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n31308.14" n="C" level="2"> In eccl. Lat., <hi rend="ital">renewed by grace</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nova creatura,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,008:5:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 2 Cor. 5, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">induite novum hominem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,010:4:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> Eph. 4, 24</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n31308.15" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, in the <hi rend="ital">sup.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">nŏvissĭmus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">the latest, last, hindermost, extreme</hi> (syn.: <cit><quote lang="la">extremus, proximus, recentissimus): a quo (sc. novo) etiam extremum novissimum quoque dici coeptum vulgo, quod meā memoriā ut Aelius sic senes aliquot, nimium novum verbum quod esset, vitabant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 6:section=59" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 6, § 59</bibl></cit> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">histriones,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,003:11:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Com. 11, 30</bibl></cit>; Brut. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:11:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 11, 1, 3</bibl>; Cass. <bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 12, 13, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui ex iis novissimus venit, necatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 56</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">novissimum agmen,</quote> <trans><tr>the rear</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 15</bibl></cit>; 7, 68. —So as <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">nŏvissĭmi</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <hi rend="ital">the rear of an army, the soldiers in the last line</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">novissimis praesidio esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">novissimos adorti magnam multitudinem conciderunt,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dixitque novissima verba,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:650" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 650</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">novissima cauda,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>the end of</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:681" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 681</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">13, 963</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">luna,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 13, 10, § 56</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n31308.16" n="2" level="3"> Like Engl. <hi rend="ital">last, extreme, highest</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">exempla,</quote> <trans><tr>the extreme penalty, the penalty of death</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:12:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 12, 20</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">15, 44</bibl>; and <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">a summā spe, novissima exspectabat,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">novissimum casum experitur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 12, 33</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n31308.17" n="B" level="2"> Esp. in eccl. <cb n="NOX" /> Lat. </sense><sense id="n31308.18" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Youngest</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">liberorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,006:6:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Jos. 6, 26</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n31308.19" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Lowest</hi> in rank or fortune: <cit><quote lang="la">de novissimis populi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,013:13:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 3 Reg. 13, 33</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n31308.20" n="3" level="3"> As <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi> </sense><sense id="n31308.21" n="a" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">Sing.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">nŏvissĭmum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the end.</hi> </sense><sense id="n31308.22" n="(a)" level="5"> Of place: <cit><quote lang="la">terrae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,023:3:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 1 Macc. 3, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">a summo ad novissimum,</quote> <trans><tr>the bottom</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,048:56:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Isa. 56, 11</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n31308.23" n="(b)" level="5"> Of time: <cit><quote lang="la">habent spem in novissimo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,029:23:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Prov. 23, 18</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n31308.24" n="b" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">nŏvissĭma</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> </sense><sense id="n31308.25" n="(a)" level="5"> Of place, <hi rend="ital">the bottom, depths</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">abyssi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Job. 38, 16</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n31308.26" n="(b)" level="5"> Of time: <cit><quote lang="la">habebis in novissimis spem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,029:24:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Prov. 24, 14</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">novissima hominis illius,</quote> <trans><tr>the end</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,003:11:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Luc. 11, 26</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <pos>adv.</pos> (not in Cic.) in two forms. </sense><sense id="n31308.27" n="(a)" level="5"> Form <orth extent="full" lang="la">nŏvē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">newly, in a new</hi> or <hi rend="ital">unusual manner</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ornata ut lepide! ut concinne! ut nove!</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:2:2:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ep. 2, 2, 38</bibl></cit>: ne quid ambigue, ne quid nove dicamus, * <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 1, 9, 15</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">verba nove aut insigniter dicta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:19:7:2" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 19, 7, 2</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:17:2:13" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 17, 2, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Contr. 1:4" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Contr. 1, 4 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>—</sense><sense id="n31308.28" n="(b)" level="5"> Form <orth extent="full" lang="la">nŏvĭter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">newly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">BASILICA IVLIA A SE NOVITER REPARATA,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 24</bibl></cit> (A. D. 377): <cit><quote lang="la">amor noviter venit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Fulg.</author> Myth. 3, 1 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit>—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">nŏvissĭmē</orth>. </sense><sense id="n31308.29" n="a" level="4"> Of time, <hi rend="ital">recently, lately, a short time ago</hi>: mater cum novissime aegrotāsset, Val. Antias. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 186</bibl> P.: <cit><quote lang="la">quod novissime nobiscum foedus fecissent,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">novissime, memoriā nostrā, argentum aere solutum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 33:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 33, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">liber quem novissime tibi misi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:8:3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 8, 3, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eloquendi rationem novissime repertam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12 praef" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12 praef.</bibl></cit> § 3.—</sense><sense id="n31308.30" n="b" level="4"> Of succession, <hi rend="ital">lastly, last of all, finally</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">dicam primum ... deinde ... novissime,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ira, 3:5:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ira, 3, 5, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">primum ... post haec ... novissime,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:6:24" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 3, 6, 24</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">primum ... post haec ... novissime,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:2:41" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 11, 2, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vel ... vel ... vel novissime,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:1:37" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 7, 1, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">et ... et ... et novissime,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:4:10" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 4, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum plura interrogāsset ... novissime id inferebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:11:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 5, 11, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">novissime cum, etc. (= postremo),</quote> <trans><tr>in the last fight</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0530,001:B. G. 8:48:3" default="NO"><author>Hirt.</author> B. G. 8, 48, 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
nox: <entryFree id="n31309" type="main" key="nox"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nox</orth>, <itype>noctis</itype> (collat. form of the <case>abl.</case> noctu; <sense id="n31309.0" n="I" level="1"><xr><lbl>v.</lbl> <ref type="sym" targOrder="U">in the foll.</ref></xr>: nox, adverb. for nocte; v. <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>), <gen>f.</gen> (once <hi rend="ital">masc.</hi> in Cato; <xr><lbl>v.</lbl> <ref type="sym" targOrder="U">infra</ref></xr>, I.) [Sanscr. nak, naktis, night; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">nu/c</foreign>; Germ. Nacht; Engl. night; from root naç; cf. neco, <foreign lang="greek">ne/kus</foreign>], <hi rend="ital">night</hi>. </sense><sense id="n31309.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: hinc nox processit stellis ardentibus apta, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 6, 1</bibl> (Ann. v. 343 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">ipsa umbra terrae soli officiens noctem efficit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:19:49" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 19, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">negat ullum esse cibum tam gravem, quin is die et nocte concoquatur,</quote> <trans><tr>in a day and a night, in twenty-four hours</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 9, 24</bibl></cit> (v. dies, I. B. 2.): <cit><quote lang="la">quod serenā nocte subito candens et plena luna defecisset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:15:23" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 15, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dinumerationibus noctium ac dierum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 2, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Milo mediā nocte in campum venit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:4:3:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 4, 3, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omni nocte dieque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:3:105" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 3, 105</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de nocte,</quote> <trans><tr>by night</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:33:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mur. 33, 69</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">multā de nocte profectus est,</quote> <trans><tr>late at night</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:7:4:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 7, 4, 2</bibl></cit>; and: <cit><quote lang="la">vigilare de nocte,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:9:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mur. 9, 22</bibl></cit> (v. de, I. B. 2.): <cit><quote lang="la">multā nocte veni ad Pompeium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:2:9:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 2, 9, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui ad multam noctem vigilāssem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:6:10:10" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 6, 10, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad multam noctem pugnatum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sub noctem naves solvit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 1, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">noctes et dies urgeri,</quote> <trans><tr>night and day</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:61:260" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 61, 260</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">qui (scrupulus) se dies noctesque stimulat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 2, 6</bibl></cit> et saep. (v. dies, I. B. 2.): <cit><quote lang="la">concubiā nocte visum esse in somnis ei, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:27:57" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 1, 27, 57</bibl></cit> (v. concubius).—</sense><sense id="n31309.2" n="(b)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Abl.</hi> noctu: hac noctu filo pendebit Etruria tota, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 1, 4</bibl> (Ann. v. 153 Vahl.); so, <cit><quote lang="la">hac noctu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 1</bibl></cit>. 116: <cit><quote lang="la">noctu hac,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:4:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 2, 4, 28</bibl></cit>: noctu concubiā, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 1, 4</bibl> (Ann. v. 169 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">senatus de noctu convenire, noctu multā domum dimitti, Quadrig. ib.: ergo noctu futura, cum media esse coeperit, auspicium Saturnaliorum erit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 1, 4 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>—Once <hi rend="ital">masc.</hi> (as in cum primo lucu; <cit><quote lang="la">v. lux): in sereno noctu,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 156, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n31309.3" n="2" level="3"> In partic., personified: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Nox</orth>, <hi rend="ital">the goddess of Night, the sister of Erebus, and by him the mother of Æther and Hemera</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:17:44" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 17, 44</bibl>; Hyg. Fab. prooem.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:721" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 721</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Verg. A. 6, 250</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:2:1:87" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 2, 1, 87</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:3:4" default="NO">3, 4</bibl> 17; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:1:455" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 1, 455</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:3:211" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 3, 211</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:2:59" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 2, 59</bibl> et saep.—</sense><sense id="n31309.4" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n31309.5" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">That which takes place</hi> or <hi rend="ital">is done at night, nightdoings, night-work</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-class. prose): <cit><quote lang="la">omnis et insanā semita nocte sonat,</quote> <trans><tr>nocturnal noise, a revelling by night</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:5:8:60" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 5, 8, 60</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:2:219" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 2, 219</bibl>.—Hence, Noctes Atticae, <hi rend="ital">the title of a work of Gellius, which he wrote at Athens by night</hi>, Gell. praef.—</sense><sense id="n31309.6" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Sleep, a dream</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): pectore noctem Accipit,<pb n="1221" /> <cb n="NOXA" />  <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:530" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 530</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">talia vociferans noctem exturbabat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:10:219" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 10, 219</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">abrupere oculi noctem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 9, 599</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:3:216" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 3, 216</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n31309.7" n="3" level="3"> In mal. part., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:2:1:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 2, 1, 21</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:1:3:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> As. 1, 3, 42</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:16:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 1, 16, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:15:13" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 15, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:1:69" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 1, 69</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:12:3" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 12, 3</bibl> et saep.; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">nox vidua,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:6:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 6, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:19:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 19, 69</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n31309.8" n="4" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Death</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">omnes una manet nox,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:28:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 28, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jam te premet nox fabulaeque Manes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 4, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in aeternam clauduntur lumina noctem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:746" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 746</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n31309.9" n="5" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Darkness, obscurity, the gloom of tempest</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae lucem eriperet et quasi noctem quandam rebus offunderet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:3:6" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 1, 3, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">carcer infernus et perpetuā nocte oppressa regio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 82:16" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 82, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">taetrā nimborum nocte coörtā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:172" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 172</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">imber Noctem hiememque ferens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:194" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 194</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">venturam melius praesagit navita noctem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4:10:5" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4, 10, 5</bibl></cit> (mortem, Müll.).—Hence, <usg type="style">poet.</usg>, of <hi rend="ital">clouds</hi> of missiles, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:7:520" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 7, 520</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:7:598" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 7, 598</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">veteris sub nocte cupressi,</quote> <trans><tr>the shadow</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:1:774" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 774</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n31309.10" n="6" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Blindness</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">perpetuāque trahens inopem sub nocte senectam Phineus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 2</bibl></cit>: ego vero non video, nox oboritur, Sen. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:2:43" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 2, 43</bibl>: vultus perpetuā nocte coöpertus, Ps.-<bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:Decl. 1:6" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> Decl. 1, 6</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n31309.11" n="7" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">The shades below, the infernal regions</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">descendere nocti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:13:708" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 13, 708</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">noctis arbiter,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Pluto</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Rapt. Pros. 1, 55</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n31309.12" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n31309.13" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Darkness, confusion, gloomy condition</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">doleo me in hanc rei publicae noctem incidisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:96:330" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 96, 330</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">rei publicae offusa sempiterna nox esset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:32:91" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 32, 91</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nox ingens scelerum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:7:571" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 7, 571</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n31309.14" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Mental darkness, ignorance</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">quantum mortalia pectora caecae Noctis habent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:472" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 472</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n31309.15" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Obscurity, unintelligibility</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mei versus aliquantum noctis habebunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:63" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Ib. 63</bibl></cit>.— <itype>Hence</itype>, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">nocte</orth>, <orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">noctū</orth> (cf. diu), and <orth extent="full" lang="la">nox</orth>, <hi rend="ital">in the night, at night, by night</hi>. </sense><sense id="n31309.16" n="(a)" level="5"> Form nocte (rare but class.): <cit><quote lang="la">luce noctem, nocte lucem exspectatis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 4, 36, 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in campum nocte venire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:4:3:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 4, 3, 4</bibl></cit> (shortly after: <cit><quote lang="la">in Comitium Milo de nocte venit): nec discernatur, interdiu nocte pugnent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 34 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:32:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 21, 32, 10</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">nec nocte nec interdiu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 47</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:3:127:198" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 3, 127, 198</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">velut nocte in ignotis locis errans,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 7</bibl></cit> prol. 3.—</sense><sense id="n31309.17" n="(b)" level="5"> Form noctu (so most freq.): ob Romam noctu legiones ducere coepit, Enn. ap. Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=179" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 179</bibl> Müll. (Ann. v. 295 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">noctuque et diu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:4:4:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 4, 4, 5</bibl></cit>; so, noctu diuque, Titin. and Sall. Hist. Fragm. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 185</bibl> P.; cf.: nec noctu nec diu, Plaut. Fragm. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 98, 27</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">continuum diu noctuque iter properabant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:15:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 15, 12 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quā horā, noctu an interdiu,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 2, 4, 7</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">nonnumquam interdiu, saepius noctu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 8 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">noctu ambulabat in publico Themistocles,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:19:44" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 4, 19, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">noctu ad oppidum respicientes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:32:69" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 1, 32, 69</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:14:7:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 14, 7, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">noctu Jugurthae milites introducit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 12:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 12, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">noctu profugere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:ib. 106:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 106, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dum noctu stertit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 2, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">noctu litigare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:35" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 35</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:605" default="NO">605</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:14:306" default="NO">14, 306</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n31309.18" n="(g)" level="5"> Form nox (cf. pernox, and the Gr. <foreign lang="greek">nukto/s</foreign>, only ante-class.): SI NOX FVRTVM FACTVM SIT, Fragm. XII. Tab. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 1, 4 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">hinc media remis Palinurum pervenio nox,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0043,001:Sat. 3:22" default="NO"><author>Lucil.</author> Sat. 3, 22</bibl></cit>: quin tu hic manes? <hi rend="ital">Arg.</hi> Nox si voles manebo, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:3:3:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 3, 3, 7</bibl> Ussing (al. mox); cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:4:2:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Trin. 4, 2, 22</bibl> Brix, Krit. Anh. and Ritschl, ed. 2: si luci, si nox, si mox, si jam data sit frux, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 724</bibl> P. (Ann. v. 412 Vahl.); cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:12:1" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 12, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
noxa: <entryFree id="n31310" type="main" key="noxa"><orth extent="full" lang="la">noxa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>for noc-sa, from noc-eo, like rixa from ringor</etym>, <sense id="n31310.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">hurt, harm, injury</hi>, which one does or suffers (v. Döderl. Synon. 2, p. 153 sqq.; not in Cic., but cf. noxia; syn.: injuria, contumelia). </sense><sense id="n31310.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: QVANDOQVE HICE HOMINES ... NOXAM NOCVERVNT, an old fetial formula in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 10 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; so, too, perhaps, SI SERVVS FVRTVM FAXIT NOXAMVE NOCVIT, Fragm. XII. Tab. in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:9:4:2:section=1" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 9, 4, 2, § 1</bibl> (al. NOXIAMVE): <cit><quote lang="la">servus, qui noxam nocuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:35:2:63" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 35, 2, 63</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si eadem (terra) ad noxam genuit aliqua,</quote> <trans><tr>injurious</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:158" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 63, 63, § 158</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tristes pellere a foribus noxas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:6:129" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 6, 129</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ab noxā curculionum conditas fruges defendere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:1:6:15" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 1, 6, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil eam rem noxae faturam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 34, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rempublicam non extra noxam modo, sed etiam extra famam noxae conservandam esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 34, 61</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sine ullius noxā urbis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:36:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 36, 21</bibl></cit>: prava incepta consultoribus noxae esse, Sall. Or. Phil. <cb n="NOXI" /> contr. Lep.: <cit><quote lang="la">sine ullā noxā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:7:26:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 7, 26, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">veram noxam concipere,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>sickness</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:3:7" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 3, 7</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n31310.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n31310.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">An injurious act</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">a fault, offence, crime</hi>, = delictum: <cit><quote lang="la">noxae appellatione omne delictum continetur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:50:16:238:section=3" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 50, 16, 238, § 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem tenere in noxā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:2:8:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 2, 8, 71</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hic in noxā est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:2:1:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 2, 1, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in noxā esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:32:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 32, 26</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:4" default="NO" valid="yes">7, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">noxae damnatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 8, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">reus ejus noxae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">capitalis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 3, 55</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">neve ea caedes capitalis noxae haberetur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 3, 55</bibl></cit>: qui in furto aut in latrocinio aut aliquā noxā sint comprehensi, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 6, 16</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">graviorem noxam fateri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:2:9:72" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 2, 9, 72</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">noxa caput sequitur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul.</author> Sent. 2, 31, 8 sq.</bibl></cit>; cf. also Paul. ex Fest. under noxia <hi rend="ital">init.</hi>—</sense><sense id="n31310.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Punishment</hi> (not ante-Aug.; <cit><quote lang="la">most freq. in jurid. Lat.): noxam merere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:28:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 28, 8</bibl></cit> Drak.: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem noxā pecuniāque exsolvere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:14:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 23, 14, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:59:6" default="NO" valid="yes">2, 59, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:29:4" default="NO" valid="yes">26, 29, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">noxae dedere aliquem,</quote> <trans><tr>to deliver one up for punishment</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:4:3:9" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 4, 3, 9</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:7:1:17:section=2" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 7, 1, 17, § 2</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:9:4:19" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 9, 4, 19</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">hence: mergi freto, satius illi insulae (Siciliae) esse, quam velut dedi noxae inimico,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:29:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 26, 29, 4</bibl></cit>; and: <cit><quote lang="la">rem rusticam pessimo cuique servorum, ut carnifici noxae dedimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 1</bibl></cit> prooem.: <cit><quote lang="la">quod ajunt aediles: noxā solutus non sit (servus) sic intellegendum est, ut non hoc debeat pronuntiari, nullam eum noxam commisisse, sed illud, noxā solutum esse, hoc est noxali judicio subjectum non esse: ergo si noxam commisit nec permanet, noxā solutus videtur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:21:1:17:section=17" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 21, 1, 17, § 17</bibl></cit>: non noxae eximitur Q. Fabius, qui contra edictum imperatoris pugnavit; <cit><quote lang="la">sed, noxae damnatus, donatur populo Romano,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:35:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 35, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">noxae accipere aliquem,</quote> <trans><tr>to receive one for the purpose of punishing him</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:7:1:17:section=2" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 7, 1, 17, § 2</bibl></cit>.— —</sense><sense id="n31310.5" n="C" level="2"> Concr., <hi rend="ital">that which commits an offence, an offender, criminal</hi> (jurid. Lat.): noxa est corpus, quod nocuit, id est servus; <cit><quote lang="la">noxia ipsum maleficium, veluti furtum, damnum, rapina, injuria,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:Inst. 4:8:1" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> Inst. 4, 8, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aut noxiam sarcire aut noxam dedere oportet,</quote> <trans><tr>the guilty thing</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:9:1:1:section=11" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 9, 1, 1, § 11</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">noxae deditio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:9:4:4" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 9, 4, 4</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
noxalis: <entryFree id="n31311" type="main" key="noxa_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">noxālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>noxa</etym>, <sense id="n31311.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">relating to an injury</hi> (jurid. Lat.): noxalis actio, <hi rend="ital">an action on account of an injury committed</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">noxales actiones appellantur, quae non ex contractu, sed ex noxā atque maleficio servorum adversus nos instituuntur. Quarum actionum vis et potestas haec est, ut, si damnati fuerimus, liceat nobis deditione ipsius corporis, quod deliquit, evitare litis aestimationem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:9:4" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 9, 4</bibl></cit> (de noxalibus actionibus), 1; so, <cit><quote lang="la">causa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:9:4" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 9, 4 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">judicium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:9:2" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 9, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:8" default="NO">8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:27" default="NO">27</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:Inst. 1:140 sq" default="NO"><author>Gai.</author> Inst. 1, 140 sq.</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul.</author> Sent. 2, 31, 7</bibl> et saep.—As <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">noxāle</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">an action on account of an injury</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">si noxali velit actor experiri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:9:4:21:section=6" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 9, 4, 21, § 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">noxali condemnatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:42:1:4" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 42, 1, 4 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
noxia: <entryFree id="n31312" type="main" key="noxi^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">noxĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, v. noxius, II.</entryFree>
noxialis: <entryFree id="n31313" type="main" key="noxi^a_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">noxĭālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>noxia</etym>, <sense id="n31313.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">injurious, noxious</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">lex noxialis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Cath. 9, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">carcer,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 14, 1107</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
noxietas: <entryFree id="n31314" type="main" key="noxi^e^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">noxĭĕtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>noxius</etym>, <sense id="n31314.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">guilt, crime</hi> (post-class.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Apol. 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
noxiosus: <entryFree id="n31315" type="main" key="noxi^o_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">noxĭōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>noxia</etym> (postAug.). <sense id="n31315.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Very hurtful, injurious</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">noxious</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">res,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 7:10:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 7, 10, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">noxiosissimo animali (al. noxissimo s. noxiissimo),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Clem. 1:26:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Clem. 1, 26, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n31315.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Full of guilt, vicious, sinful</hi>: animi perditi noxiosique, v. l. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 70:23" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 70, 23</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">noxiosissimum corpus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 130, 7</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
noxitudo: <entryFree id="n31316" type="hapax" key="noxi^tu_do"><orth extent="full" lang="la">noxĭtūdo</orth>, <itype>ĭnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>noxa</etym>, <sense id="n31316.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">guilt, offence, crime</hi>: Pelopidarum, Att. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 143, 22</bibl> (Trag. Rel. v. 162 Rib.).</sense></entryFree>
noxius: <entryFree id="n31317" type="main" key="noxi^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">noxĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> (<sense id="n31317.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">comp.</hi> noxior, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Clem. 1:13:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Clem. 1, 13, 2</bibl> dub.; al. obnoxior.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi> noxissimus or noxiissimus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Clem. 1:26:3" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Clem. 1, 26, 3</bibl> dub.; better, noxiosissimus) [id.]. </sense><sense id="n31317.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Hurtful, harmful, injurious, noxious</hi> (used by Cic. only in archaic lang.; <xr><lbl>v.</lbl> <ref type="sym" targOrder="U">the foll.</ref></xr>): <cit><quote lang="la">MAGISTRATVS NECOBEDIENTEM ET NOXIVM CIVEM MVLTA COERCETO,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:3:3:6" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 3, 3, 6</bibl></cit> (araneus) aculeo noxius, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:155" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 48, 72, § 155</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">afflatus maris (opp. utiles),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 17, 4, 2, § 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tela,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:5:10:22" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 5, 10, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">terrae halitus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:2:3" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 7, 2, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lingua,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:2:61:7" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 2, 61, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aves,</quote> <trans><tr>rapacious</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:10:5:12" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 10, 5, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">crimina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:326" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 326</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n31317.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Guilty, culpable, criminal</hi>: dictum oportuit. <hi rend="ital">Lys.</hi> Non possum, ita instas; <cit><quote lang="la">urges quasi pro noxio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:4:3:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. 4, 3, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nobilitas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui citati non affuerant, noxios judicavit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 39, 41</bibl></cit>: corda, <cb n="NUBE" /> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:10:351" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 10, 351</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnibus omnium rerum noxior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Clem. 1:13:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Clem. 1, 13, 2</bibl></cit>: reducto comā capite, ceu noxii solent, <hi rend="ital">culprits, criminals</hi> (esp. those condemned to be thrown to wild beasts), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vit.:17" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vit. 17</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:27" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Calig. 27</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:34" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Claud. 34</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:12" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ner. 12</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n31317.3" n="(b)" level="5"> With <case>abl.</case>: <cit><quote lang="la">Falisci, eodem noxii crimine,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:20:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 20, 9</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n31317.4" n="(g)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">noxius conjurationis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:5:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 5, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">facinoris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:29:5:3:section=12" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 29, 5, 3, § 12</bibl></cit>.— Esp. as <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">noxĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">hurt, harm, damage, injury</hi> (class.; syn. noxa). </sense><sense id="n31317.5" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: noxia, ut Serv. Sulpicius Rufus ait, damnum significat, apud poëtas autem et oratores ponitur pro culpā, at noxa peccatum, aut pro peccato poenam, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=174" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 174</bibl> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">in re incipiundā ad defendendam noxiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:1:4:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 1, 4, 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si ab eo fides sibi data esset, haud futurum noxiae futurum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:18:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 18, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sive ullius eorum quos oderat noxia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:41:23:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 41, 23, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">veneficiorum noxia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:108" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 21, 17, 68, § 108</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vini,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:100" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 14, 16, 19, § 100</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n31317.6" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">an injurious act, a fault, offence, trespass</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">noxa est corpus, quod nocuit id est servus: noxia ipsum maleficium, veluti furtum, damnum, rapina, injuria,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:Inst. 4:8:1" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> Inst. 4, 8, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Tranioni remitte, quaeso, hanc noxiam causā meā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:5:2:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 5, 2, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">manufestum teneo in noxiā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:4:3:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Merc. 4, 3, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">noxiā carere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:4:9:87" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Bacch. 4, 9, 87</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">noxiis vacuum esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:5:4:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Merc. 5, 4, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in noxiā esse,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 3, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amicum castigare ob meritam noxiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:1:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Trin. 1, 1, 1</bibl></cit> and 4: <cit><quote lang="la">quod in minimis noxiis et in his levioribus peccatis id primum quaeritur, quae causa maleficii fuerit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:22:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 22, 62</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si qua clades incidisset, desertori magis, quam deserto noxiae fore,</quote> <trans><tr>the blame would fall on</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 10, 19</bibl></cit>: metum prorsus et noxiam conscientiae pro foedere haberi, <hi rend="ital">fear and guilt served the participants as an agreement</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">brought them to an agreement</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:6:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 6, 4</bibl>. —Hence, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">noxĭē</orth> (post-class.), <hi rend="ital">injuriously, perniciously</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">multos petulca confoderat,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sulp.</author> Sev. Dial. 2, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Conf. 1:7" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Conf. 1, 7</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
nuba: <entryFree id="n31318" type="main" key="Nuba"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Nuba</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, v. Nubae <sense id="n31318.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
nubae: <entryFree id="n31319" type="main" key="Nu_bae"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Nūbae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*nou=bai</foreign>, <sense id="n31319.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a people of Africa, to the south of Egypt, the Nubians</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:3:269" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 3, 269</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:7:664" default="NO">7, 664</bibl>.—Also called <orth extent="full" lang="la">Nūbei</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:192" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 30, 35, § 192</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n31319.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A people of Arabia and Syria</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:142" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 28, 32, § 142</bibl>. —In <number>sing.</number>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Nūba</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Stil. 1, 252</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
nubecula: <entryFree id="n31320" type="main" key="nu_be_cu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nūbēcŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>nubes</etym>, <sense id="n31320.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a little cloud</hi>. </sense><sense id="n31320.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:356" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 35, 82, § 356</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n31320.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">something cloudy</hi> or <hi rend="ital">dark, a dark spot</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mala urina, in quā veluti furfures atque nubeculae apparent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 28, 6, 19, § 68</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">smaragdi variā nubeculā improbati,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 37, 5, 18, § 68</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nubeculae et caligationes suffusionesque oculorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:29:123" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 29, 6, 38, § 123</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:61" default="NO" valid="yes">20, 7, 26, § 61</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n31320.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a gloomy expression of countenance</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">frontis tuae nubecula,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:9:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Pis. 9, 20</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
