nubes: <entryFree id="n31321" type="main" key="nu_bes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nūbes</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> (ante-class. collat. form, <orth extent="full" lang="la">nūbis</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>: <sense id="n31321.0" n="I" level="1"><cit><quote lang="la">nubis ater,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. 5</bibl></cit> 2, 38: nubs for nubes, Liv. Andron. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Verg. A. 10, 636</bibl>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Idyll. de Monosyll. Hist. 12, 4</bibl>) [Sanscr. nabhas, vapor, cloud; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">ne/fos, nefe/lh</foreign>; Lat. nubilus, nebula; cf. nimbus, nubo], <hi rend="ital">a cloud</hi>. </sense><sense id="n31321.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">aër concretus in nubes cogitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:39:101" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 39, 101</bibl></cit>: <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 2, 22, 70</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">atra nubes Condidit lunam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:16:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 16, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">candida,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,027:14:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Apoc. 14, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aestivis effusus nubibus imber,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:312" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 312</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:339" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 339</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">venti nubes abigunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:126" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 47, 48, § 126</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nube deprendere volucrem jaculis,</quote> <trans><tr>to bring down a bird from the sky</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:16:566" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 16, 566</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">usque ad nubes,</quote> <trans><tr>up to heaven</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,027:35:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Psa. 35, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,049:51:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Jer. 51, 9</bibl>.— <usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">Sabaeae nubes,</quote> <trans><tr>the smoke of frankincense</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:4:8:2" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 4, 8, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n31321.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n31321.3" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A cloud, a dark spot</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sudare nubemque discutere,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>by the breath</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:127" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 33, 8, 44, § 127</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">crystalla infestantur plurimis vitiis, maculosā nube, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 37, 2, 10, § 28</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n31321.4" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A cloud, thick multitude, dense mass, swarm</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">locustarum tantae nubes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:10:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 42, 10, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Pomptinum velut nubibus locustarum coopertum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 42, 2, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">levium telorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 38, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">obruti velut nube jaculorum a Balearibus conjectā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:55:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 21, 55, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">peditum equitumque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:35:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 35, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(volucrum),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:254" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 254</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nigro glomeratur pulvere nubes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 9, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">muscarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:29:106" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 29, 6, 34, § 106</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pulveris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:15:32" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 4, 15, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(volucrum) nubem sonoram,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:13:167" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 13, 167</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">farrea nubes, i. e. porrigo capitis, furfures,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ser. Samm.</author> 3, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nubes testium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Hebr. 12, 1</bibl></cit>.— <pb n="1222" /> <cb n="NUBI" /> </sense><sense id="n31321.5" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n31321.6" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A cloud</hi>, for <hi rend="ital">something unreal</hi> or <hi rend="ital">unsubstantial, a phantom</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nubes et inania captare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:230" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 230</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n31321.7" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Cloudiness</hi>, of a gloomy countenance, of sleep, of drunkenness, of blindness (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">deme supercilio nubem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 18, 94</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:8:612" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 8, 612</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">meri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:3:65" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 3, 65</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">soporis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Achill. 1, 646</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mortis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:4:6:72" default="NO"><author>id.</author> S. 4, 6, 72</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">frontis opacae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:4:512" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Th. 4, 512</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n31321.8" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A gloomy</hi> or <hi rend="ital">mournful condition</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pars vitae tristi cetera nube vacet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:5:5:22" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 5, 5, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omni detersus pectora nube,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:1:3:109" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 1, 3, 109</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n31321.9" n="D" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A veil, obscurity, concealment</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">fraudibus obice nubem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 16, 62</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n31321.10" n="E" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A cloud, storm-cloud</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">a threatening appearance</hi> or <hi rend="ital">approach</hi> of misfortune, war: <cit><quote lang="la">nubem belli, dum detonet omnis, Sustinet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:809" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 809</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">consurgens in Italiā nubes trucis et cruenti belli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:29:3" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 29, 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
nubifer: <entryFree id="n31322" type="main" key="nu_bi^fer"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nūbĭfer</orth>, <itype>ĕra, ĕrum</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>nubes-fero</etym>, <sense id="n31322.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">cloud-bearing, cloud-capped</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">Apenninus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:226" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 226</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rupes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:599" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 599</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n31322.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Cloud-bringing</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Notus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:3:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 3, 58</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Eurus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:10:323" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 10, 323</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ver,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:5:415" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 5, 415</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
nubificus: <entryFree id="n31323" type="main" key="nu_bi^fi^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nūbĭfĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype> <etym>nubes-facio</etym>, <sense id="n31323.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">producing clouds</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aether,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Anthol. Lat.</author> 5, 24, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
nubifugus: <entryFree id="n31324" type="hapax" key="nu_bi^fu^gus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nūbĭfŭgus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>nubes-fugio</etym>, <sense id="n31324.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">cloud-chasing</hi>: nubifugus Boreas, Col. poët. 10, 288.</sense></entryFree>
nubigena: <entryFree id="n31325" type="main" key="nu_bi^ge^na"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nūbĭgĕna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>comm.</gen> <etym>nubes-gigno</etym>, <sense id="n31325.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">cloud-born, born of clouds</hi> or <hi rend="ital">of a cloud</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>). </sense><sense id="n31325.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">amnes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:1:365" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 1, 365</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nimbi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Hamart. 486</bibl></cit>: clipei, <hi rend="ital">the Ancilia</hi> (so called because they fell from the sky), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:5:2:131" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 5, 2, 131</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n31325.2" n="II" level="1"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n31325.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">The Centaurs</hi>, whom Ixion begot of a cloud, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:5:263" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 5, 263</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:12:211" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 12, 211</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">541</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 62" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 62</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n31325.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Phrixus</hi>, as the son of Nephele: Phrixus nubigena, Col. poët. 10, 115.</sense></entryFree>
nubiger: <entryFree id="n31326" type="main" key="nu_bi^ger"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nūbĭger</orth>, <itype>ĕra, ĕrum</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>nubes-gero</etym>, <sense id="n31326.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">borne by the clouds</hi> (late Lat.): pluvias, Cassiod. Un. praef.</sense></entryFree>
nubigosus: <entryFree id="n31327" type="main" key="nu_bi^go_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nūbĭgōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>nubes</etym>, <sense id="n31327.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">full of clouds, cloudy</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">aër,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Mamert. Stat. Anim. 1, 7</bibl></cit> dub.</sense></entryFree>
nubila: <entryFree id="n31328" type="main" key="nu_bi^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nūbĭla</orth>, v. nubilus, 2. b.</entryFree>
nubilarium: <entryFree id="n31329" type="main" key="nu_bi^la_ri^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nūbĭlārĭum</orth>, <itype>ĭi</itype> (collat. form ‡ <orth extent="full" lang="la">nūbĭ-lāre</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 4369</bibl>), <gen>n.</gen> <etym>nubes</etym>, <sense id="n31329.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a shed</hi> or <hi rend="ital">barn</hi>, in which corn was kept from the rain: <cit><quote lang="la">aedificium facere oportet, sub quod tectum totam fundi subicere possis messem, quod vocant quidam nubilarium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:13:5" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 13, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:1:6:24" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 1, 6, 24</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:20:3" default="NO">2, 20, 3</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 1, 36, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
nubilis: <entryFree id="n31330" type="main" key="nu_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nūbĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>nubo</etym>, <sense id="n31330.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">marriageable</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">filia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:5:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 5, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">virgo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 29, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jam plenis nubilis annis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nubiles anni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:335" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 14, 335</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
nubilo: <entryFree id="n31331" type="main" key="nu_bi^lo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nūbĭlo</orth>, <pos>v. a.</pos> and <gen>n.</gen> <etym>nubilum</etym>, <sense id="n31331.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to be cloudy</hi> or <hi rend="ital">overcast; to make cloudy, to overcast</hi>. </sense><sense id="n31331.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">si nubilare coeperit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:13:5" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 13, 5</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n31331.2" n="(b)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Impers. pass.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ubi nubilabitur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 88, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n31331.3" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to be cloudy, dull</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nubilans fulgor carbunculi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:94" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 7, 25, § 94</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n31331.4" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to cloud over, to obscure</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">lucem dei,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul. Nol.</author> Carm. 10, 37</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
nubilosus: <entryFree id="n31332" type="main" key="nu_bi^lo_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nūbĭlōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>nubilus</etym>, <sense id="n31332.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">cloudy</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">caligo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 11, p. 260, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dies,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> 30, § 33</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
nubilus: <entryFree id="n31333" type="main" key="nu_bi^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nūbĭlus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>nubes</etym>, <sense id="n31333.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">cloudy, overcast, lowering</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose). </sense><sense id="n31333.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">caelum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:109" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 26, 46, § 109</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dies,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:100" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 35, 35, § 100</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">annus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:2:5:76" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 2, 5, 76</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n31333.2" n="2" level="3"> <pos>Subst.</pos> </sense><sense id="n31333.3" n="a" level="4"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">nūbĭlum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a cloudy sky, cloudy weather</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">venti, qui nubilum inducunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:2:17:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 2, 17, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">differre aliquid propter nubilum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:13" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 13</bibl></cit>: vitandos soles atque ventos et nubila etiam ac siccitates. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:27" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 27</bibl>.—In <case>abl.</case>: <cit><quote lang="la">nubilo,</quote> <trans><tr>in cloudy weather</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:215" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 60, 60, § 215</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aranei sereno texunt, nubilo texunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:84" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 11, 24, 28, § 84</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n31333.4" n="b" level="4"> In <number>plur.</number>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">nū-bĭla</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the clouds</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Diespiter lgni corusco nubila dividens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:34:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 34, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caput inter nubila condit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:177" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 177</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nubila dissicere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:328" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 328</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nubila conducere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:1:572" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 572</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nubila inducere et pellere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:7:202" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 202</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:30:3" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 30, 3</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n31333.5" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n31333.6" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Cloud-bringing, cloudy</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nubilus Auster,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:2:1:26" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 2, 1, 26</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:127" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 47, 48, § 127</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Laud. Stil. 1, 287</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n31333.7" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Dark, gloomy</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Styx,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:3:322" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 3, 322</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">via nubila taxo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:432" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 4, 432</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Tibris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:14:447" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 14, 447</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Arcas,</quote> <trans><tr>dwelling in the infernal regions</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:4:483" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 4, 483</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n31333.8" n="3" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Dark</hi>, of color: <cit><quote lang="la">nubilus color margaritae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:108" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 35, 54, § 108</bibl></cit>; <cb n="NUCA" /> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:8:51:4" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 8, 51, 4</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n31333.9" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n31333.10" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Beclouded, troubled</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ita nubilam mentem Animi habeo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:2:1:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cist. 2, 1, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Mars nubilus irā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:3:230" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 3, 230</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n31333.11" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Gloomy, sad, melancholy</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">toto nubila vultu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:512" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 5, 512</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oculi hilaritate nitescunt et tristitiā quoddam nubilum ducunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:3:27" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 4, 3, 27</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 6, 4, § 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:5:3:13" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 5, 3, 13</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nubila tempora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:1:1:40" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 1, 1, 40</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">1, 9, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nubila nascenti seu mihi Parca fuit,</quote> <trans><tr>unfavorable, adverse</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:5:3:14" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 3, 14</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
nubis: <entryFree id="n31334" type="main" key="nu_bis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nūbis</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n31334.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a cloud</hi>, v. nubes.</sense></entryFree>
nubivagus: <entryFree id="n31335" type="hapax" key="nu_bi^va^gus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nūbĭvăgus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>nubes-vagor</etym>, <sense id="n31335.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">wandering among the clouds</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">meatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:12:102" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 12, 102</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
nubo: <entryFree id="n31336" type="main" key="nu_bo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nūbo</orth>, <itype>psi, ptum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> and <gen>n.</gen> (acc. to <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 789</bibl> P., the ancients used the construction nubere aliquem; hence <sense id="n31336.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">part. pass.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">nuptus</orth>, <itype>a</itype>, um; v. <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>) [root in Sanscr. nabhas; Germ. Nebei; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">ne/fos, nefe/lh</foreign>; Lat.: nubes, nebula, nimbus; cf. <foreign lang="greek">nu/mfh</foreign>], <hi rend="ital">to cover, veil</hi>. </sense><sense id="n31336.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen. (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">jubet ut udae virgines nubant rosae. Auct. Pervig. Ven. 22: quod aqua nubat terram,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 3, 118</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n31336.2" n="II" level="1"> In partic., of a bride: alicui, <hi rend="ital">to cover, veil herself</hi> for the bridegroom, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to be married to</hi> him; <hi rend="ital">to marry, wed</hi> (class. and freq.); constr. with <case>dat.</case> or <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>: nuptam esse; also with <hi rend="ital">cum;</hi> post-class. also with <hi rend="ital">apud</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quo illae nubent divites Dotatae?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:3:5:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 3, 5, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">virgo nupsit ei, cui Caecilia nupta fuerat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:46:104" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 46, 104</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">deam homini nubere, Aug. Civ. Dei, 4, 27: locuples quae nupsit avaro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:141" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 141</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:591" default="NO">591</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">regis Parthorum filius, quocum esset nupta regis Armeniorum soror,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:15:3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 15, 3, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Amphitruo ... Quicum Alcumenast nupta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:prol. 99" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. prol. 99</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dum cum illo nupta eris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:5:2:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> As. 5, 2, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum in familiam clarissimam nupsisses,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:14:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cael. 14, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in familiae luctum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:66:188" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clu. 66, 188</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut una apud duos nupta esset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:1:23:8" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 1, 23, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si qua voles apte nubere, nube pari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:9:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 9, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">posse ipsam Liviam statuere nubendum post Drusum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tu nube atque tace,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:2:61" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 2, 61</bibl></cit>.—In the <hi rend="ital">sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nam quo dedisti nuptum, abire nolumus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:1:2:83" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Stich. 1, 2, 83</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">uxor, invita quae ad virum nuptum datur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 2, 85</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Mamilio filiam nuptum dat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ultro nuptum ire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:prol. 86" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. prol. 86</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nuptum locare virginem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:5:1:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 5, 1, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">propinquas suas nuptum in alias civitates collocāsse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 18</bibl></cit>: nuptum mitti, Sall. Fragm. ap. Arus. Mess.—<hi rend="ital">Impers. pass.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cujusmodi hic cum famā facile nubitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:3:1:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 3, 1, 58</bibl></cit>: praestruxit, hic quidem nubi, ubi sit et mori, Tert. c. Marc. 4, 38.—<hi rend="ital">Pers.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque nubent neque nubentur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,001:22:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Matt. 22, 30</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n31336.3" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n31336.4" n="1" level="3"> Of a man, <hi rend="ital">to marry, be married</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-class. prose): <cit><quote lang="la">pontificem maximum rursus nubere nefas est,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> ad Uxor. 1, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec filii sine consensu patrum rite et jure nubent,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 11</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Ep. 22</bibl>, n. 19; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,003:20:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Luc. 20, 34</bibl>: viri nupti, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 480</bibl>. 3.—So, comically, of a man who is ruled by his wife, <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 143, 24 sq.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">uxorem quare locupletem ducere nolim, Quaeritis? uxori nubere nolo meae,</quote> <trans><tr>will not be my wife's wife</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:8:12:2" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 8, 12, 2</bibl></cit>.—Also of unnatural vice: <cit><quote lang="la">nubit amicus, Nec multos adhibet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:2:134" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 2, 134</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:12:42" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 12, 42</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Lampr.</author> Heliog. 10</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 9, 9, 31</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n31336.5" n="2" level="3"> In mal. part.: <cit><quote lang="la">haec cotidie viro nubit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:1:1:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cist. 1, 1, 45</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:2:8:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cas. 2, 8, 45</bibl> sqq.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:1:24:4" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 1, 24, 4</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n31336.6" n="3" level="3"> Of plants, <hi rend="ital">to be wedded</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">tied to</hi> others: <cit><quote lang="la">vites in Campano agro populis nubunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 14, 1, 3, § 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">et te, Bacche, tuos nubentem junget ad ulmos,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Manil.</author> 5, 238</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">populus alba vitibus nupta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:266" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 28, 68, § 266</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">nuptus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">P. a., married, wedded</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex quā hic est puer et nupta jam filia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:3:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 3, 6</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">nūpta</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a married woman, bride, wife</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nova nupta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:4:7:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 4, 7, 33</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:2:120" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 2, 120</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pudica,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:45:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 45, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:2:794" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 2, 794</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nupta virum timeat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:3:613" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. A. 3, 613</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> G. 18</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Contr. 3:21:9" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Contr. 3, 21, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:269" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 269</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:3:45" default="NO">3, 45</bibl>.—Comically, in the <hi rend="ital">masc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">novus nuptus, of a man married in jest as a woman to another man,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:5:1:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 5, 1, 6</bibl></cit> (cited in <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 789</bibl> P.).— <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>: nupta verba, <hi rend="ital">which should not be spoken by the unmarried</hi>, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=170" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 170</bibl> Müll.</sense></entryFree>
nubs: <entryFree id="n31337" type="main" key="nubs"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nubs</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, v. nubes <sense id="n31337.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
nucalis: <entryFree id="n31338" type="main" key="nu^ca_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nŭcālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>nux</etym>, <sense id="n31338.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">like a nut</hi> (postclass.):<cb n="NUDI" />  palmulae nucales, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Acut. 2:37" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Acut. 2, 37</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
nucamenta: <entryFree id="n31339" type="main" key="nu^ca_menta"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nŭcāmenta</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>nux</etym> (things in the shape of nuts; hence), <sense id="n31339.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fir-cones</hi>, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 10, 19, § 49</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
nucella: <entryFree id="n31340" type="hapax" key="nu^cella"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nŭcella</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n31340.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a little nut</hi>, Apic. ap. Barth. Adv. 34, 18.</sense></entryFree>
nuceria: <entryFree id="n31341" type="main" key="Nu_ce^ri^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Nūcĕrĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n31341.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the name of several cities</hi>. </sense><sense id="n31341.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A city in Campania</hi>, with the appellation Alfaterna, the modern <hi rend="ital">Nocera</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:41:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 41, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:15" default="NO" valid="yes">23, 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:3" default="NO" valid="yes">27, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:31:86" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Agr. 2, 31, 86</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,026:11:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Balb. 11, 28</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n31341.2" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Nūcĕ-rīnus</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">Nŭc-</orth>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul. Nol.</author> Carm. 26, 517</bibl>), a, um, <hi rend="ital">adj., of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Nuceria, Nucerian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ager,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 38</bibl></cit>.—In <number>plur.</number>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Nū-cĕrīni</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the Nucerians</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 27, 3</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n31341.3" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A city in Umbria</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Nocera, whose inhabitants are called</hi> Nucerini Favonienses <hi rend="ital">and</hi> Camelani, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:114" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 14, 19, § 114</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
nucetum: <entryFree id="n31342" type="main" key="nu^ce_tum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nŭcētum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>nux</etym>, <sense id="n31342.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a wood where nut-trees grow</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:1:6:12" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 1, 6, 12</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Valent. 20</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
nuceus: <entryFree id="n31343" type="main" key="nu^ce^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nŭcĕus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n31343.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of a nut-tree</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">fibulae unde fiant, aridae iligneae, ulmeae, nuceae, ficulneae, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 31</bibl></cit>; id. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:193" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 39, 75, § 193</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">virga nucea,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Ep. 53</bibl></cit>, n. 8.</sense></entryFree>
nucifrangibulum: <entryFree id="n31344" type="hapax" key="nu^ci^frangi^bu^lum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nŭcĭfrangĭbŭlum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>nux-frango</etym>, qs. <sense id="n31344.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a nut-cracker</hi>, comically for a <hi rend="ital">tooth</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:4:2:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 4, 2, 16</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
nucinus: <entryFree id="n31345" type="main" key="nu^ci^nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nŭcĭnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>nux</etym>, = nuceus, <sense id="n31345.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of a nut-tree</hi> (late Lat.): mensae, Schol. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:11:117" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 11, 117</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">virga,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ambros.</author> Jacob. 2, 4, 19</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
nucipersicum: <entryFree id="n31346" type="main" key="nu^ci^persi^cum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nŭcĭpersĭcum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>nux-persicum</etym>, <sense id="n31346.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a peach grafted on a nut-tree, a nut-peach</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">persica, nucipersica,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:13:46" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 13, 46</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">in lemm.</hi></sense></entryFree>
nuciprunum: <entryFree id="n31347" type="main" key="nu^ci^pru_num"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nŭcĭprūnum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>nux-prunus</etym>, <sense id="n31347.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a plum grafted on a nut-tree, a nut-plum</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 15, 13, 12, § 41</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
nucleatus: <entryFree id="n31348" type="main" key="nu_^cle^a_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nū^clĕātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>nucleus</etym>, <sense id="n31348.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">having a kernel</hi> or <hi rend="ital">stone, stoned</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">uva passa, nucleata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1011,001:Comp. 223" default="NO"><author>Scrib.</author> Comp. 223</bibl></cit> dub. (al. enucleata).</sense></entryFree>
nucleo: <entryFree id="n31349" type="main" key="nu_^cle^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nū^clĕo</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n31349.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to become kernelly, hard</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nucleantibus mamillis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Theod. Prisc.</author> 4, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
nucleolus: <entryFree id="n31350" type="main" key="nu_^cle^o^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nū^clĕŏlus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n31350.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a little nut</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Plin. Val.</author> 1, 48</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
nucleus: <entryFree id="n31351" type="main" key="nu_^cle^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nū^clĕus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">nŭcŭlĕus</orth>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>for nuculeus, from nux</etym>, <sense id="n31351.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a little nut</hi>. </sense><sense id="n31351.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n31351.2" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A nut;</hi> applied also to fruits resembling a nut: <cit><quote lang="la">nucleus amygdalae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 15, 13, 12, § 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">avellanae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 37, 4, 15, § 56</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pinearum nucum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 15, 10, 9, § 35</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">pineus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:2:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 2, 22</bibl></cit>.—Prov.: e nuce nuculeum qui esse vult, frangit nucem, <hi rend="ital">he who would eat the kernel of a nut breaks the nut</hi>, i. e. he who desires an advantage should not shun the labor of earning it, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:1:1:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 1, 1, 55</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nuculeum amisi, retinui pigneri putamina,</quote> <trans><tr>I have lost the kernel and kept the shell</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:3:4:122" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Capt. 3, 4, 122</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n31351.3" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">The hard, uneatable kernel, the stone</hi> of fruits: <cit><quote lang="la">nuculei olivarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:188" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 11, 73, § 188</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">persicorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:23:132" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 23, 7, 67, § 132</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cerasorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:23:141" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 23, 7, 72, § 141</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lignosus nucleus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:13:112" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 13, 19, 34, § 112</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">acini,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:23:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 23, 1, 9, § 13</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n31351.4" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n31351.5" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">The kernel, the inner part, inside</hi> of a thing: <cit><quote lang="la">nucleus gallae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 24, 4, 5, § 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">myrrhae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:12:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 12, 16, 35, § 70</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">allii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:111" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 19, 6, 34, § 111</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">conchae,</quote> <trans><tr>pearls</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:111" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 9, 35, 55, § 111</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n31351.6" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">The kernel</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">the hardest, firmest, most solid part</hi> of a thing: <cit><quote lang="la">pinguitudinis (terrae),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 6, 4, § 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ferri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:144" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 34, 14, 41, § 144</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:187" default="NO" valid="yes">36, 25, 62, § 187</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">insuper ex testā nucleus inducatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:7:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 7, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
nucrae: <entryFree id="n31352" type="main" key="Nu_crae"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Nūcrae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n31352.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a city of Italy</hi> (in Samnium or Campania), otherwise unknown. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:8:566" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 8, 566</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
nucula: <entryFree id="n31353" type="main" key="nu^cu^la1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nŭcŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>nux</etym>, <sense id="n31353.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a small nut</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:87" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 15, 22, 24, § 87</bibl>: nuculas Praenestinos antiqui appellabant, quod inclusi a Poenis Casilini famem nucibus sustentārunt, vel quod in earum regione plurima nux minuta nascitur, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=172" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 172</bibl> and 173 Müll.; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 23, 19</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n31354" type="main" key="Nu^cu^la2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Nŭcŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n31354.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Roman proper name</hi>, Lucil. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:62:253" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 62, 253</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:6:5:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 6, 5, 14</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">8, 9, 26</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">11, 6, 13</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
nucunculus: <entryFree id="n31355" type="gloss" key="nu^cuncu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nŭcuncŭlus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>nux</etym>, perh. a kind of <sense id="n31355.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">nut-cake</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Not. Tir.</author> p. 176</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
nudatio: <entryFree id="n31356" type="main" key="nu_da_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nūdātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>nudo</etym>, <sense id="n31356.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a stripping naked, nakedness</hi> (post-Aug.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 28, 6, 19, § 69</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">femorum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Ep. 22</bibl></cit>, n. 8.</sense></entryFree>
nude: <entryFree id="n31357" type="main" key="nu_de_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nūdē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. nudus <sense id="n31357.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
nudipedalia: <entryFree id="n31358" type="main" key="nu_di^pe^da_li^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nūdĭpĕdālĭa</orth>, <itype>ĭum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>nudipes</etym>. <sense id="n31358.0" n="I" level="1"> <pb n="1223" /> <cb n="NUDO" /> <hi rend="ital">A religious procession of persons with bare feet, the barefoot festival</hi>, celebrated in seasons of great drought, to procure a fall of rain: <cit><quote lang="la">cum stupet caelum et aret annus, nudipedalia denuntiantur, magistratus purpuras ponunt, fasces retro avertunt, precem indigitant, hostiam instaurant,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Jejun. 16</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Apol. 40</bibl>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 44</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:3:28" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 3, 28</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n31358.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A going barefoot</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nudipedalia exercere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> in Ep. ad Galat. 4, 8</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
nudipes: <entryFree id="n31359" type="main" key="nu_di^pe_s"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nūdĭpēs</orth>, <itype>ĕdis</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>nudus-pes</etym>, <sense id="n31359.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">barefoot, barefooted</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Pall. 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
nuditas: <entryFree id="n31360" type="main" key="nu_di^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nūdĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>nudus</etym> ( = <foreign lang="greek">gumno/ths</foreign>, Gloss.), <sense id="n31360.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">bareness, nakedness, exposure</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">pudere eum nuditatis suae coepit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 2, 12, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vestire pauperem sine suā nuditate,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sulp.</author> Sev. Vit. Mart. 2, 2</bibl></cit>; Aug. Civ. Dei, 14, 17 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in fame et siti et nuditate,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,005:28:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Deut. 28, 48</bibl></cit>; ib Rom. 8, 35; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,008:11:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> 2 Cor. 11, 27</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">capitis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> de Virg. Vel. 12</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">ext.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">patris,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 2, 13, 5</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n31360.1" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">bareness, want</hi>, Cod. Th. 9, 42, 13; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 9, 42</bibl>, c. 12.</sense></entryFree>
nudius: <entryFree id="n31361" type="main" key="nu^di^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nŭdĭus</orth> <etym>num (i. e. nunc) and dius = dies; the ending accommodated to that of the following numeral</etym>, <sense id="n31361.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">it is now the ... day since</hi>, always in connection with ordinal numbers; as, nudius tertius, <hi rend="ital">three days ago, the day before yesterday</hi>: nudius quartus, <hi rend="ital">four days ago</hi>, etc.: nudius tertius videtur compositum ex nunc et die et tertio, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=170" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 170</bibl> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">heri et nudius tertius, Quartus, quintus, sextus, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:4:2:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 4, 2, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nam ego Lemno advenio Athenas nudius tertius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:1:1:74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Truc. 1, 1, 74</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nudius sextus quoi talentum mutuom dedi reposcam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:3:2:101" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Trin. 3, 2, 101</bibl></cit>; cf. Afran. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 192</bibl> P.: <cit><quote lang="la">nudius tertius dedi ad te epistulam longiorem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:14:11:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 14, 11, 1</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">here, nudius quintus natus quidem ille est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:2:6:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 2, 6, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">recordamini, qui dies nudius tertiusdecimus fuerit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:5:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 5, 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">a nudius quartā die,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,005:10:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Act. 10, 30</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
nudiustertianus: <entryFree id="n31362" type="main" key="nu^di^usterti^a_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nŭdĭustertĭānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>nudius-tertianus</etym>, <sense id="n31362.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">made three days ago</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">the day before yesterday</hi>, M. Aur. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Ep. ad M. Caes. 5:59" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Ep. ad M. Caes. 5, 59</bibl> Mai.; cf.: nudius tertianus, <foreign lang="greek">triqhmerino/s</foreign>, Gloss. Philox.</sense></entryFree>
nudo: <entryFree id="n31363" type="main" key="nu_do"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nūdo</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>nudus</etym>, <sense id="n31363.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to make naked</hi> or <hi rend="ital">bare; to strip, bare, lay bare, expose to view, uncover</hi> (syn.: exuo, detego, revelo). </sense><sense id="n31363.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n31363.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: nudare inter cives corpora, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:33:70" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 4, 33, 70</bibl> (Trag. v. 426 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">hominem nudari ac deligari jubet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:62:section=161" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 62, § 161</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nudatum caput,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:312" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 312</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">duros nudantia dentes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:1064" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 1064</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:81" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 81</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">gladios,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 28, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">telum nudatum vaginā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,014:11:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Dat. 11, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">viscera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:211" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 211</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">crura,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 2, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:6:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 6, 33</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">si interrupto nudaret gurgite pontum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:4:1:75" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 4, 1, 75</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nudata cacumina silvae Ostendunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:345" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 345</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ubera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:10:391" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 10, 391</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tertia nudandas acceperat area messes,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to be threshed out</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:3:557" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 3, 557</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n31363.3" n="B" level="2"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n31363.4" n="1" level="3"> In milit. lang., <hi rend="ital">to leave uncovered, leave exposed</hi> or <hi rend="ital">defenceless, to expose</hi> a place to the enemy: <cit><quote lang="la">latera sua,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">murus nudatus defensoribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 11</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">collis nudatus hominibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque sibi nudanda litora existimabant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 3, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne castra nudentur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. G. 7, 70</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praesidiis nudatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 88:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 88, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 30, 2, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">terga fugā nudant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:586" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 586</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n31363.5" n="2" level="3"> Pregn., <hi rend="ital">to strip, spoil, plunder</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">spoliavit nudavitque omnia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 1, 5, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">agros nudare populando,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 44, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">opibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 42, 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quem praeceps alea nudat,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 18, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">moveat cornicula risum Furtivis nudata coloribus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 3, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec nuder ab illis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:1:6:7" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 1, 6, 7</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n31363.6" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n31363.7" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To lay bare, expose</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">te evolutum illis integumentis dissimulationis tuae nudatumque perspicio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:86:350" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 86, 350</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vis ingenii etiamsi hac scientiā juris nudata sit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 38, 172</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n31363.8" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To lay bare, make visible, expose, betray, disclose</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">defectionem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:35:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 35, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec illi primo statim creati nudare, quid vellent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 24, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fama equestris pugnae nudavit voluntates hominum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 42, 63</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne poena ejus consilia adversus Romanos nudaret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 40, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:33:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 33, 21</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:5:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 5, 47</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ingenium res Adversae nudare solent, celare secundae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 8, 74</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alicui amorem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:4:7:2" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 4, 7, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n31363.9" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To deprive of, strip of</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nudata omnibus rebus tribunicia potestas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 7</bibl></cit>: nudatos opere censorio aut sententiā judicum de ambitu condemnatos restituit,<cb n="NUDU" />  <hi rend="ital">those who had been stripped by the censor of their rights and privileges</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:41" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 41</bibl> (al. notatos): <cit><quote lang="la">cum tuo exercitusque tui praesidio nudatam Italiam viderint,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 28, 42</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
nudulus: <entryFree id="n31364" type="hapax" key="nu_du^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nūdŭlus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <sense id="n31364.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adj. dim.</hi> [nudus], <hi rend="ital">naked, bare</hi>: loca nudula, Hadr. Carm. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Spart.</author> Hadr. 25</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
nudus: <entryFree id="n31365" type="main" key="nu_dus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nūdus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>for nugdus; root nag-, nig-, to make bare; Sanscr. nagna, naked; cf. Germ. nackt; Eng. naked</etym>, <sense id="n31365.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">naked, bare, unclothed, uncovered, exposed</hi>. </sense><sense id="n31365.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n31365.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">membra nuda dabant terrae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:970" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 970</bibl></cit> Lachm. <hi rend="ital">N. cr.</hi> (not nudabant): <cit><quote lang="la">tamquam nudus nuces legeret, in ventrem abstulisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:66:265" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 66, 265</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nudus membra Pyracmon,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:425" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 425</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nuda pedem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:183" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 183</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">capite nudo,</quote> <trans><tr>bareheaded</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 94:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 94, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pedibus nudis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:8:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 8, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">costae nudae tegmine,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:5:449" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 5, 449</bibl></cit>.—Esp., <hi rend="ital">without the toga, in one's tunic</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nudus ara, sere nudus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:299" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 299</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 92</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Vir. Illustr. 17" default="NO"><author>Aur. Vict.</author> Vir. Illustr. 17</bibl>; cf. Drak. ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:26:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 26, 9</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Unarmed, unprotected</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in maximo metu nudum et caecum corpus ad hostes vortere,</quote> <trans><tr>his defenceless back</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 107:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 107, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:45:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 45, 3</bibl>.—Prov.: vestimenta detrahere nudo, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to get something out of one who has nothing</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">to draw blood from a stone</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:1:1:79" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 1, 1, 79</bibl>.—Of things: <cit><quote lang="la">silex nuda,</quote> <trans><tr>not covered with turf</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:1:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 1, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ensis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:306" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 12, 306</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sedit humo nudā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:261" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 261</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">et quodcumque jacet nudā tellure cadaver,</quote> <trans><tr>on the bare ground, unburied</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:6:550" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 6, 550</bibl></cit>; so of <hi rend="ital">unburied bodies</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:8:434" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 8, 434</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:8:73" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 8, 73</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nudum nemus,</quote> <trans><tr>leafless</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Herc. Oet. 281" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Herc. Oet. 281</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n31365.3" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">loca nuda gignentium,</quote> <trans><tr>bare of vegetation</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 79:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 79, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nudus Arboris Othrys,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:12:512" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 12, 512</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n31365.4" n="B" level="2"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n31365.5" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Stripped, spoiled, vacant, void, deprived</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">destitute of, without</hi>. </sense><sense id="n31365.6" n="(a)" level="5"> With <case>abl.</case>: <cit><quote lang="la">urbs nuda praesidio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:7:13:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 7, 13, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praesidiis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:4:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 29, 4, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nudus agris, nudus nummis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:3:184" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 3, 184</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nudum remigio latus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:14:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 1, 14, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:16:46" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 16, 46</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n31365.7" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">ab</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Messana ab his rebus sane vacua atque nuda est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:2:section=3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 2, § 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n31365.8" n="(g)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mors famae nuda,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:4:608" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 4, 608</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n31365.9" n="(d)" level="5"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">heri quod homines quattuor In soporem conlocāstis nudos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:147" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 1, 147</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">partem istam subselliorum nudam atque inanem reliquerunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:1:7:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 1, 7, 16</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n31365.10" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Poor, needy, destitute, forlorn</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quem tu semper nudum esse voluisti,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fl. 21, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">senecta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:9:154" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 9, 154</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">senectus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:7:35" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 7, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quis tam nudus, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:5:163" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 5, 163</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sine amicis, sine hospitibus, plane nudum esse ac desertum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:66:section=148" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 66, § 148</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n31365.11" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n31365.12" n="A" level="2"> </sense><sense id="n31365.13" n="1" level="3"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">bare, mere, pure, simple, sole, alone, only</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nuda ista si ponas, judicari qualia sint non facile possim,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,047:3:2:24" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Par. 3, 2, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ira Caesaris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:3:11:17" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 3, 11, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">locorum nuda nomina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3</bibl></cit>, praef. § <cit><quote lang="la">2: virtus nudo homine contenta est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 3:18:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 3, 18, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nuda rerum cognitio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:5:8:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 5, 8, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nuda virtus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 88</bibl></cit>: nudā manu captare fontem, i. e. <hi rend="ital">without a cup</hi>, Sen. Hippol. alt. 519.—So freq. in jurid. Lat.: <cit><quote lang="la">nudo animo adipisci quidem possessionem non possumus: retinere tamen nudo animo possumus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul.</author> Sent. 5</bibl></cit>, tit. 2: <cit><quote lang="la">etiam nudus consensus sufficit obligationi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:44:7:51" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 44, 7, 51</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:Inst. 3:154" default="NO"><author>Gai.</author> Inst. 3, 154</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n31365.14" n="2" level="3"> Esp., in phrases. </sense><sense id="n31365.15" n="(a)" level="5"> Nudum pactum, <hi rend="ital">a bare agreement</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">a contract without consideration</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex nudo enim pacto inter cives Romanos actio non nascitur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul.</author> Sent. 2, 14, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n31365.16" n="(b)" level="5"> Nudum jus, <hi rend="ital">an unexecuted right</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui nudum jus Quiritium in servo habet, is potestatem habere non intellegitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:Inst. 1:54" default="NO"><author>Gai.</author> Inst. 1, 54</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:3:166" default="NO">3, 166</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n31365.17" n="B" level="2"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n31365.18" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Simple, unadorned</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Commentarii (Caesaris) nudi sunt, recti et venusti, omni ornatu orationis tamquam veste detractā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:75:262" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 75, 262</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">brevitas nuda atque inornata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:84:341" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 84, 341</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quoniam dicendi facultas non debeat esse jejuna atque nuda,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 50, 218</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nuda et velut incompta oratio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:6:41" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 6, 41</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:4:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 4, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:3:747" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 3, 747</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sedit humo nudā, nudis incompta capillis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:261" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 261</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n31365.19" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Undisguised, unadorned, not veiled</hi> or <hi rend="ital">obscured</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">veritas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:24:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 24, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nudissima veritas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Chron. 1:5:176" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Chron. 1, 5, 176</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">simplex ac nuda veritas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 3, 1, 3</bibl></cit>: nuda verba, <hi rend="ital">unveiled</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">obscene words</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:4:14:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 4, 14, 4</bibl>.—Hence, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">nūdē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">nakedly, simply</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid tradere breviter ac nude,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 3, 1, 11</bibl></cit>. <cb n="NUGI" /></sense></entryFree>
nugacissime: <entryFree id="n31366" type="main" key="nu_ga_cissi^me_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nūgācissĭmē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. nugax <sense id="n31366.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
nugacitas: <entryFree id="n31367" type="main" key="nu_ga_ci^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nūgācĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>nugae</etym>, <sense id="n31367.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a trifling playfulness, drollery</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Ep. 67" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Ep. 67</bibl>; id. de Musica, 6 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
nugae: <entryFree id="n31368" type="main" key="nu_gae"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nūgae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>etym. dub.; old form naugae; cf.: naucum, nux</etym>, <sense id="n31368.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">jokes, jests, idle speeches, trifles, trumpery, nonsense</hi> (syn. ineptiae). </sense><sense id="n31368.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">aufer nugas,</quote> <trans><tr>away with your jesting</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:4:4:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 4, 4, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nugas postulare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:2:4:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Trin. 2, 4, 40</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:2:1:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Truc. 2, 1, 20</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:2:4:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Merc. 2, 4, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">huncine hominem tantis delectatum esse nugis?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:13:30" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 13, 30</bibl></cit>. —Hence, nugas agere, <hi rend="ital">to play the fool</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nisi argentum dederit, nugas egerit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:prol. 54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. prol. 54</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">maximas nugas agis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:1:1:78" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> As. 1, 1, 78</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">and ellipt. without ago: quo illum sequar? in Persas? nugas,</quote> <trans><tr>nonsense!</tr></trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:4:7:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pers. 4, 7, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:5:1:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Most. 5, 1, 38</bibl>.—Of verses, <hi rend="ital">trifles</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nescio quid meditans nugarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:9:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 9, 2</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 1, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:9:1:5" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 9, 1, 5</bibl> (cf. also: <cit><quote lang="la">versūs et cetera ludicra,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 1, 10</bibl></cit>).—Of the songs of hired female mourners at a funeral: <cit><quote lang="la">haec sunt non nugae: non enim mortualia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:4:1:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 4, 1, 63</bibl></cit>.—Acc. to Nonius, Plautus called <hi rend="ital">women's finery</hi> nugae, <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 144, 30</bibl>; v. nugivendus. —</sense><sense id="n31368.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> (abstr. pro concreto), <hi rend="ital">jesters, jokers, droll fellows</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">amicos habet meras nugas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:6:3:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 6, 3, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ego Hephaestum ... Niciam, ego nugas maximas omni meā comitate sum complexus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:1:2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 1, 2, 2</bibl></cit> comites Graeculi, quocumque ibat: <cit><quote lang="la">tum in comitatu nugarum nihil,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:21:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 21, 55</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
nugalis: <entryFree id="n31369" type="main" key="nu_ga_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nūgālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>nugae</etym>, <sense id="n31369.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">frivolous, trifling, worthless, empty</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">theoremata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:1:2:6" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 1, 2, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 1, § 2</bibl> Kopp (al. nugalas): <cit><quote lang="la">scholica quaedam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 4, 1, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">7, 17, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">illa olim nugalia conscripsi,</quote> <trans><tr>trifles, bagatelles</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:de Fer. Als. 3" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> de Fer. Als. 3</bibl></cit> Mai.</sense></entryFree>
nugalitas: <entryFree id="n31370" type="gloss" key="nu_ga_li^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nūgālĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>nugalis</etym>, <sense id="n31370.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">foolery, nonsense</hi>: nugalitas, <foreign lang="greek">sapro/ths</foreign>, Gloss. Philox.: nugalitas, <foreign lang="greek">fluaro/ths</foreign>, Gloss. Lat. Graec.</sense></entryFree>
nugamenta: <entryFree id="n31371" type="main" key="nu_ga_menta"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nūgāmenta</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>nugae</etym>, <sense id="n31371.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">trifles, trash</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 1, p. 113, 31</bibl>; cf.: nugamenta, <foreign lang="greek">u(qlh/mata</foreign>, Gloss. Lat. Graec.</sense></entryFree>
nugas: <entryFree id="n31372" type="gloss" key="nu_gas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nūgas</orth>, v. nugax <sense id="n31372.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
nugator: <entryFree id="n31373" type="main" key="nu_ga_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nūgātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>nugor</etym>, <sense id="n31373.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a jester, joker, babbler, trifler, silly person;</hi> hence, too, <hi rend="ital">a braggart, a swaggerer</hi>: illic nugator nili, non nauci'st homo, Enn. ap. Paul. ex Fest. s. v. naucus, p. 166 Müll.
