(Com. v. 10 Vahl.); Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 35, 24</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:4:2:91" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 4, 2, 91</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 2, 14</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nimius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:2:2:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Capt. 2, 2, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vae tibi nugator!</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:4:2:86" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 4, 2, 86</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non vero tam isti (lacerti), quam tu ipse nugator,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:9:27" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Sen. 9, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque in istum nugatorem, tamquam in aliquem testem, invehar,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fl. 16, 38</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 38, 56</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">homo nihili et nugator,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:15:2:2" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 15, 2, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">iste nugator libellus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Idyll. 11 praef.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cessas nugator?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:5:127" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 5, 127</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n31373.1" n="II" level="1"> Perh., <hi rend="ital">a debauchee</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Cath. 2, 29</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
nugatorie: <entryFree id="n31374" type="main" key="nu_ga_to_ri^e_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nūgātōrĭē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. nugatorius <sense id="n31374.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
nugatorius: <entryFree id="n31375" type="main" key="nu_ga_to_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nūgātōrĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>nugator</etym>, <sense id="n31375.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">trifling, worthless, useless, futile, nugatory</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nugatoriae artes,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>lies</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:4:2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 4, 2, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">boves Ligustici,</quote> <trans><tr>worthless, useless</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:5:9" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 5, 9</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">unguentum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 7:section=64" default="NO"><author>id.</author> L. L. 7, § 64</bibl></cit> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">ad probandum res infirma nugatoriaque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:23:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Caecin. 23, 64</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">illud valde leve est ac nugatorium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:11:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 11, 2, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in malā nugatoriāque accusatione,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:15:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 15, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">genus argumentationis,</quote> <trans><tr>not to the point</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 2, 20, 31</bibl></cit>: genus deorum, Aug. Civ. Dei, 4, 27.—As <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">nū-gātōrĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a worthless fellow</hi>, nugatorium vocant, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 36:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 36, 2</bibl>.—Hence, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">nūgātōrĭē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">triflingly, frivolously</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tenuiter et nugatorie respondere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 4, 36, 48</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
nugatrix: <entryFree id="n31376" type="main" key="nu_ga_trix"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nūgātrix</orth>, <itype>īcis</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n31376.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">trifling, frivolous</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nugatrix acies,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>luxurious</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Psych. 433</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
nugax: <entryFree id="n31377" type="main" key="nu_gax"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nūgax</orth>, <itype>ācis</itype> (collat. form <itype>indecl.</itype> ‡ nugas, <foreign lang="greek">sapro/s</foreign>, Gloss. Philox.; so, ‡ nugas, inutilis, Gloss. Vet.; cf. Don. p. 1749 P.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">15</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">22</bibl>; 120 ib.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Diom.</author> p. 286</bibl> P.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 649</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">701</bibl> ib.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0996,001:1464" default="NO"><author>Val. Prob.</author> 1464</bibl> and 1478 ib.), <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>nugor</etym>, <sense id="n31377.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">jesting, trifling, frivolous</hi>, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 355, 22</bibl>: qui tam nugax esset, Cael. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:8:15:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 8, 15, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nugax es,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 52</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Ambros.</author> Ep. 58, 6</bibl> <hi rend="ital">ext.— Adv.</hi> only <hi rend="ital">sup.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">nūgācissimē</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">-sŭmē</orth>), <hi rend="ital">in the most trifling manner</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:3:3:90" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 3, 3, 90</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
nugigerulus: <entryFree id="n31378" type="main" key="nu_gi_^ge^ru^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nūgī^gĕrŭlus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, v. nugivendus. <pb n="1224" /> <cb n="NULL" /></entryFree>
nugipalamloquides: <entryFree id="n31379" type="main" key="Nu_gi^pa^lamlo^qui^des"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Nūgĭpălamlŏquĭdes</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>nugaepalam-loqui</etym>, <sense id="n31379.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a public talker of nonsense</hi>, a comically formed name, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:4:6:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 4, 6, 21</bibl> Ritschl <hi rend="ital">N. cr</hi>.</sense></entryFree>
nugivendus: <entryFree id="n31380" type="main" key="nu_gi^vendus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nūgĭvendus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>nugae-vendo</etym>, <sense id="n31380.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a dealer in female finery</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ubi nugivendis res solutast omnibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:3:5:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 3, 5, 51</bibl></cit>: nugivendos Plautus dici voluit omnes eos qui aliquid mulieribus vendant. Nam omnia quibus matronae utuntur nugas voluit adpellari, Plautus in Aulularia, etc.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 144, 29 sq.</bibl> (But the best MSS. of Plautus read nugigerulis, Wagn. ad loc.)</sense></entryFree>
nugo: <entryFree id="n31381" type="main" key="nu_go"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nūgo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>nugae</etym>, <sense id="n31381.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a buffoon, trifler, worthless fellow</hi> (Appuleian): <cit><quote lang="la">nugo et corruptor,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 5, p. 172, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nugonem castigare,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
nugor: <entryFree id="n31382" type="main" key="nu_gor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nūgor</orth>, <itype>ātus, 1</itype>, <sense id="n31382.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. dep. n.</hi> [id.]. </sense><sense id="n31382.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To jest, trifle, play the fool, talk nonsense</hi> ( = <foreign lang="greek">fluarei=n</foreign>; <cit><quote lang="la">syn. ludo): Democritus non inscite nugatur, ut physicus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:13:30" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 13, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum aliquo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:1:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 1, 73</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 2, 1, 93</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n31382.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To trick, cajole, cheat</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nugatur sciens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:5:4:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 5, 4, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non mihi nugari potes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:3:4:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ep. 3, 4, 42</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:4:2:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Trin. 4, 2, 55</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
nugulae: <entryFree id="n31383" type="main" key="nu_gu^lae"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nūgŭlae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n31383.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">jokes, jests, trifles</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nugulas ineptas aggarrire,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 1, p. 1</bibl></cit> Grot. (dub.; Kopp: nugales ineptias, § 2).</sense></entryFree>
nuithones: <entryFree id="n31384" type="main" key="Nuitho_nes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Nuithōnes</orth>, <itype>um</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n31384.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Germanic people near the Elbe</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> G. 40</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
nullatenus: <entryFree id="n31385" type="main" key="nulla_te^nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nullā-tĕnus</orth> <etym>cf. eā-tenus, etc.</etym>, <sense id="n31385.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adv., in nowise, by no means</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">immortalitatis sedem nullatenus obtinebis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 2, § 135</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 8, 10, 12, § 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
nullibi: <entryFree id="n31386" type="main" key="nulli^bi"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nullĭbi</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>nullus-ibi</etym>, <sense id="n31386.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">nowhere</hi> (postclass.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:7:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 7, 1, 4</bibl> (dub.); cf. <foreign lang="greek">ou)damw=s</foreign>, nullibi, Gloss. Gr. Lat.</sense></entryFree>
nullificamen: <entryFree id="n31387" type="main" key="nulli^fi^ca_men"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nullĭfĭcāmen</orth>, <itype>ĭnis</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>nullifico</etym>, <sense id="n31387.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a despising, contempt</hi> (eccl. Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">nullificamen populi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Marc. 3, 7</bibl></cit>, and 17, from Psalm 21, 7.</sense></entryFree>
nullificatio: <entryFree id="n31388" type="main" key="nulli^fi^ca_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nullĭfĭcātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n31388.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a despising, contempt</hi> (eccl. Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">quae ignominia? quae nullificatio?</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Marc. 4, 14 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
nullifico: <entryFree id="n31389" type="main" key="nulli^fi^co"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nullĭfĭco</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>nullus-facio</etym>, <sense id="n31389.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to esteem lightly; to despise, contemn</hi> (eccl. Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Psych. 15</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Ep. 135</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
nullus: <entryFree id="n31390" type="main" key="nullus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nullus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, (<sense id="n31390.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">gen. m.</hi> nulli, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:4:7:99" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 4, 7, 99</bibl> Ritschl; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:3:5:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 3, 5, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,003:16:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Com. 16, 48</bibl>; <hi rend="ital">gen. f.</hi> nullae, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:3:1:207" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 3, 1, 207</bibl>; v. Ritschl ad h. l.; <hi rend="ital">dat. m.</hi> nullo, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 6, 13</bibl>; <hi rend="ital">dat. f.</hi> nullae, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:20:35" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 1, 20, 35</bibl>; and cf. Cato ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 694</bibl> P.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0013,001:ib. p. 678" default="NO"><author>Caecil.</author> ib. p. 678</bibl>; <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi> usu. nullīus, but nullĭus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:224" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 224</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:926" default="NO" valid="yes">926</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:1" default="NO" valid="yes">4, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:16:61" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 16, 61</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 1, 1, 14</bibl>), <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>ne-ullus</etym>, <hi rend="ital">not any, none, no.</hi> </sense><sense id="n31390.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen.: semita nulla. Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:20:40" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 20, 40</bibl> (Ann. v. 44 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">nulla videbatur aptior persona,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:1:4" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 1, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praecepta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:37:132" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 37, 132</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lites,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:26:118" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 26, 118</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">elephanto beluarum nulla prudentior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:35:97" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 1, 35, 97</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nullo pacto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:13:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mur. 13, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nullo certo ordine,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nullo discrimine,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:574" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 574</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliter sine populi jussu nulli earum rerum consuli jus est,</quote> <trans><tr>no consul has the right</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 29:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 29, 3</bibl></cit> (al. nullius): <cit><quote lang="la">nulla verius quam ubi ea cogitentur, hostium castra esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:53:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 53, 8</bibl></cit> Weissenb. (al. nullo): <cit><quote lang="la">nullum meum minimum dictum,</quote> <trans><tr>not the slightest word on my part</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:Fam. 1:9:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 1, 9, 21</bibl></cit>: nullusdum, <hi rend="ital">none as yet</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nulladum via,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 34</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:11" default="NO" valid="yes">29, 11</bibl>: nulli rei esse, <hi rend="ital">to be good for nothing</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nequam hominem dixerunt nulli rei, neque frugis bonae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:7:11:1" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 7, 11, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:13:30:3" default="NO">13, 30, 3</bibl>: nullius partis esse, <hi rend="ital">on neither side</hi>, Asin. Poll. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:10:31:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 10, 31, 2</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n31390.2" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">nullus</orth>, <itype>ī^us</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, for nemo, <hi rend="ital">no one, nobody</hi> (rare in Cic.): <hi rend="ital">Pi.</hi> Qui scire possum? <hi rend="ital">Chry.</hi> Nullus plus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:2:2:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 2, 2, 12</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sunt nulli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:37:132" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 37, 132</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut nullo egeat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:9:30" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 9, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ego quidem nulli vestrum deero,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:18:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 6, 18, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nulli ea placere sententia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:37:15:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 37, 15, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ab nullo repetere beneficia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 96:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 96, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aut nullo aut quam paucissimis praesentibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:ib. 109:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 109, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nullo poscente,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:128" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 128</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nullo hostium sustinente novum ac velut infernum aspectum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> G. 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">a nullo ante nos prodita,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:279" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 28, 69, § 279</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nullus denique tam abjectae condicionis fuit, cujus, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:35" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc nullus nisi arte assequi potest,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8</bibl></cit> prooem. § <cit><quote lang="la">16: nulli non parta libertas est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:5:8:14" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 5, 8, 14</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Fem.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">nulla</orth>, <itype>ī^us</itype>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:3:5:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 3, 5, 24</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:5:3:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 5, 3, 20</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:3:1" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 3, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3:24" default="NO">3, 24</bibl> (31), 41; Ov. R. <cb n="NUM" /> Am. 747; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:28:4:4" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 28, 4, 4</bibl>.—In <number>plur.</number> (rare): <cit><quote lang="la">nam, reor, nullis, si vita longior daretur, posset esse jucundior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:39:93" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 39, 93</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nullis adversus Romanos auxilia denegabant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0530,001:B. G. 8:45:1" default="NO"><author>Hirt.</author> B. G. 8, 45, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nullis defendentibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,002:4:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Them. 4, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nullis magis opus esse magistris vivendi quam plerisque qui, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 3, 15, 10</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 73:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 73, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 77 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 2, 20</bibl>: nulli duo, <hi rend="ital">not two, no two</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nullas duas in tot milibus hominum indiscretas effigies exsistere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 1, 1, § 8</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">ita fit, ut nulli duo concinant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 3, 1, 3, § 16</bibl></cit>: nullus alter, nullus unus, <hi rend="ital">no other, no one</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">scelestiorem nullum illuxere alterum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:2:3:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 2, 3, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nullā re unā magis oratorem commendari, quam, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:59:216" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 59, 216</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ut unum signum Byzantii ex maximo numero nullum haberent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,025:4:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Prov. Cons. 4, 7</bibl></cit>: nullus non, <hi rend="ital">every</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nullā rerum suarum non relictā inter hostes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nullo non se die extulit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 12:8" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 12, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:76" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 76</bibl>: non nullus; v. nonnullus.—In the <hi rend="ital">neutr.</hi>, <orth extent="full" lang="la">nul-lum</orth>, <itype>nullī^us</itype>, <hi rend="ital">nothing</hi> (rare for nihil): <cit><quote lang="la">Grai praeter laudem nullius avari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:324" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 324</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nullius acrior custos, quam libertatis fuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:1:26" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 1, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nullo sibi relicto praeter querelas, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 14, 1, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nullum magnum quod extremum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 4:3" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 4, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nullo magis studia, quam spe gaudent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:4:43" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 4, 43</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Abl.</hi> nullo, for nullā re (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">nullo magis exterritus est quam quod, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nullo magis Caesarem Augustum demeruit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 2:25:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 2, 25, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">deus nullo magis hominem separavit a ceteris animalibus quam dicendi facultate,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:16:12" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 16, 12</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:4:13" default="NO">2, 4, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:14:14" default="NO">5, 14, 14</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n31390.3" n="C" level="2"> (Mostly conversational.) Nullus, = non, <hi rend="ital">not, not at all</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">at tu edepol nullus creduas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:3:1:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 3, 1, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:4:4:91" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rud. 4, 4, 91</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">is nullus venit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:2:4:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> As. 2, 4, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">memini, tametsi nullus moneas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:2:1:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 2, 1, 10</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:1:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Hec. 1, 2, 3</bibl> (cf. II. C. infra): <cit><quote lang="la">Philotimus non modo nullus venit, sed, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:11:24:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 11, 24, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Sextus ab armis nullus discedit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 15, 22</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 15, 29, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nolite arbitrari, me, cum a vobis discessero, nusquam aut nullum fore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:22:79" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Sen. 22, 79</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hereditas quae nulla debetur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:17:section=44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 17, § 44</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:44:128" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 44, 128</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n31390.4" n="II" level="1"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n31390.5" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Of no account</hi> or <hi rend="ital">moment, insignificant, trifling</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">igitur tu Titias et Appuleias leges nullas putas?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:6:14" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 2, 6, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nullum vero id quidem argumentum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:5:13" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 2, 5, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sed vides nullam esse rem publicam, nullum senatum, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:3:4:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 3, 4, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,019:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Phoc. 1, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in his tam parvis atque tam nullis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 2, 2, § 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alia fuere, quae illos magnos fecere, quae nobis nulla sunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 52:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 52, 21</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n31390.6" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Null, of no value</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut sine his studiis vitam nullam esse ducamus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:5:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 5, 20</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:1:589" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 1, 589</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n31390.7" n="C" level="2"> Nullus sum, <hi rend="ital">I am lost, undone, it's all over with me</hi> (ante-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">si id factum est, ecce me nullum senem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:2:4:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 2, 4, 26</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:2:1:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Most. 2, 1, 41</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:1:2:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Merc. 1, 2, 52</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">104</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nullu's, Geta, nisi, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:1:4:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 1, 4, 1</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:3:4:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> And. 3, 4, 20</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
num: <entryFree id="n31391" type="main" key="num"><orth extent="full" lang="la">num</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>an <hi rend="ital">acc. m.</hi>, of which nam is the <hi rend="ital">acc. f.</hi></etym>, an interrog. particle, usually implying that a negative answer is expected. <sense id="n31391.0" n="I" level="1"> In a direct interrogation (no corresp. term in English). </sense><sense id="n31391.1" n="(a)" level="5"> Num esse amicum suspicari visus est? <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:1:2:102" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. 1, 2, 102</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:2:2:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 2, 2, 29</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">num igitur tot ducum naufragium sustulit artem gubernandi? aut num imperatorum scientia nihil est, quia, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:14:24" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 14, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">num exspectatis, dum L. Metellus testimonium dicat?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:53:section=122" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 53, § 122</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:11:17" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 11, 17</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">num barbarorum Romulus rex fuit?</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 37, 58</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n31391.2" n="(b)" level="5"> Followed by <hi rend="ital">an</hi>, contmuing the inquiry: <cit><quote lang="la">num furis, an prudens ludis me obscura canendo?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:5:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 5, 58</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">num iratum timemus Jovem? ... an ne turpiter faceret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:28:102" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 3, 28, 102</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n31391.3" n="(g)" level="5"> Esp., with <hi rend="ital">quis, quando</hi> ( = aliquis, aliquando): <cit><quote lang="la">numquis hic est? nemo est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:3:5:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 3, 5, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">num quae trepidatio? num qui tumultus?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,034:7:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Deiot. 7, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">num quando perditis civibus vexillum defuturum putatis?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:5:11:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 5, 11, 29</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n31391.4" n="(d)" level="5"> Num quid (also numquid) vis? <hi rend="ital">do you wish any thing further? is there any thing else?</hi> a very common form of leave-taking, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:3:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 3, 44</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">46</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 3, 15</bibl> et saep.; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:2:3:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 2, 3, 49</bibl> Don.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:6:3:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 6, 3, 6</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 2, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:34:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 6, 34, 7</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">for which, also: numquid me vis?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:1:1:119" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cist. 1, 1, 119</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:6:92" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 2, 6, 92</bibl>; and elliptically:<cb n="NUME" />  numquid me? <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:3:6:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 3, 6, 6</bibl>. —（<foreign lang="greek">e</foreign>) <hi rend="ital">Numquid</hi> is also used adverbially; v. numquid.—（<foreign lang="greek">z</foreign>) Joined to <hi rend="ital">nam</hi> and <hi rend="ital">ne</hi> numnam, numne, in anxious and surprised inquiry: <cit><quote lang="la">eho numnam hic relictus custos?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:2:2:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 2, 2, 55</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">numne vis me ire ad cenam?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:2:6:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 2, 6, 65</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">deum ipsum numne vidisti?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:31:88" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 1, 31, 88</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:11:36" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 11, 36</bibl> (so B. and K., Halm. But Ritschl, Opusc. 2, 248, denies the Latinity of the form numne; cf. Hand, Turs. 4, 79; and, contra, R<bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> Lat. Part. p. 13</bibl>).—</sense><sense id="n31391.5" n="II" level="1"> In an indirect interrogation, <hi rend="ital">whether</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quaero, num aliter ac nunc eveniunt, evenirent?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,054:3:6" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fat. 3, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">videte, num dubitandum vobis sit, omni studio ad id bellum incumbere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,009:7:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Imp. Pomp. 7, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jusserunt speculari, num sollicitati animi sociorum essent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 42, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exsistit hoc loco quaedam quaestio subdifficilis: num quando amici novi, digni amicitiā veteribus sint anteponendi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:19:67" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 19, 67</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">num quando,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:5:11:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 5, 11, 29</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,023:6:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Vatin. 6, 17</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">num quis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:13:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 13, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:38:105" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clu. 38, 105</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:3:7" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 3, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">videamus ergo, num expositio haec longior demum esse debeat,</quote> <trans><tr>whether this explanation should not be a little longer still</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:2:79" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 4, 2, 79</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">consultus, num et ... vellet,</quote> <trans><tr>whether he did not also wish</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:18" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 18</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
numa: <entryFree id="n31392" type="main" key="Nu^ma"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Nŭma</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n31392.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Roman proper name</hi>. </sense><sense id="n31392.1" n="I" level="1"> Numa Pompilius, <hi rend="ital">the second king of Rome</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:18 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 18 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:13:25" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 2, 13, 25</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 18, 33</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:2:69" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 2, 69</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:3:305" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 305</bibl> sqq.; Juv 3, 16; 8, 156 al.—</sense><sense id="n31392.2" n="II" level="1"> Numa Marcius (Martius), <hi rend="ital">a Sabine, a friend of the former and high-priest</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 20</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:6:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 6, 11</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
numana: <entryFree id="n31393" type="main" key="Nu^ma_na"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Nŭmāna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n31393.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a sea-coast town in Picenum</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Umana</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:111" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 13, 18, § 111</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:8:433" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 8, 433</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:4:6" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 4, 6</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n31393.1" n="II" level="1"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Nŭ-mānas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj., Numanian</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Grut.</author> 446, 1</bibl> and 2; Inscr. Don. cl. 5, n. 1.</sense></entryFree>
numantia: <entryFree id="n31394" type="main" key="Nu^manti^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Nŭmantĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n31394.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a city in</hi> Hispania Tarraconensis, <hi rend="ital">captured and destroyed by Scipio Africanus the Younger</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Garray</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:Ep. 47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> Ep. 47</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:54" default="NO" valid="yes">54</bibl> sq.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:11:35" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 11, 35</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:2:18" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 2, 18</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Eutr.</author> 4, 17</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:6:4" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 6, 4</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n31394.1" n="II" level="1"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Nŭmantīnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj., Numantine</hi>. De Numantino foedere, <hi rend="ital">made by</hi> C. Mancinus, <hi rend="ital">but not ratified by the Senate</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:3:18:28" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 3, 18, 28</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:17:54" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 2, 17, 54</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Nŭ-mantīnus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a surname given to Scipio Africanus, as the taker of Numantia;</hi> cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:1:596" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 1, 596</bibl>.—In <number>plur.</number> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Nŭ-mantīni</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the Numantines</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:8:11" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 8, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:Ep. 59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> Ep. 59</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
numarius: <entryFree id="n31395" type="main" key="nu_ma_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nūmārĭus</orth>, v. nummarius.</entryFree>
numanus: <entryFree id="n31396" type="main" key="Nu^ma_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Nŭmānus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n31396.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Rutulian, surnamed</hi> Remulus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:592" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 592</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
numatio: <entryFree id="n31397" type="main" key="nu_ma_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nūmātĭo</orth>, v. nummatio.</entryFree>
numatus: <entryFree id="n31398" type="main" key="nu_ma_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nūmātus</orth>, v. nummatus.</entryFree>
numella: <entryFree id="n31399" type="main" key="numella"><orth extent="full" lang="la">numella</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n31399.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of shackle</hi> or <hi rend="ital">fetter</hi>, for crimmals, slaves, and cattle: numella genus vinculi, quo quadrupedes deligantur, solet autem ea fieri nervo, aut corio crudo bovis, ut plurimum, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=173" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 173</bibl> Müll.; <cit><quote lang="la">less trust worthy is the explanation of Nonius: numellae machinae genus ligneum ad discruciandos noxios paratum, quo et collum et pedes immittunt. Plautus Asinaria (3, 2, 5): nervos, catenas, carcerem, numellas, pedicas, boias,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 144, 25 sq.</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:7:8:6" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 7, 8, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ubi potest etiam numella fabricari, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:19:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 6, 19, 2</bibl></cit> (al. numelli; al. numellae).</sense></entryFree>
numellus: <entryFree id="n31400" type="main" key="numellus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">numellus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, v numella <sense id="n31400.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
numen: <entryFree id="n31401" type="main" key="nu_men"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nūmen</orth>, <itype>ĭnis</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>for nuimen, root nu-; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">neu/w</foreign>, nod; Lat. nuo in re-nuo, etc</etym>, prop., <sense id="n31401.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a nodding with the head, a nod</hi>: numen quasi nutus dei ac potestas dicitur, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=173" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 173</bibl> Müll.—Hence, trop., <hi rend="ital">a nod</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">command, will</hi>. * </sense><sense id="n31401.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">ad numen mentis momenque moveri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:144" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 144</bibl></cit> (but <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:632" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 632</bibl>, and 4, 179, the correct reading is momine, v. Lachm.).—</sense><sense id="n31401.2" n="II" level="1"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">the divine will, the will</hi> or <hi rend="ital">power of the gods, divine sway</hi> (the class. signif. of the word): <cit><quote lang="la">numen dicunt esse imperium, dictum ab nutu: numina sunt, quojus imperium maximum esse videatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 7:section=85" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 7, § 85</bibl></cit> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">deo, cujus numini parent omnia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:53:120" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 53, 120</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">multa saepe prodigia vim ejus (Cereris) numenque declarant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:49:section=107" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 49, § 107</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">di inmortales suo numine atque auxilio sua templa atque urbis tecta defendunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:2:13:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 2, 13, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">numen interdictumque deorum immortalium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:21:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pis. 21, 48</bibl></cit>: nox et Diana, Nunc, nunc adeste, nunc in hostiles domos Iram atque numen vertite, Hor. Epod. <pb n="1225" /> <cb n="NUME" /> 5, 54.—To Fortune: <cit><quote lang="la">nullum numen abest, si sit prudentia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:10:365" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 10, 365</bibl></cit>.—Hence, transf., of the <hi rend="ital">will, might, authority</hi> of powerful persons: <cit><quote lang="la">flectere tenta Caesareum numen, numine, Bacche, tuo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:5:3:45" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 5, 3, 45</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:4:13:24" default="NO"><author>id.</author> P. 4, 13, 24</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">annuite, Patres Conscripti, nutum numenque vestrum invictum Campanis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 30</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">quanta potestas, quanta majestas, quantum denique numen, sit historiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:9:27:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 9, 27, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n31401.3" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Godhead, divinity, deity, divine majesty</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">numina Palladis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:543" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 543</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">per Dianae numina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:17:3" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 17, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">venerantur numina nymphae, Mygdonidesque nurus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">audis ... positas ut glaciet nives Puro numine Juppiter,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:10:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 10, 8</bibl></cit>.—Concr., <hi rend="ital">a divinity, deity, a god, goddess</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">caeleste numen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:21:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 21, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:2:4:4" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 2, 4, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:5:1:3" default="NO">5, 1, 3</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 19, 1, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">summum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 7:30:4" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 7, 30, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 15, 8, 9</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">17, 7, 3 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">templa et effigies numinum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 10</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">1, 73</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 71</bibl>; 15, 45; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:22" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 22</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nos magna precati Numina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:634" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 634</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si quem Numina laeva sinunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 4, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">promissaque numine firmat,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>by calling a god to witness, by an oath</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:10:430" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 10, 430</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vadimus immixti haud numine nostro,</quote> <trans><tr>the divinity not with us</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:396" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 396</bibl></cit>, cf. sqq.: <cit><quote lang="la">hospes numinis Idaei,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:3:138" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 3, 138</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in contumeliam numinum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:11" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Titus numinibus aequatus est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:ib. 35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">numinis loco habere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> G. 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">numina quibus sacrificabat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:5:10" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 5, 10</bibl></cit>, ext. 2: <cit><quote lang="la">ea numina, i. e. Apollo and Diana,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 61</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 7, 12, § 25</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:132" default="NO" valid="yes">18, 13, 35, § 132</bibl>.—Of the manes of a beloved person: <cit><quote lang="la">juro per illos manes, numina mei doloris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6</bibl></cit> prooem. § 10 Spald.</sense></entryFree>
numerabilis: <entryFree id="n31402" type="main" key="nu^me^ra_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nŭmĕrābĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>numerus</etym>, <sense id="n31402.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that can be numbered</hi> or <hi rend="ital">counted, numerable</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">calculus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:588" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 5, 588</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">populus utpote parvus,</quote> <trans><tr>easily numbered</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:206" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 206</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">nŭmĕrābĭlĭ-ter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, Ps.-<bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Spec. 20" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Spec. 20</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
numeralis: <entryFree id="n31403" type="main" key="nu^me^ra_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nŭmĕrālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n31403.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to number, numeral</hi>: numerale nomen, in gram., <hi rend="ital">a numeral</hi>, Prisc. pp. 579 and 581 P.</sense></entryFree>
numeraria: <entryFree id="n31404" type="main" key="Nu^me^ra_ri^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Nŭmĕrārĭa</orth> <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n31404.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">Arithmetic</hi>, personified, <hi rend="ital">the genius of number</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 7, § 802</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
numerarius: <entryFree id="n31405" type="main" key="nu^me^ra_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nŭmĕrārĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>. <sense id="n31405.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">An arithmetician</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:in Psa. 146:section=11" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> in Psa. 146, § 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Lib. Arb. 2:11" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lib. Arb. 2, 11</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n31405.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">An accountant, keeper of accounts</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">numerarii vocati sunt, qui publicum nummum aerariis inferunt,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 9, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 19, 9</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 1, 11</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 7</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 12</bibl>, tit. 50: De numerariis, actuariis, etc.</sense></entryFree>
numeratio: <entryFree id="n31406" type="main" key="nu^me^ra_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nŭmĕrātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>numero</etym>, <sense id="n31406.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a counting out, paying, payment</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">ubi numeratio exigetur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:1:8:13" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 1, 8, 13</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:1:24" default="NO">11, 1, 24</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ab isto fiet numeratio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 18:4" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 18, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:26:8" default="NO">26, 8</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">numeratio pecuniae rei, non litterarum, facit obligationem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:Inst. 3:131 sq" default="NO"><author>Gai.</author> Inst. 3, 131 sq.</bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
numerator: <entryFree id="n31407" type="main" key="nu^me^ra_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nŭmĕrātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n31407.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a counter, numberer</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">numerator siderum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Conf. 5:4" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Conf. 5, 4</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
numeratus: <entryFree id="n31408" type="main" key="nu^me^ra_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nŭmĕrātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos>, from numero.</entryFree>
numeria: <entryFree id="n31409" type="main" key="Nu^me^ri^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Nŭmĕrĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>numerus</etym>. <sense id="n31409.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The goddess of counting</hi>: Numeria, quae numerare doceat, Aug. Civ. Dei, 4, 11.—</sense><sense id="n31409.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The goddess of speedy birth</hi>, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 352, 31 sq.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
numerius: <entryFree id="n31410" type="hapax" key="nu^me^ri^us1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nŭmĕrĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n31410.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to number, numeral</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aestimatio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1672,001:Res Gest. Alex. M. 3:58" default="NO"><author>Jul. Val.</author> Res Gest. Alex. M. 3, 58</bibl></cit> Mai.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n31411" type="main" key="Nu^me^ri^us2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Nŭmĕrĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, abbrev. N., <sense id="n31411.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Roman</hi> praenomen: qui celeriter erant nati, fere Numerios praenominabant, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 352, 29</bibl>. Concerning the introduction of this praenomen into the Fabian gens, v. Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=170" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 170</bibl> Müll. So, Numerius (abbrev. N.) Fabius Buteo, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:41:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 41, 28</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">N. Fabius Vibulanus,</quote> <trans><tr>a consul</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 4, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Numerius, Numestius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:2:22:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 2, 22, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">24, 1, 5</bibl>.—（<hi rend="ital">Fem.</hi> Numeria was not in use, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 9:section=55" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 9, § 55</bibl> Müll.)</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n31412" type="main" key="Nu^me^ri^us3" n="3"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Nŭmĕrĭus</orth>, <itype>a</itype>, <sense id="n31412.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the name of a Roman</hi> gens. So, Q. Numerius Rufus, <hi rend="ital">a tribune of the people</hi>, A. U. C. 697, <hi rend="ital">an enemy of Cicero</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:33:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 33, 72</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">38, 82</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">43, 94</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n31412.1" n="II" level="1"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Nŭmĕrĭānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj., of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to a Numerius, Numerian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">raudusculum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:7:2:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 7, 2, 7</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
numero: <entryFree id="n31413" type="main" key="nu^me^ro1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nŭmĕro</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>numerus</etym>, <sense id="n31413.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to count, reckon, number</hi> (syn. recenseo). </sense><sense id="n31413.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">si singulos numeremus in singulas (civitates),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:3:4:7" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 3, 4, 7</bibl></cit>: ea, si ex reis numeres,<cb n="NUME" />  innumerabilia sunt; <cit><quote lang="la">si ex rebus, modica,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:32:137" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 32, 137</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">numerare per digitos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:3:123" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 3, 123</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">votaque pro dominā vix numeranda facit,</quote> <trans><tr>that can hardly be counted, almost innumerable</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:4:4:12" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 4, 4, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amores divūm numerare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:347" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 347</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pecus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:3:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> E. 3, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">viros,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:7:51" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 7, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">milites,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:3:285" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 3, 285</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aureos voce digitisque numerare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:21" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">numera sestertia qumque omnibus in rebus—numerentur deinde labores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:9:41 sq" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 9, 41 sq.</bibl></cit>: numera senatum, said to the consul by a senator opposed to a bill, and who considered that there was not a quorum of senators present; like the phrase <hi rend="ital">to demand a call of the House</hi>, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=170" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 170</bibl> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">ne quid ad senatum consule! aut numera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:5:4:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 5, 4, 2</bibl></cit> Orell. <hi rend="ital">N. cr.</hi>: posset rem impedire, si, ut numerarentur, postularet, Cael. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:8:11:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 8, 11, 2</bibl> (cf. also <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:76" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 76</bibl>).—In law, of days granted for deliberation, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">continui dies numerantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:Inst. 2:173" default="NO"><author>Gai.</author> Inst. 2, 173</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">tempus numeratur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:ib. 2:172" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 172</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n31413.2" n="B" level="2"> In partic., of money, <hi rend="ital">to count out, pay out, pay</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">stipendium numerare militibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:36:88" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Pis. 36, 88</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pecuniam de suo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:16:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 16, 16</bibl></cit>, A, § 5; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fl. 19, 44</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,015:3:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Ep. 3, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">talenta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:4" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid usurae nomine,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alicui pensionem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 29, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">magnam pecuniam numerare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 3</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:Perioch. 4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. Perioch. 4</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n31413.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n31413.4" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To reckon, number</hi> as one's own, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to have, possess</hi> (rare): <cit><quote lang="la">donec eris felix, multos numerabis amicos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:1:9:5" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 1, 9, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">triumphos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:169" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 169</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tum licet a Pico numeres genus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:8:131" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 8, 131</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">veterani tricena aut supra stipendia numerantes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 35</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n31413.5" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To account, reckon, esteem, consider</hi> as any thing.—With two <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Sulpicium accusatorem suum numerabat, non competitorem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:24:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mur. 24, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hos non numero consulares,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:12:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 12, 2, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">stellas singulas numeras deos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:16:40" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 3, 16, 40</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:13:4:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 13, 4, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae isti bona numerant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:15:44" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 5, 15, 44</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">sapientes cives, qualem me et esse et numerari volo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:1:9:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 1, 9, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">is prope alter Timarchides numerabatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:70:section=169" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 70, § 169</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">numerare aliquid beneficii loco,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:2:6:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 2, 6, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mors in beneficii parte (al. partem) numeretur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:11:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 11, 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">voluptatem nullo loco,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:28:90" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 2, 28, 90</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid in bonis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:5:12" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 2, 5, 12</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:9:31" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 1, 9, 31</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid in actis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:1:8:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 1, 8, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Herennius in mediocribus oratoribus numeratus est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:45:166" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 45, 166</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem in septem (sc. sapientibus),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,047:1:1:8" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Par. 1, 1, 8</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">inter</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ipse honestissimus inter suos numerabatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:6:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 6, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem inter decemviros,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:35:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 35, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae jactura inter damna numerata non est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:2:5:11" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 2, 5, 11</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 2, 12, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:1:6:11" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 1, 6, 11</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">numerabatur inter ostenta deminutus magistratuum numerus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:12:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 12, 64</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 29</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:4:15:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 4, 15, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:3:6" default="NO" valid="yes">5, 3, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:7:18 al" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 3, 7, 18 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">inter amicos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:4:9:35" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 4, 9, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem post aliquem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 77</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Thucydides numquam est numeratus orator,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:45:166" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 45, 166</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">nŭmĕrātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">P. a., counted out, paid down</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">argentum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:4:3:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 4, 3, 57</bibl></cit>; hence, in <hi rend="ital">ready money, in cash</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">hic sunt quinque argenti lectae numeratae minae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:4:7:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ps. 4, 7, 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">duo talenta argenti numerata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:1:3:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> As. 1, 3, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(vendidit aedis) praesentariis Argenti minis numeratis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:4:3:75" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Trin. 4, 3, 75</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dos uxoris numerata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:4:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Caecin. 4, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pecunia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fl. 32, 80</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">nŭmĕrātum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">ready money, cash</hi>: quae tua est suavitas nolles a me hoc tempore aestimationem accipere; <cit><quote lang="la">nam numeratum, si cuperem, non haberem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:20:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 5, 20, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut numerato malim quam aestimatione,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Att 12, 25, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:36:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 36, 21 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 2, 166</bibl>: in numerato, <hi rend="ital">in ready money</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">testamento edixit relinquere in numerato HS DC,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:135" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 33, 10, 47, § 135</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">proferre in numerato,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 33, 3, 17, § 55</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:Inst. 2:196" default="NO"><author>Gai.</author> Inst. 2, 196</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:3:141" default="NO">3, 141</bibl>.— Hence, </sense><sense id="n31413.6" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: in numerato habere, <hi rend="ital">to have in readiness</hi> (a phrase of Augustus): <cit><quote lang="la">dictum est de actore facile dicente ex tempore, ingenium eum in numerato habere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:3:111" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 3, 111</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Contr. 2:13" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Contr. 2, 13 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n31414" type="main" key="nu^me^ro_2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nŭmĕrō</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. numerus <sense id="n31414.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
numerose: <entryFree id="n31415" type="main" key="nu^me^ro_se_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nŭmĕrōsē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. numerosus <sense id="n31415.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
numerositas: <entryFree id="n31416" type="main" key="nu^me^ro_si^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nŭmĕrōsĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>numerosus</etym>. <sense id="n31416.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A great number, multitude</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">numerositas innumera,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 5, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">filiarum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Monog. 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">curialium, Cod. Th. 12, 5, 3: Scriptorum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Carm. 23, 150</bibl></cit>.— <cb n="NUME" /> </sense><sense id="n31416.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Rhythm, harmony</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Doctr. Christ. 4:20" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Doctr. Christ. 4, 20</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:ib. 55:109" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 55, 109</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
numerositer: <entryFree id="n31417" type="main" key="nu^me^ro_si^ter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nŭmĕrōsĭter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. numerosus <sense id="n31417.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
numerosus: <entryFree id="n31418" type="main" key="nu^me^ro_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nŭmĕrōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>numerus</etym>. <sense id="n31418.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Consisting of a great number, numerous, manifold</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">numerosa pubes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:5:40" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 5, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">partus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:233" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 40, 95, § 233</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">numerosā caede futuram ultus mortem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:10:172" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 10, 172</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">herba radice magnā, numerosa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:167" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 21, 24, 95, § 167</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">civitas, numerosissima provinciae totius,</quote> <trans><tr>the most populous</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> Agr. 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">numerosissima florum varietas, Plin, 35, 11, 40, § 125: numerosissima suffragia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 7, 28, 29, § 101</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">classis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:7:151" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 7, 151</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">excelsae turris tabulata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:10:106" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 10, 106</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">copiosa et numerosa domus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:4:15:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 4, 15, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">debitor arcae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:3:31:3" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 3, 31, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:4:1:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 4, 1, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pullus equinus lato et musculorum toris numeroso pectore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:29:2" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 6, 29, 2</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">feminibus torosis ac numerosis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:ib" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pictor diligentior quam numerosior,</quote> <trans><tr>who is more accurate than prolific</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:130" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 11, 40, § 130</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gymnasium longe numerosius laxiusque,</quote> <trans><tr>more extensive, with more wings</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:10:48:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 10, 48, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">numerosa tabula,</quote> <trans><tr>a painting with many figures</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:138" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 11, 40, § 138</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">numerosum opus,</quote> <trans><tr>of various contents</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:10:10" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 10, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sermo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:6:64" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 8, 6, 64</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pectus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:9:2" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 6, 9, 2</bibl></cit>: numerosa res means <hi rend="ital">variously accomplished, having a knowledge of many things</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">RES NVMEROSA FVI,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Grut.</author> 655, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n31418.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Full of rhythm</hi> or <hi rend="ital">harmony, according to rhythm, measured, rhythmical, harmonious, melodious</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">numerosaque bracchia ducit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:2:4:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 2, 4, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">numerosos ponere gressus (al. gestus),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:4:2:33" default="NO"><author>id.</author> P. 4, 2, 33</bibl></cit>: numerosa oratio, <hi rend="ital">rhythmical, melodious</hi>: si numerosum est id in omnibus sonis atque vocibus, quod habet quasdam impressiones et quod metiri possumus intervallis aequalibus; <cit><quote lang="la">recte, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:48:185" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 48, 185</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">apta et numerosa oratio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:chapter=50" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 50</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">52</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">numerosus Horatius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:4:10:49" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 4, 10, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Myron numerosior in arte, quam Polycletus,</quote> <trans><tr>more harmonious</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 34, 8, 19, § 58</bibl></cit>. —Hence, <pos>adv.</pos>, in two forms. </sense><sense id="n31418.2" n="1" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">nŭmĕ-rōsē</orth>. </sense><sense id="n31418.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Numerously, multifariously</hi> (not in Cic.): <cit><quote lang="la">numerosius onerare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:4:21:2" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 4, 21, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">numerosius dividere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 33, 3, 19, § 61</bibl></cit>. —<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">familias numerosissime comparant,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> de Deo Socr. p. 54, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sententias versare quam numerosissime,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:5:9" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 5, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">numerose loqui,</quote> <trans><tr>to speak in the plural number</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Prax. 12</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n31418.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Rhythmically, harmoniously, melodiously</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">fidiculae numerose sonantes?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:8:22" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 8, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(sententia) cadit numerose,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:8:34" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 8, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">numerose dicere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:66:221" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 66, 221</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">65, 219</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">62, 210</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">numerosius dicere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:7:3:53" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 7, 3, 53</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n31418.5" n="2" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">nŭmĕrōsĭter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">rhythmically, harmoniously, melodiously</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 2, 73</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
